story:
(props to my 12-year-old daughter for filming and editing the video!)

A Book About Mistakes

Everyone makes mistakes. And I've made some huge ones. I've learned how to evaluate and frame my mistakes so I can learn from them. Through working with lots of people and hundreds and hundreds of hours of study (even a dissertation) I've found 7 mistakes that shut down your life. We all make these 7. Few go on to learn from them.

10,000 hours of practice to be awesome at something means nothing if you don't learn how to evaluate whether or not your practice is effective. You'll never be as mistake free as you want but you can avoid staying stuck.

I've broken down my daily practice so deep I've been able to teach others how to become their own sage. The best wisdom you have is waiting to be unblocked. You don't have to search for that right answer or that right guru. You can become your own.

I'm Kinda OCD About Learning

Getting stuck sucks. Not knowing you're stuck is worse. You're blind to reality. 

I hate being stuck. 

16 years ago as a naive 21-year-old I was thrust into the responsibility that comes with public leadership. I read everything I could get my hands on regarding leadership for 10 years. I geeked out on all the models. Pretty soon I learned you could make up a concept and slap a venn diagram together or chart it out on an x-y axis and it sounded smart. 

The problem was that it addressed an external reality. In all those years of reading leadership books and going to the conferences and falling for the hype I finally admitted...

I couldn't learn enough about managing my external world that actually fixed the internal world that was driving me to burn bridges and lead out of insecurity. (Just ask the profs I cried in front of at my dissertation defense.)

Thankfully I started capturing insights about how a leader's internal world drives their external world. I've been capturing those insights for 12 years. I obsessively started capturing everything on a spreadsheet that represented my most vulnerable learnings and what was driving my decision making in key wins and losses.

I’ve had to borrow money to cover payroll and I’ve seen wealth created 1000X my investment. I know the highs and lows and complexities of leading organizations in transition and turnarounds. I know startups. I’ve coached leaders of all types. From a full family life to leading multiple non-profit organizations, both large and small, I have learned how to order my internal world so I can lead my external world.

This Book Is For People That Are Done With Getting In Their Own Way

This book isn't for everybody. If you're not willing to use some introspective muscles that might have atrophied then you'll probably want to pass. This isn't the only resource on this idea. But I know my journey. And I know I have found 7 organizing realities that keep my thinking in tip-top shape ready for each day to avoid 7 critical mistakes. I can teach you how to order your internal world. Awareness of these 7 mistakes are the recipe that keep me from staying stuck. They can instantly help you reframe every moment to stay resilient. Most quit at some point right before things turn awesome. I want to teach you how to not quit. (If you want to hear some of this in a podcast search "SightShift podcast" on the inter webs. Give the first episode 7 minutes.)

Recently, my work with helping leaders figure out who they are apart from what they do has been growing. (If you need the professional vibe check out chrismcalister.com) And now is the time to create this book and articulate what it means to lead and live from a secure core. 

I've had this brewing in me for a while. Remember the spreadsheet? 

So before the fresh extraction of these lessons turns bitter, let's get this message out. That sounded more like making coffee than learning. 

I need your help. Some of you need mine. And together we'll get this done to help others that will come after us. 

Let's help people learn from these 7 mistakes: 

  • I am blindly focused on the goal and don't enjoy the process to get there.
  • I make myself responsible for the behavior of others.
  • I insecurely try to be accepted by others.
  • I repeat the same self-sabotaging choices.
  • I don't live from a secure core of who I really am.
  • I am unknowingly guided and driven by fear.
  • I am internally distracted and miss what is really happening around me. 
People Are Polite

I'm not a great writer. How do I know? Plenty of people have let me know they get more out of hearing me speak or from coaching sessions than my writing. Uh. Oh.
Usually they say something like, "I'm glad I heard you speak first." I blogged for 6 years and nothing happened. Then I wised up. I've got solid help around me to make this the best reading experience possible. But...I also wanted to shape the experience of the book around my strengths.

I'm better at having a conversation with you. So the format of this book will be about taking a ride with you, having a conversation, and helping these 7 realities permeate all of who you are.

Points to me for using the word permeate. Maybe I can write? :-) 

It's easier to talk about really deep stuff when you're on a car ride. You're both looking off to the horizon and avoiding eye contact. 

Learning these 7 mistakes deeply will help you:

  • Become confident in the most difficult of relationships.

  • Get clarity on your mission that transcends your job.

  • Learn to process your day to close open loops that create anxiety.

  • Use your problems to build momentum in every category of your life.

  • Learn practices and strategies to stay focused and motivated.

  • Learn to how to be happy with yourself regardless of circumstances.

  • Develop awareness to build great teams for life and work.

  • Become a brilliant leader that can discern what each moment needs.

  • Learn the sequence of executing a big vision in your life.

  • Develop the skill of setting goals that are true to who you are.

  • How to invest who you are to grow your most important relationships.

And I promise to keep my eyes on the road. I'm an expressive talker. And my wife made sure I will NEVER AGAIN have my daughter record me while driving and talking to the camera. (See honey, I can learn!)

This Ain't My First Rodeo

This will be my second but most ambitious project to date. Some of you helped us cross the finish line over 18 months ago. I know what it takes to get this done. 
The deets:

  • I've built most of the rewards around being able to connect with you and have you shape the flow of the book and/or connect with me personally. We'll do this together.
  • The funds will be used to fund the writing process, pay the very expensive and price-haggling-mean-12-year-old-girl otherwise known as my daughter for the video work, invest in a quality design and layout, and purchase a grain of sand from Tony Robbin's private island.
  • The timeline: I will dedicate March/April to delivering on the rewards that allow us to connect. I plan to finish the book by the end of June. July will be dedicated to the design of the book and planning the launch. Hopefully we'll launch the book in August. Depending on what reward you sign up for, when the book is done, you will get your copy before we make it available to others.

So Will You Take A Ride With Me? Grab A Perk.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Use the share tools and let others now about this project.
  • Or even better, don't just throw some noise out there. Email someone the link to this project. If you've been impacted in some way by the work I've done up to this point then share this page with them as a way to get involved.

Wait. 2 more updates real quick:

1. These Sweet Perks (and a video series stretch goal?)

I want us to connect in some way through this. Grab a perk that allows us to do that. And if we exceed the goal by double I'm aiming to get a video course done where I'll teach through the 7 lessons. Everyone a part of the campaign will get access to the videos if we double the goal. 

2. Pay With Paypal

I've got a special bonus I'll email everyone who pays with paypal. I've got a 12 week email coaching program. I'll send you one email per week for 12 weeks. This starts when the campaign ends. I've seen massive results from the lessons and the change that happens when people work on the exercises. Some of the exercises will be in the book so you'll get advance access. It's like a boot camp for life change.

You with me?

I’m dying (dramatic? I have 3 pre-teen daughters. You know jack about dramatic.) to create my next book.

It will be unique content that I have been ruminating on for over a freaking decade.

It will be how to approach each day with brilliance, ambition, heart, joy, fire, hope, peace, and relaxation. 

Paradoxical? Yeah I know. Grab a perk. Hang on for the ride.

Peace!

Chris

story:
OddBike's USA Tour

My name is Jason Cormier, and I am the Editor of Odd-Bike.com, an independent website that specializes in the profiling of rare and unusual motorcycles.

I've long been a passionate motorcycle rider and freelance writer, and OddBike is the culmination of my passions and skills as well as an archive of some of the rarest, most unusual and fascinating two-wheeled machines that have ever put rubber to pavement. As I am a historian by education and a mechanic by hobby, I pride myself in writing detailed profiles that detail the historical context, cultural impact, and technical information of these interesting motorcycles. 

I maintain OddBike in my spare time as a non-profit website that is free of sponsorship or advertising. I believe this allows me to write without hindrance and without anyone to answer to, and my articles reflect this freedom. However for certain (more ambitious) projects I require funding from you, my readers and supporters.

This campaign is, at its basis, to fund my journey by motorcycle this October 2013 from my home in Montreal, Quebec, Canada to visit several key locations in the Southern United States, for the purpose of collecting information, interviews and photographs to use in at least three upcoming OddBike features. These features will include:

  • A visit to the Motus Motorcycles factory in Birmingham, Alabama.
  • A stop at the Barber Motorsports Museum in Birmingham to cover the 9th annual Barber Vintage Festival.
  • A visit to Bienville Studios in New Orleans, Louisiana to interview motorcycle designer JT Nesbitt about his upcoming Bienville Legacy project.
  • NEW A visit to the Wheels Through Time Museum in Waynesville (Maggie) North Carolina to profile and photograph the 1917 Traub V-Twin.

This journey will be undertaken in mid-October 2013 and will take approximately two weeks, round trip. I will be using my personal 1997 Ducati 916 to perform the journey. It may not be the most appropriate touring rig, but it has served me well over the years and I wouldn't do it on anything else.

I will maintain a travelogue of the journey on the OddBike Facebook page, with the intent of eventually writing a detailed ride report.

This journey is more than a simple trip across the USA, it's an opportunity for OddBike to grow by showcasing several unique independent motorcycle projects that have been under-represented in the traditional motorcycle media. I aim to correct that with my own blend of intelligent technical analysis and insight into motorcycle history and design. And I feel the best way to do this is to meet with the individuals in person and examine their projects first-hand.  

What I Need

To complete this tour I require funding for the following expenses:

  • Gas
  • Food
  • Accommodations
  • Some basic touring gear and maintenance to prepare the 916 for the journey

It really is that simple. I am only seeking the funding I need to complete this trip, which will be a round trip of approximately 5000kms over a period of two weeks.


Other Ways to Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, I would greatly appreciate if you shared my campaign and OddBike via social media, and of course I encourage you to read my writing and contribute your opinions on Facebook and the OddBike website. 

I am also seeking accommodations along my route to keep expenses to a minimum - if you have a couch and a safe place to park my bike, please get in touch with me and we can discuss.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

September 3rd Update

Update on the OddBike USA Tour Campaign

I want to personally thank everyone that has supported, shared and/or contributed to the OddBike USA Tour. I’m really psyched up about this trip and the enthusiasm I’ve gotten from my followers and riding buddies has been great. However we are still a way off from the goal, so I wanted to clarify some details and better explain what my intentions are with this campaign (and what it represents for OddBike’s future).

As I would expect with any campaign that asks strangers to contribute money, I have received negative feedback. I’m a reasonable man so I can completely understand why some may have some hesitation, but I think in general the poor feedback I’ve gotten is due to a lack of understanding more than any ill will.

Several months ago I was discussing the future of OddBike with a follower who made an interesting suggestion – keep OddBike independent and free of sponsors, but ask the readers to fund topics directly. His idea was to campaign for a specific goal – “ I need X dollars to write an article on Motorcycle Y”. I put the idea in the back of my mind.

Last month I was invited to Barber by that same follower. He suggested that I visit several of the manufacturers in the area (those being Motus, Confederate, and Bienville) to profile them in my own inimitable style. He reminded me of the crowd sourcing idea, and gave me a verbal kick in the ass to quit dreaming and start doing.

Thus began the OddBike USA Tour. It was a spur of the moment idea that has the opportunity to make myself known to several independent American marques - brands who have been neglected by the traditional media, but who deserve to be covered in depth. Right up my alley. It also allows me to take photographs that I can use for future publication, an important thing when you want to get serious about writing – no matter how good your writing is everyone wants unique, high-quality images.

I could have easily just campaigned for a plane ticket and a couple of nights at a hotel, doing everything in three or four days. But that’s boring. That’s what a traditional motorcycle journalist would do. I’m not a traditional journalist. And I wanted to make it an adventure, a journey with its own perils and challenges. I decided I would do it on my Ducati 916, which is my only vehicle, spending two weeks on the road and covering over 5000 kms. To keep it cheap and interesting, I’m camping most of the journey, with a few couches to crash on along the way.

Is it a vacation? Can’t say it isn’t. I am taking two weeks off work to jump in the saddle and blast across the USA. But I will be working the whole way. When I’m not riding, I will be visiting stops, taking pictures, conducting interviews, and of course writing. I hope that the information I gather on this journey will be enough to write at least 3 top-notch articles with my own pictures to accompany them, maybe as many as 5 or 6 if all goes well – and that doesn’t include the in-depth ride report I’m working on.

In the interest of full disclosure here is a break down of the projected expenses:

  • Total funding amount – 2000$
  •  Net after Indiegogo fees – 1800$
  • Gas 500$
  • Food 400$
  • Accommodations (camping fees) 300-400$
  • Gear (specifically: luggage, tent, sleeping bag, and a few odds and ends to get the bike prepped) ~300$

Thus my high estimate is 1600$, plus another 200-odd bucks of “oh shit” money, not including the 5-ish percent I’ll lose converting CAD to USD.

I was hoping to setup some incentives to donate – namely mugs and T-shirts – but quickly discovered that I couldn’t afford to custom print anything in small quantities, never mind the exorbitant Canadian shipping rates to send stuff around the world. If I were printing 50-100 shirts at a time, it would be worth it. But not when I am printing 10 or 15. Not to say I won’t get some OddBike items lined up for future events and giveaways, but this time around it would just be eating into my trip budget.

That being said, feel free to ignore the “perks” on the Indiegogo site when deciding your contribution. Donate 5$, 10$, or whatever you please. No need to stick to the “guidelines”, and every little bit helps. I appreciate every contribution no matter how modest.

Please remember that I run OddBike free of sponsorship and advertising. I work full time in another, unrelated industry and work on OddBike, solo, in my free time. I write and publish my work for free, and make no money off OddBike (full disclosure – I have sold one article for a whopping 40$ but otherwise have provided all my articles free of charge). This campaign is the beginning of a new concept where you, my readers and my followers, will directly fund my writing. That way I only have to answer to you, not to some corporate sponsor. Independence and free opinion is what sets OddBike apart, and it’s what I aim to maintain. But for more ambitious projects, I need your help – and rest assured the OddBike USA Tour will not be the last such endeavour, there are still many weird, rare and odd motorcycles out there that I hope to profile with your help.

Thanks again and I look forward to hitting the road in October.

Jason Cormier

Indiegogo site when deciding your contribution. Donate 5$, 10$, or whatever you
please. No need to stick to the “guidelines”, and every little bit helps. I
appreciate every contribution no matter how modest. 
Please remember that I run OddBike free of sponsorship and
advertising. I work full time in another, unrelated industry and work on
OddBike, solo, in my free time. I write and publish my work for free, and make
no money off OddBike (full disclosure – I have sold one article for a whopping
40$ but otherwise have provided all my articles free of charge). This campaign
is the beginning of a new concept where you, my readers and my followers, will
directly fund my writing. That way I only have to answer to you, not to some
corporate sponsor. Independence and free opinion is what sets OddBike apart,
and it’s what I aim to maintain. But for more ambitious projects, I need your
help – and rest assured the OddBike USA Tour will not be the last such
endeavour, there are still many weird, rare and odd motorcycles out there that
I hope to profile with your help.
Thanks again and I look forward to hitting the road in
October.
Jason Cormier

story:
Who We Are

Allow us to introduce ourselves: we are Jessie Mannisto and Chris Wells, a former CIA leadership analyst and Google fellow, and an educational psychologist and author, respectively. We’re the founders and lead editors of Third Factor, and we're working to bring together psychologists, educators, activists, writers and artists, spiritual leaders, divergent thinkers, and others interested in exploring this thing called positive disintegration.

What We Need

So far, we've built Third Factor out of our own donated time, energy, and funds.  But as with every endeavor, if we have more funds available, we can really extend our reach and our appeal.  Here's how we'll do that:

  • We'll hire an artist to create a logo and artwork for the site that visually represent the ideals of positive disintegration, drawing people in at first glance.
  • We'll launch a social media marketing campaign, to reach those positively maladjusted people who aren't fortunate enough to know someone who shared our work organically.
  • We'll cover all those things on the backend of the site that aren't glamorous to talk about here, but that everyone notices when they stop working, including secure and reliable web hosting, WordPress designs and plugins, and the like.
  • We'll begin to pay our writers and editors (in concert with funds from our ongoing Patreon) who are at present donating their labor because they value the theory of positive disintegration and share our belief that the world needs to hear about it.

If we don't reach our funding goal, we'll still be able to apply the funds we do raise to the goals above.  The amount we raise simply affects how well our site will function, how catchy it will look, how high the quality of our articles will be, and how far our reach will extend,

The Impact

If we succeed in getting Third Factor off the ground, this will give Dabrowski's work a tremendous boost.  Right now, few people outside of academia and education know anything about it.  Someone's got to bridge that gap if we want these ideas to flourish and make the mark they're capable of making.

Seriously, have you turned on the news lately?  The world needs the theory of positive disintegration.  And we're not going to stick only with theory; we're going to have interviews with people out there making a difference, living their reintegration through constructive social engagement of all sorts.  While the primary integrated have energy to spare, people at Level III often need a bit of a boost.  We're going to get them that boost.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone has financial resources available. But there are other ways you can help!  Please share this campaign and/or our articles with people you think should know about positive disintegration.  Our ultimate goal is to raise the number of people who have this lens to make sense of their lives and the world.  And on that note, every little social media share helps.

story:
Story of My Book

Iterating Autism is a guidebook to a more experimental approach to autism, exploring how a design thinking mindset can lead to unimaginable growth in any individual with autism.

My name is Ayush Agrawal, and I am the author of Iterating Autism. I was inspired to write this book because of my own experiences and struggles with autism. I am the older brother of autistic 11-year-old Aryan, having struggled with and thought about autism for over nine years now.

My hope in this book is to convince you that the well-thought and personalized approach to autism is truly superior to simply following the path of those who have been successful before you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you conquer the multitude of difficulties autism can throw at you.

In this book, you'll not only learn about approaching autism more effectively with an experimental mindset, you'll also discover popular yet misguided autism “treatments” as well as how to overcome the social, emotional, and psychological troubles that often accompany a family member with autism. You'll hear stories such as how...

  • Chinmay Nair overcame challenges with diets, sleeping, tantrums, and learning
  • Setting SMARTer goals helped us determine Aryan’s core issues with autism
  • A certain popular dietary approach to autism caused much more harm than good in Anushka

You will love this book if you are the caretaker of a newly diagnosed individual with autism, someone struggling to differentiate and gain success from conventional autism treatments, or simply someone who wants to support a loved one with autism.

Iterating Autism is a nonfiction book that especially speaks to caretakers of individuals with autism who want to look at autism treatment and coping in a new way.

The Book - Iterating Autism

Iterating Autism is written in 2 parts.

Part 1, containing the introduction and chapters 1-6, forms the core of the book, delving into the specific steps of well thought-out improvement. You’ll learn how to clearly recognize the specifics of the disorder, set SMART goals, effectively track data (especially since a caretaker’s schedule is often too busy to keep sufficient track), and maintain resilience during the tough times.

Part 2, containing chapters 7-10, focuses more on the various outside factors that can affect and/or hinder the process outlined in Part 1. We will discuss some of the most popular yet also potentially misleading treatments such as the gluten-free-casein-free (‘GF/CF’) diet. We will also talk about how to cope with the immense emotional, psychological, and social stresses that, if not addressed appropriately, can make life with autism spiral downward quickly.

What We Need & What You Get

Iterating Autism will be published with New Degree Press. I have set up pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing the book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

After the pre-selling of 120 copies of Iterating Autism, I will publish a paperback and ebook. After pre-selling 150 copies of Iterating Autism, I will also publish a hardcover edition. Lastly, after pre-selling 200 copies of Iterating Autism, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for anyone who pre-orders Iterating Autism now:
  • A personally signed copy of Iterating Autism when published
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of Iterating Autism.
  • Early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from Iterating Autism, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • The opportunity to be involved in selecting the cover and title.
  • An invitation to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Ayush Agrawal is a high school student from San Diego, California. He loves spending time with his younger autistic brother, Aryan, and regularly volunteers as a buddy to an autistic individual as part of a local organization’s Buddy Program. He is also deeply interested in STEM fields, especially the environmental sciences, currently interning at the Scripps Institute of Oceanography and leading a research project to degrade toxic pesticides.

Throughout Ayush’s life, his family has sought ways to decrease the pain, anxiety, stress, and confusion Aryan has to undertake in his everyday life. Watching Aryan pound his head against the wall in frustration, scream in pain, and shed tears when tired and scared pushed Ayush and his family to find any possible solution to alleviate Aryan’s troubles. While it hasn’t cured him completely, the iterative process certainly has forever changed Aryan’s autism for the better. Ayush wants to share their journey so that other caretakers of autistic individuals don’t have to go through the same mistakes and troubles he and his family have endured over the last 9 years.

When not immersed in typing out the next sentence, Ayush enjoys spending time at San Diego’s gorgeous beaches, playing cards with his family and friends, catching up on the latest environmental news, and enduring his friends’ taunts for being too tall.

For more information, you can connect with Ayush at ayush.agrawal2410@gmail.com and at @ayush.agrawal2410 on Instagram.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to the reader. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of Iterating Autism is contingent on the publisher I use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when Iterating Autism will publish. You will know when the copies of Iterating Autism that had been pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #IteratingAutism and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media. 
    • If you do so, you can email me (ayush.agrawal2410@gmail.com) and I will add you to a raffle where one randomly chosen winner will win something worth $50!

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ayush Agrawal

story:
Story of My Book

Path to PM: The Non-Traditional Journey into Product Management is about breaking into product management in tech for people with unique and non-technical backgrounds. It's filled with actionable advice, real stories, and frameworks that you can use to inspire and build an understanding of product management.

My name is Allison Lai and I am the author of Path to PM: The Non-Traditional Journey into Product Management. I wrote this book to motivate people who are interested in product management (PM) in technology, but feel that they don’t have the skills needed to make the jump into the role. Impostor syndrome can hit you hard and people might feel that they lack the “technical skills” needed to become a product manager. I hope to fight this myth because I felt the same fear that I wouldn’t stand out as a strong candidate in the field. I decided to take the steps that helped me land my first two roles in PM, which I want to share in order to support those who need that extra push!

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover it is possible for people to break into PM without computer science degrees or strong coding skills. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for product management! Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you take your first steps.

In this book, you'll learn what product management is and how you can leverage or build experiences that will help you land your desired role. You'll learn things such as...

  • Advice and real journeys from over 20+ product managers in tech, such as Microsoft and Facebook.
  • Actionable advice and tips for your career and challenges that you may encounter during recruiting.
  • Effective frameworks and new perspectives related to product development.
You will love this book if you are someone learning about product management and want to know how to begin thinking like a product manager. You will enjoy hearing about people’s unique journeys into tech, or you may decide to make a lateral move in your career!

Path to PM: The Non-Traditional Journey into Product Management is a nonfiction book that speaks to aspiring product managers, college graduates, and individuals making lateral career changes who want to look at product management in a new way.
 

The Book - Path to PM: The Non-Traditional Journey into Product Management

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-2. Here, we kick off by learning about what is product management, what does the industry looks like right now, and where will the industry go from here. This serves as an in-depth view of how product management came to be from the memo from the Father of Product Management, Neil McElroy, a P&G manager in 1931 who defined the role of future product managers.

Part 2 contains chapters 3-7. These chapters cover the five principles and characteristics that make up an effective product manager. Here, we dig into the meat of the book. You will read different examples, stories, and research that illustrate the importance of each trait! You will learn about different frameworks, specific terminology used in product management, and a structured game-plan for you to begin working on your own project!

Part 3 contains chapters 8-11. Last but not least, this section will cover the relevant information that you need to know how to become a product manager. This will take you through the recruitment process, information about how different tech companies have shaped their product manager roles, tips for new graduates or individuals making a career change, compensation, and identifying what company or environment is best for you!
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About the Author

Allison Lai serves in a product manager role at Western Digital. She previously worked for companies such as Marvel Entertainment, American Red Cross, and many others. She holds a bachelor’s degree in international business from the Zicklin School of Business at Baruch College. Allison is also a proud member of Women In Business at Baruch and has a passion for supporting young women to reach their career and personal goals.

Allison was inspired to write this book recruiting for product management roles. Allison saw fellow peers rejected due to lack of technical and coding skills, this inspired her to write this book. Shouldering fears of her own, this made her question: Does an effective product manager truly need a “technical” background? How do we motivate people and change this stigma about PM in tech?


Based on these questions, she dove headfirst into research and coffee chats with product managers who successfully landed their roles, despite their non-traditional backgrounds. Armed with phenomenal advice and a motivation to help other aspiring product managers in their careers, Allison hopes to encourage and inspire others.

Besides writing, Allison enjoys solo traveling, learning new languages, and meeting new people on her international adventures. Having studied Spanish, Japanese, Mandarin, and Latin throughout her education, she holds a strong passion for language which spurred her passion for travel. She is no stranger to adventure and loves trying new and exciting things! From hiking to surfing, to eating interesting cultural foods, Allison is always happy to talk about her travel experiences and more.

Don’t hesitate to reach out! You can connect with Allison at allison.lai@baruchmail.cuny.edu and on Instagram at @allisonlai_

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Path2PM and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support! :)

Thanks again,
Allison Lai

Having studied Spanish, Japanese, Mandarin, and Latin throughout her education, she holds a strong passion for language which spurred her passion for travel. She is no stranger to adventure and loves trying new and exciting things! From hiking to surfing, to eating interesting cultural foods, Allison is always happy to talk about her travel experiences and more.Don’t hesitate to reach out! You can connect with Allison at allison.lai@baruchmail.cuny.edu and on Instagram at @allisonlai_

story:
Girls Leading Girls

Our goal is to empower young women to become leaders and global citizens. This campaign is the start of our goal to raise awareness around the lack of training in sports and leadership for women, the lack of counter images in the media of positive female role models, and the lack of professional female sports coaches. As a soccer coach and former player, sports have been a useful vehicle for me growing up to build my self-esteem and confidence on and off the field. 

Why sports? Girls that participate in sports have increased levels of self-esteem, are happier, less likely to engage in dangerous or harming behavior. They also learn the value of teamwork, overcoming adversity, and self determination. Half of all girls who participate in some kind of sport experience higher than average levels of self-esteem and less depression.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal is to raise $1,000 in the next 30 days to purchase soccer equipment and to fund our Junior Coaches training program. We need 40 more soccer balls, 4 soccer nets, 20 scrimmage vests, 50 more cones, and materials to run the leadership training courses for our high school junior coaches.
  • People that donate $100 or more will receive a Girls Leading Girls t-shirt! Those that donate $50 or more will get a special thank you and Girls Leading Girls sticker.

The Impact

Currently, Girls Leading Girls (GLG) has over 100 girls in its programs! We are launching new programs every month to address the disparity between girls in sports and the lack of female role models in the game. There's so much more to a sport than just kicking a ball! We want to share this growth experience with the rest of the world and provide access and resources to girls of all backgrounds and skill level.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Make some noise about our campaign! Share this page with all your friends and LIKE us on facebook to build up our following. Men and Boys are allowed! We need your support just as much as we need women to support us.
  • Send us used soccer gear and clothes to donate! We host free clinics for girls in less served areas of San Francisco so please send us any used equipment or balls that you no longer need.

Thank you for taking the time to read this! Please visit us at: www.girlsleadinggirls.org

And LIKE us on facebook at: www.facebook.com/girlsleadinggirls

Contact Brianna@girlsleadinggirls.org for more information!

story:
Hello everyone,

I started a project called Hudson River Zeitgeist in April of this year. The project has become an open-ended oral history project exploring both the changes the twentieth century brought to the mid-Hudson Valley and the human experience of the area’s working class. To date, I’ve published fifteen interviews.

As the year went on, I started thinking about the idea of shelf life. If these interviews live only on the Web, they’ll soon get lost in that fast-paced world, and will only exist archived on there for however many years I pay the website’s hosting and URL fees. I decided in the past couple months that there ought to be a more tangible record of the stories and the experiences shared in the interviews.

My plan now is to publish a short-run of 250 copies of a book with those fifteen interviews, an introduction and an additional two previously unpublished interviews. It's a fairly tight timeline, but I'm hoping to have copies sent out before Christmas.

By donating to this campaign, you’re not only pre-ordering a book, you’re investing in at least one more year of Hudson River Zeitgeist as a project. One hundred percent of the proceeds will go toward the 2016 re-launch and subsequent season of interviews and stories on Hudson River Zeitgeist.

This year focused on people in my home area—Germantown, Hudson, Red Hook and surrounding towns. My plan for next year is to use the project to explore the experiences and histories of the people of river towns along the tidal Hudson, from The Bronx to Troy, from Nyack to Albany, and plenty of the rural areas in between.

About fifty percent of the proceeds from the book will go to a marketing budget to continue growing the readership next year. The other fifty percent will be ear-marked for a freelance budget, to provide, in addition to the interviews, a variety of feature stories about strange and forgotten chapters and pages of the Hudson River Valley’s history.

This campaign and the entire project is, in part, an experiment to explore whether a new and unique media company, with bare-bones overhead costs, can be crowdfunded—the context of course being the continual upheaval and the flailing of previously successful media business models.

To touch a bit on my background, I grew up in Germantown, New York, and started my career as a newspaper reporter for the Hudson Register-Star. I studied at Columbia University’s graduate school of journalism and, as a freelance writer, have written stories for The New York Times, The Boston Globe and a bunch of others. I write on the side and work for Camphill Hudson and the Devereux Foundation and hope to never be drawn away from the Hudson River Valley.

Through the interviews this year, I’ve learned about the local effects of the Great Depression, Prohibition, World War II; the rise of automobiles and the modern amenities of electricity and indoor plumbing; of differing perceptions of the ways the area and society in general have changed in recent decades; and of how various people cope with often-relentless adversity.

Please watch the book trailer above and please consider making a donation from $25 up to $2,500. If you’d rather, paper checks can be made out to Hudson River Zeitgeist and sent (but must be received by Nov. 30) with a note mentioning your donation level to P.O. Box 64 , Germantown, NY 12526

Here are the incentives for the various donation levels:

$25: receive a copy of the book. Pre-ordering now will be the only way to ensure a copy.

$40: receive a copy of the book for yourself and one to give away to a friend or family member interested in Hudson Valley history.

$100: Receive five copies of the book to keep and ensure any younger relatives will have access, when they’re ready, to this pool of unfiltered first-hand history. Anyone who chooses this donation level will also be thanked on a page at the close of the book.

$250: Receive five copies of the book yourself plus a donation in your name of eight additional copies of the book to a local public school district, history department or after-school program of your choosing. You will also be listed in the opening pages of the book as a bronze sponsor.

$500: Receive five signed copies of the book plus a donation in your name of twenty copies of the book to the recipient of your choosing. You’ll also be listed as a silver sponsor at the front of the book.

$1,000: Five signed copies for yourself plus fifty copies donated in your name and a listing at the book’s front pages as a gold sponsor.

$2,500: Five signed copies of the book plus an additional 150 books donated (all of this level’s donated books will display a marking showing who donated the books); a listing as a platinum sponsor in the book and an oral history interview conducted with a person of your choosing to create an in-depth record of the person’s experiences, memories, and advice—a talk which will be archived, printed, and, if requested, published on HudsonRiverZeitgeist.com.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,

William Shannon

Editor, Hudson River Zeitgeist

story:
Story of My Book

The Gen-Z Book is about Gen-Z. But here’s some more. In the book, I go into specific nuances of Gen-Z; What do we like talking about? What do we care about? What’s unique about our generation, and why should you care?

My name is Riya Goel and I am the author of The Gen-Z Book. I wrote this book because I’m a Gen-zer myself, and I wanted to see more written about Gen-Z by a Gen-Zer. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover and learn more about my generation. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for Gen-Z. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you learn about Gen-Z and how to promote intergenerational conversation and equity to make the world a better place.

In this book, you'll learn about Gen-Z, why we matter, and some of our characteristics as a generation. You'll hear stories such as...
  • Ziad Ahmed, the CEO of JUV consulting on why you should talk “to Gen-Z and not about us.”
  • Matt Sarafa, the CEO of Matt Sarafa fashion on why we should embrace diversity. 
  • Ava McDonald, the CEO of Zfluence on why authenticity matters. 
You will love this book if you are Gen-Z, know someone from Gen-Z, or are just trying to understand Gen-Z.

The Gen-Z Book is a nonfiction book that speaks to parents, CEOs, industry leaders, Gen-Zers themselves, and really those who want to look at and learn about Gen-Z in a new way.
 

The Book - The Gen-Z Book

The book is written in 4 parts.

Part 1: What is change and what is Gen-Z's role in change? contains the introduction + chapters 1-2. This section provides the reasoning behind why youth have always been at the forefront of change, and sets up the scene for where Gen-Z comes into play while providing background on the generation. 

Part 2: What's so unique about us (with stories ofc!) and how does Gen-Z do things differently? contains the chapters 3-12. These chapters, which are the majority of the book, go into specific characteristics of Gen-Z through interviews with Gen-Zers, and other industry leaders in their respective fields. I discuss topics from Gen-Z's global network to the collective trauma that we carry as a generation. 

Part 3: So Gen-Z is pretty cool. But what does that mean and what do we do now? contains chapters 13-16. Here, I address everyone that intersects into Gen-Z. Are you a Gen-Zer? Chapter 13 is for you. Are you a CEO or aspiring CEO? Read Chapter 15. 

Part 4: Peace out. This is (hopefully) what you learned contains chapter 17. These are my final words, a summary of the book, and what I hope my readers took out of it!

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover, title, and subtitle 
  • You will get to be featured on talks and content on the book’s social media accounts
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Riya Goel is a senior at West Orange High School in West Orange, New Jersey. She is a student-athlete, intersectional feminist, and racial justice activist changing the world one day at a time.

As a senior in high school, Riya is a Gen-Zer herself, and wants to let the world know the power that lies in Gen-Z, and how other generations need to talk to and understand Gen-Z in order to work with them to make the world a better place. 

Riya is a social good advocate and loves to meet new people. She started her own nonprofit, Asians Lead, worked with GirlUp as a teen advisor, and was a Girl Advocate with the Working Group on Girls. She also started her school’s fencing team, women empowerment club, and rows recreationally. 

For more information, you can connect with Riya Goel at riyagoelrs@gmail.com and on instagram at @riya.goel_ , and on twitter and tiktok @riyagoel103, and all platforms @thegenzbook. 
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #thegenzbook and tag me (@riya.goel_ and @thegenzbook on Instagram and @riyagoel103 everywhere else) as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Riya Goel

story:
Why El Salvador?

El Salvador hasnâ€™t been in the news much lately, so you may be wondering why there is a need for election observers.  A little back story: in the 1980â€™s, US military aid fueled El Salvadorâ€™s Civil War. The repressive military dictatorship had for years been killing anyone who spoke out against the severe economic inequality. Workers, students, farmers, the unemployed, and priests were murdered in the thousands, among these the Archbishop Oscar Romero. The Salvadoran people organized underground to defend themselves. They took up arms and fought from 1980-1992. The conflict ended with a truce that included official recognition of the rebel forces as a political party - the FMLN. Since the first post-war elections in 1994, the FMLN has continued to consult and work with the population to define their political goals in terms of the people's priorities. It's very refreshing to see a political party represent a poor and working class majority, whose needs have been ignored for so long.

A long-time El Salvador solidarity organization CISPES, the Committee in Solidarity with the People of El Salvador, is organizing an election observer delegation and I've decided that I want to make the commitment to join this important effort. Our delegation will give a press conference in El Salvador to publicize our findings. I'm planning on doing a couple of community presentations to share the news from El Salvador after the elections, so expect to hear from me when I come back - and please let me know if you know of a venue where I could share my findings. In addition to accompanying the Salvadoran people in their democratic process, I look forward to meeting with civil society groups to learn about the relationship between the popular social movements and the political goals of the FMLN.  And I hope to return energized to organize in the struggle for democracy here in the US. Can you help me get to El Salvador by contributing to my fundraising effort?

Mending the damage done by decades of US militarism and coercion

As an elections observer, I will do my small part to mend the damages done by many years of US interference in El Salvador by continuing a Central New York tradition of standing with the Salvadoran people. During El Salvador's last presidential elections in 2009, the FMLN candidate won â€“ despite a barrage of electoral fraud and the government party's fear campaign. Past elections had been rife with fraud, disinformation and political intimidation to frighten voters from voting their conscience at the polls. Some US government officials played an unfortunate role in this as well, threatening to retaliate against Salvadoran immigrants in the US if the FMLN won the presidency (see Democracy Now! March 13 2009.) In the run-up to the 2009 elections, CISPES and other grassroots groups succeeded in pressuring the US government to declare its neutrality with respect to El Salvador's elections. And just before election day, the US pledged that relations with El Salvador would not change based on who the Salvadoran people elected.

What I Need & What You Get

Can you help me get to El Salvador? To make this happen I need to raise at least $1700 dollars. $750 will cover in-country costs - very modest, shared accommodations (think bunk beds), meals, transportation, and election observer training.  $700 will cover travel costs, from Syracuse to NYC and the round trip flight from NYC to San Salvador. For a tax deductible donation, you can make your check out to "CISPES Education Fund"

Why El Salvador?

El
  Salvador
hasnâ€™t been in the news much lately, so you may be wondering why there is a
need for election observers.  A little back story: in the 1980â€™s, US military aid fueled El Salvadorâ€™s Civil War. The repressive military dictatorship had for years been killing anyone who spoke out against the severe economic inequality. Workers, students, farmers, the unemployed, and priests were murdered in the thousands, among these the Archbishop Oscar Romero. The Salvadoran people organized underground to defend themselves. They took up arms and fought from 1980-1992. The conflict ended with a truce that included official recognition of the rebel forces as a political party - the FMLN. Since the first post-war elections in 1994, the FMLN has
continued to consult and work with the population to define their political
goals in terms of the people's priorities. It's very refreshing to see a
political party represent a poor and working class majority, whose needs have
been ignored for so long. 
A long-time El Salvador solidarity organization CISPES, the Committee in Solidarity with the People of El Salvador, is organizing an election observer delegation and I've decided that I want to make the commitment to join this important effort. Our delegation will give a press conference in El
  Salvador to publicize our findings. I'm planning on
doing a couple of community presentations to share the news from El Salvador
after the elections, so expect to hear from me when I come back - and please
let me know if you know of a venue where I could share my findings. In addition to accompanying the Salvadoran people in their democratic process, I look forward to meeting with civil society groups to learn about the relationship between the popular social movements and the political goals of the FMLN.  And I hope to return energized to organize in the struggle for democracy here in the US. Can you help me get to El Salvador by contributing to my fundraising effort?
Mending the damage done by decades of US militarism and coercion 
As an elections observer, I will do my small part to mend the damages done by many years of US interference in El Salvador by continuing a Central New York tradition of standing with the Salvadoran people. During El Salvador's last presidential
elections in 2009, the FMLN candidate won â€“ despite a barrage of
electoral fraud and the government party's fear campaign. Past elections had been rife with fraud, disinformation and
political intimidation to frighten voters from voting their conscience at the
polls. Some US government
officials played an unfortunate role in this as well, threatening to retaliate
against Salvadoran immigrants in the US if the FMLN won the presidency (see Democracy Now! March 13 2009.) In the run-up to the 2009 elections, CISPES and other grassroots groups succeeded in pressuring the US government to declare its neutrality with respect to El Salvador's elections. And just before election day, the US pledged that relations with El Salvador would not change based on who the Salvadoran people elected.

story:
Our Story

Small rural community Baptist Church. Our Pew Bibles are in incredibly bad shape, many of them have been here for years. Torn and tattered is God's Holy word and the Bibles are sufficient until they fall apart the seems yes, however, it is the desire of my husband's and my own heart to buy new Pew Bibles for our church. In addition to buying new Bibles for our beloved Mt. Tabor Baptist Church, we hope to forward our old Bibles onto the family member's of those who long ago donated or to the ones who donated in memory of another loved one.


The Impact

The impact is that a tiny rural church will spread God's word through passing on BIBLES to other's in need or even to the family members of those who have donated a BIBLE in another's name. Or, maybe we will even be able to send them to people in nations that don't have copies of the BIBLE yet...


What We Need & What You Get

For every $7.14 donated by any one individual we will place a NEW PEW BIBLE in MT. TABOR BAPTIST CHURCH in loving memory or on behalf of any individual you request. In order to purchase 96 NEW PEW BIBLES we need to collect $673.40. When making a donation of 7.14 or more please indicate whom you would like the BIBLES placed on behalf of or in memory of.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

story:
Hi everyone!

My name is Kristina Smith I am the writer of Max and the Magnificent Mustache. I have written several children’s stories, but this would be my first published piece.

This whimsical story is about Max, an eight year old boy with a penchant for of all things, MUSTACHES! Max goes to great lengths to try to grow a mustache, he even eats liver and onions (ewhhh) all to no avail; till one day Max mysteriously grows a mustache and it's everything he ever wished for. Max becomes an overnight celebrity, the youngest person to win a national mustache competition and grace the cover of Mustache Magazine; but his mustache grows out of control and the situation becomes pretty hairy when nothing can control his unruly whiskers...

Why a mustache, why not a beard? Do you have something against beards?

No, no, no you have it all wrong! I love all facial hair; beards, mustaches, eyebrows, etc. If it makes you feel any better I will consider writing a story and include beards. 

"With Great Mustache Comes Great Responsibility"...

First of all I wanted to write a book that would make children laugh out loud, there is nothing more contagious than the laughter of children. In doing so with some of the proceeds I am hoping to also put a smile on the face of children, survivors and families of childhood cancer. As a Partner in Hope with St. Jude Hospital I know that my book will help money and the spirits of everyone affected by childhood cancer. If you would also like to become a Partner in Hope check out their website at...http://www.stjude.org/stjude/v/index.jsp?vgnextoid=f87d4c2a71fca210VgnVCM1000001e0215acRCRD

My story isn't intended to be too terrible moral although it does have a universal message that I believe will resonate in the hearts of readers young and old and that is… "Not everything you wish for is all it’s cracked up to be; so be careful what you wish for, because it just might come true".  Max and the Magnificent Mustache stirs a child's imagination, curiosity and intellect; with a message that is sure to open up the lines of communication, which I found out first hand when I read my manuscript to some of my toughest critics....Second Graders!

It was AMAZING to watch their faces and to hear what they had to say about the story. Some kids had alternate endings for me and new adventures for max. Some kids shared their deepest wishes, some were silly, some were serious, but wishes all the same. I was blown away when one little girl told me...she thought Max's mustache grew so out of control because of all the attention he was getting, "he let it all go to his head" she said. Well, I thought she must be a comedian or one pretty smart cookie - either way her reasoning was pretty deep for an eight year old! 

The outpouring of support I received from all the children was very encouraging and when I read all their Thank You letters that their teacher Mrs. Lopez sent me, well, it only fueled my desire to get this book published ASAP! 

Now I already have an Illustrator, her name is Valentina Felce. I found Valentina in the wonderful world of Etsy one day while looking for inspiration. I was immediately enamored by her work as you will soon see. The illustrations in the book are playful with a touch of nostalgia and even the dolls used in the artwork are hand-crafted by Valentina Felce. That's right, not only is she a wonderful illustrator but she hand-crafts dolls as well. Illustrating with the dolls helps bring the book to life, adding layers and textures; making the book even more tangible.

Readers will also be given the chance to purchase Max dolls, along with the Bandeady Brothers (the villains in the story). What a wonderful gift it will be for a child to have their own Max doll, to play along with the story and to spend hours creating their own Max adventures. Check out Valentina's etsy store and get a feel for the unique and quality dolls she creates. http://www.etsy.com/shop/BlueRaspberryDesigns

The short and long of it...

We are self-publishing Max and the Magnificent Mustache, unlike big publishing houses that cover all the cost of getting the word out to the media, editing, copy editing, web design, press kits, artwork, design & typesetting, printing, marketing, sales, etc...We unfortunately don't have that luxury YET!

This process is extremely expensive but through Amazon we are able to publish a paperback book and an e-book for those with nook/kindle; all within our means. Your pledges will also go toward printing the book in hardcover, not just in English but in different languages as well. This is the most expensive step, to publish the book in hardback; since we will be using a more traditional printing service for this process. It cost upwards of $3,000 or more for 500 fully illustrated and colored hardcover books; we want to print as many as we can, not just to sell but we want to be able to gift Max and the Magnificent Mustache to school library's and children's hospitals. Your pledges will also go toward making a interactive book app, the purchasing of ISBN numbers for all the books, publishing, editing, creating a fun, kid friendly website, the finished illustrations, the max dolls, and the sales and marketing of this book. Sooooooo....

Will you help me get my book published? 

We have different levels of incentives when you become a backer, from handwritten thank you cards and your own printable mustaches, to t-shirts, hard cover books and your very own Max doll.

Come back and visit our project regularly as we will keep you informed every step of the way with illustrations, photographs and video’s.

Follow us on facebook https://www.facebook.com/max.magnificent.3?ref=tn_tnmn and Twitter https://twitter.com/Kristin69633728

Contact us anytime at maxandthemagnificentmustache@gmail.com

So lay down your razors, go forth and spread the word about Max and the Magnificent Mustache!

story:
Just a few days to go...

 

Aloha.

Recently I finished writing a fiction book under the title "Going Nuts in Kaua'i --- love, humor and spirituality" and can sure use a little help in launching this out to the world. My plan is to make a print-on-demand paperback book, plus Kindle and e-book edition to sell on Amazon.

 

The story: An ordinary woman goes to the island of Kaua'i to find a quiet life, and possibly the man of her dreams. She finds those all right, and much, much more. Totally unprepared for what's coming, before she knows it, she starts down the path of a crash “coarse” in spirituality and discovers other worlds that surround all, of which she had not been aware.

Written with a light touch, laughter and a bit of drama, it’s about how fascinating life can be, if you just see it in a different way.

Adult fiction, non-violent

Illustration: courtesy of my friend Hami Otaki

 

❦With this story, I hope to encourage others to let go of fears and go live life the way you truly want to live. The journey to find yourself is not an easy one, however, some laughter and optimism always helps.❦

 

Hopefully I can get this published in May.

The campaign goal includes fees for proof-reading by an editor, getting a cover designed, self-publishing online and initial fee for advertising the book. Contributors will receive notifications on when it is published, via email or otherwise.

Everyone who contributes can receive a copy of the story as a perk. If online is not your favorite way to send money, a check or money order in $US sent to the following payee and address will be just as good. (Rhaya is my pen name) Or, in person if we meet. Please include an email address to receive follow up notices, and shipping address to receive a printed book.

Alisen Celestyne

P O Box 1438

Kapaa, HI 96746

 

日本からは参加がむつかしいかもしれませんので、その場合は気になさらないで下さい。あと一年後くらいにこの本の日本語版も出したいので、その時までお楽しみに。

Feel free to share this campaign with others if your heart says so.

Mahalo nui loa to all !

 

Excerpts from the book:

 

“And what do you do for a living?”

“I'm retarded.”

“You mean, you're retired?”

“No I mean, retarded, see?” He rolls up his eyes and makes a funny face. Her face goes blank for a moment or two, then eases into a smile.

“Well, uh, we always welcome people with some humor.”

 

******* 

One night I had a very short dream. It was a quick flash of a dream that felt very strange. It was just one scene: I am looking at a row of tall trees, like a small forest. There is a lot of space between the tree trunks and through those spaces, I can see a very large, green mountain in the distance. Then, I wake up. That's all.

It seems like just a second or two that I saw this view. Yet, somehow I sensed that this is a place in Kaua'i. I don't know how I know, but I know that's where it is. After this dream, I also knew that I would go there for real. I still had to work on the details of how and when, but my heart knew for sure that I would be there. So, from that point on, I prepared for my move with confidence, despite that my friends looked at me at first in surprise, and then in disbelief. They couldn't even imagine me moving so far away to a place where I knew no one.

 

Note: not sure why the fonts on this page are all mixed up.  I'm not a techy : )

 

Quote from a song that resonates with this story:

RETURN TO FOREVER

 

I think it's time we return to forever

Where we can fly like birds of a feather

Never say you're sorry and never say never

It's really time we return to forever

 

And if you fall I will help you back up

And if you call I will always pick up

And I will see you no matter what they say

And if we must part I will love you anyway

 

I think it's time we return to forever

Where we can fly like birds of a feather

Never say you're sorry and never say never

It's really time we return to forever

 

The way to find your bliss is to lose your monkey mind

Look up so you don't miss the love you've been trying to find

 

I think it's time we return to forever...

 

+Elijah- and the Band of Light

© December, 2011

story:
Short Summary

I am 50 years young and was born near Reading, PA. When I was 19 and in my sophomore year of college, I broke my neck playing tackle football and have been in a wheelchair for over 30 years. I transferred to a wheelchair accessible college just south of Erie, PA. Since my injury, I have earned a Master's degree, been nominated for a Rhode's scholarship, traveled around the world as a wheelchair athlete, founded a theater, and a stand-up comedy troupe, been an advocate, free-lance writer, talk-show host, and a fine judge of whiskey. My story will educate you on what is abuse and how it affects everything you do, what disability is and isn't, how God has been my co-pilot, though many times, I opted to take a bus. Finally, I analyze forgiveness and how betrayal can make it so difficult.

What We Need & What You Get

I will use the $5,000 to self-publish my autobiography. I am doing this so I can keep the rights, because there's a chance my story could be made into a movie. I will self-publish using a company called Xlibris, which will handle the copyrighting, editing, design, marketing, and the creation of my own website.

Contributors will get a personal thank-you email for donations of $10-$20, personal phone call for $21-$50, autographed copy of the book for $51-$75, and a mention in the book for $76 on up. If I don't get all the funding I need, I will launch another campaign to earn the rest.

The Impact

"The Long Journey Home" is real life, not Hollywood's sugary sweet version of disability. In the beginning, the reader sees an abused kid powerless to help his more severely abused mother. His chair is sent into his life as both his tormentor and liberator. His rehab and adjustment are difficult and intense. His mother dies just months later.

My autobiography will forever change everyone who reads it. It will force you to think, re-evaluate, laugh out loud, and hurt. Many stereotypes are weakened and/or laid to waste.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's ok. Just get the word out!!
