story:
Wit and Humor Magazine is an iTunes Newsstand digital magazine which is optimized for viewing on the iPad. The magazine will be published once a month beginning in November 2012.

What is Wit and Humor Magazine about?

The new and upcoming Wit & Humor Magazine shines a humorous spotlight on human behavior. By combining wit, humor, science, a few factoids, some absurdity, along with your funny bone, we will explore the various antics humans get themselves into and have a good laugh about it.

In the magazine, not only will we explore the science behind why people do the things they do, there will be plenty of funny examples of them doing it.

The magazine will contain articles written by known as well as up-and-coming humorists; comic strips and illustrations; as well as audio and video skits.

We will have ourselves a blast poking fun at the creature we call mankind.

What Kind of Humor Will Be in the Magazine?

The intent behind the Wit and Humor Magazine is to present humor that falls within the neutral to positive scale of what many Psychology of Humor experts consider to be healthy.

As such, we will keep the humor mostly clean and positive, and certainly free of harsh expletives. The types of humor included in the magazine will probably include the following: dry, witty, silly, esoteric, parody, and British-style; along with a touch of sarcasm.

We have plenty of published and unpublished comedians and humorists just waiting to entertain you through the Wit and Humor Magazine.

The creator of the magazine, Addison C. Arthur, has even done a few things that have received a chuckle. Here are some samples of the podcasts that he has done in the past: http://innerillumination.net

Who Will Be Some of the Characters in the Magazine?

Along with the various articles contributed by comedians and humorists, the magazine will feature what we call the Inner Illumination Team. This team has been created by Addison C. Arthur and is a team of characters depicting various countries and belief systems from around the world.

The idea behind the team is to provide the magazine's listeners and viewers some interesting and often humorous perspectives on human behavior.

 

Of course there is nothing like playing the Inner Illumination Team off of the local yokels and some "not-so-benevolent" characters that Addison is cooking up for you. All-in-all, we have some interesting articles and skits in mind for your entertainment.

Expert Opinions

Along with amusing viewpoints from contributing artists, we will have interesting articles from human behavior and humor experts such as Dr. Kathy Hahner and Addison C. Arthur.

We will take a scientific look behind the humor that we are presenting within the magazine. The intent is to educate through entertainment.

Sample Pages of the Wit and Humor Magazine

Here are some pages that we created to serve as mockups of what some of the pages in the magazine may look like.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Why is the Magazine Made for the iPad?

Forrester Research now predicts that 82 million Americans - or more than one-third of U.S. adults - will own a tablet computer by 2015.

"Of those sales, the lion's share will be iPads, and despite many would-be competitors that will be released, we see Apple commanding the vast majority of the tablet market through 2012," a Forrester analyst said.

It is estimated that there will be 1 in 4 (53 million) American iPad users by the end of 2012. This number does not include the number of non-Americans around the world using the iPad.

With most of the iPad users having an appreciation for humor, we thought it would be a great idea to optimize the magazine for them. Initially, the magazine will be available for download through the iTunes Newsstand. Eventually, we will see about getting the magazine published for the Kindle and Android platforms as well.

The digital format of the magazine allows us to do many cool things such as adding audio and video within it.

Conclusion

We have the platform and talent to see this project through from beginning to completion. We are asking for your help in getting some of the software and to contribute some funds for the great voice-over actors and writers participating in the project. We invite you to feel good and actually laugh at us while helping to turn this project into reality.

Any money donated above the financial goal for this project will go towards paying contractors such as illustrators, voice-over actors, animators, and writers to make the "Wit and Humor Magazine" that much more awesome!

We appreciate your interest and thank you in advance for your financial and moral support.

story:
Did you know that you are overlooking thousands (if not millions) of job opportunities everyday?

 

THE PITCH (short version) 

I am writing a book on job / career hunting called "How To Find a Job Now (and never have to look for a job again)." I have already produced several videos on job hunting strategies, spoken at career ministries and job seeker events, written articles on how to find hidden jobs, contributed to a few books, participated in podcasts and achieved some notoriety in the recruiting world but, I do not have a book of my own. It has been suggested to me on several occasions that I should do so and I feel that now is the right time.

 

I was quoted in: Globe and Mail, US News and World Report, Wall Street Journal and The Atlanta Journal and Constitution.  Monster.com, Entrepreneur Magazine, Black Enterprise and The HR Examiner have all cited my contribution to job seekers.

 

I have been involved in the recruiting industry for over a decade and have worked for such companies as Google, Microsoft, Siemens, MCI and a host of startup companies. I have produced award winning blogs, been featured in several leading publications and have been cited several times for my digital influence. Check out my LinkedIn profile to learn more about me and to network. 

 

THE PITCH (long version) 

2002 was not a happy time for me; at least, not initially. I was in a position where my wife laid off, I was laid off, I had a little one to take care of and bills that would not stop coming in. So, being the responsible man of the house I go into job search mode.

This was my checklist:

[X] Post my resume on Monster
[X] Search every (insert expletive of your choice) online job board I could find
[X] Newspaper Want-ads
[X] Email Recruiters and Contacts for leads
[X] Go to Networking Events
[X] Go to Job Fairs
[X] Department of Labor Office
[X] Contact Temp Employment Agencies
[X] Walk into companies and fill out applications

And the more I did these things, the more frustrated I became because I was not getting the results I needed. I blamed the economy, I blamed others for not recognizing my skills, I shifted the blame to there being too much competition in the workplace and eventually I began to doubt myself. I also tried to laugh at the situation as I considered the irony at the time, me, a recruiter, looking for work.

The turning point for me came about 2 weeks into my job search. Sure, not a long time by other measures, but the uncertainty and feeling of desperation was real nonetheless. I was at the kitchen table with a stack of bills on one side of me and a pile of printed off job descriptions on the other when I said  (in jest mind you), “God,something has got to happen and quick.”

And then, a light illuminated my face and angels began to sing and my next job appeared before my eyes. Hah! Not really, not even half of that, but dramatic nonetheless. It occurred to me that I was doing the same thing, in the same way as everyone else and getting the same results – no job.

“Do something different,” I said out loud, and from that moment on, I did.

It was not uncommon in 2002, to be unemployed for several months before landing a position. Once I changed my job search strategy, I was working in two months. It was a simple thing, really. I took my knowledge of how recruiters act, think and search for talent and reversed engineered the process to my advantage. Not only that, I was determined to not be in that situation again. So, what did I do? Once I found work, I did not stop looking and in a very real way, I positioned myself to perpetually refuse job offers. In this way, I have a type of insurance should the specter of layoffs ever darken my door again. Did it work? Or rather, has it worked since the recession of 2002? Yes.

Although I was laid off (again) in 2008, the season of another recession, I was able to secure a new corporate gig in four months time. (Although, I did service several clients on a contract basis via my own business in between corporate opportunities.) If that does not sound remarkable to you, then you have been fortunate enough not to have to look for work when the jobless rate was greater than the great depression.

But I digress, my intention is not to brag on my success, but to help you with yours. Why? Simply put, I have not forgotten what it felt like to be without a job and no prospects and I don't wish that on anyone.

Be sure to click the "Gallery" tab above to watch sample videos of the type of job search advice I give

What follows is a partial list of the information I plan to include in my book.

TABLE OF CONTENTS

SECTION ONE: What really happens to your resume after you apply for a job?

  • Let's take a look at job hunting from the recruiter's perspective and examine what recruiter's want to see verses what they typically get. Furthermore, let's delve into the politics that sometimes play out behind the scenes. Issues I may add, that you would normally never learn about.
  • Some recruiters use job boards and some do not. Some believe job boards are dying in the wake of“social media recruiting” and others laugh at the argument. I'm going to show you both sides of the coin and how to take advantage of both viewpoints.
  • At the end of the day, you need to think of the process as it were a dating situation. The more desparate you appear, no matter how qualified you are, the least likely you will attract the interest of an employer. Its weird, I know. The trick is to get them to chase after you. I share with you a few strategies on how to do that.


SECTION TWO: Why is that online?

  • Every company you apply for does the poor man's background check, but they won't tell you that and there are reasons why. I explain those reasons to you. I also detail how companies dig up dirt on you during a background check and what you can do to protect your online reputation.

SECTION THREE: How To Find Hidden Jobs

  • How to find hidden jobs
  • How to find jobs that most people will never see
  • How to automate the job search process
  • How to mine opportunities from press releases
  • How to find jobs before the job description is even written
  • How to find the right people to network with
  • How to prospect perfect strangers for job leads
  • How to generate job leads from webinars
  • How to find new jobs from old job descriptions
  • How to find work by referring leads to others
  • How to dial for dollars
  • How to Use Search Engines to find your next boss
  • How to look for work without angering your boss
  • How to find a job on Twitter
  • How to find work in other countries
  • How to find a job on Skype
  • How to find a job on Facebook
  • How to job hunt like a spy 
  • How to find work at a startup
  • How to find a job on Pinterest
  • How to find a job on Instgram
  • How to find a job on Google Plus

SECTION FOUR: The Job Seeker's Guide to LinkedIn

  • LinkedIn is the #1 social network with recruiters and candidates. That being the case, I wanted to give special attention to LinkedIn and show you how to fully leverage it to your advantage as a job seeker.

SECTION FIVE: Job Hunting is a Team Sport

  • Searching for work is hard enough on your own, so why not take a team-centered approach to finding a job? There are many advantages to this strategy: a) You cover more ground without extra effort, b) You save money on expenses related to job search and c) It reduces the time you would be unemployed. In this section, I show you how to create a team of job seekers and pursue employment as a group project, how to find team members, how to build a list of potential employers and how to manage yourjob search data.

SECTION SIX: Good to Know

In this section, I give advice on things every job seeker should be considering or at least, should know for themselves.

  • How to solicit friends and family for job search help
  • How to research a company before accepting an offer 
  • How to repurpose your skills into a new career
  • How to craft a cover letter that works
  • How to find out how the job market is really doing
  • How to choose the best place to relocate for a job
  • How to get noticed by a hiring manager
  • How to find out who is really hiring now
  • How to find out if your company is about to lay you off
  • How to apply for a job that has impossible requirements
  • How to set your expectations after an interview
  • How NOT to get the job you really, really want
  • How To get the job you really, really want.
  • How to pick the right career

SECTION SEVEN: How to spend a little to get a lot

  • This is the only part of the book that will cost you money to implement the strategies I suggest. And even with these, I strive to keep the cost of these strategies to under $100.00. Everything prior to this section, costs $0.00 to implement. 

SECTION EIGHT: Advice and Resources

  • In this section, I share free resources for finding work online that I have not already covered. Plus, I reach out to other authors and career advisors for their best tips and comments on surviving in any economic climate, but especially during a recession.

And, back to the pitch...

So as you can see, once completed, this book would have a LOT of actionable information that can be immediately applied. All of the strategies will cost $0.00 for you to implement, with the exception of things covered in "Section Seven." Make sense?

IMPORTANT: The final deliverable will be an ebook that will be made available for downloading. Once the ebook has been sent out to all supporters, it will later be sold via multiple outlets at a significantly higher price than $1.00. 

I will complete and distribute the book by September 2012. If that seems like a long time to deliver on this commitment, please review again the table of contents and consider that I will be adding more to that list as I go along. Just sayin'...

Ta-Ta For Now!

I've rambled on long enough. I look forward to hearing from you. Oh! On the off chance that your spirit is willing, but your wallet is weak, I would really appreciate it if you shared this campaign with others in your network.

Until next time, good luck with your job search!

Jim Stroud

story:
Action/Thriller series following a family torn apart by war and espionage in the Alaska wild. Books, Audiobooks, and Documentary Film.

I am an Alaskan and an indie writer with a passion for getting the details right about the land I love. Survival in desperate situations is always difficult, but in an Arctic environment there are factors that take that difficulty closer to impossible. People have lived in Alaska for thousands of years before modern technology, so it is obviously possible.

So much of what people know about Alaska comes from Hollywood which usually gets it very wrong, wrong to the point that if someone followed the advice even of some of the "reality shows" they could end up dead very fast. While my books are fiction, I strive to show my home state as it really is in all its harsh beautiful reality, and to provide real tools that a reader could employ if they found themselves in the unthinkable situation of trying to survive in an extreme climate. And that's where ICE HAMMER comes in.

The Story: 

  • Ice Hammer is a three book fiction series seen through the eyes of a family ripped apart by invasion and the ensuing war that consumes the North American continent, including their home state of Alaska. It is not about the bigger political game that stands behind all war, but it is about the lives, the loves and the bitter struggles of those trying to survive to see another day. 

The Set Up

  • 2013: NSA spy scandal lost the US many of its friends.

  • 2016: The US government defaults on its debts. With the collapse of the American Empire the few remaining US allies turn their backs as well.

    2017: Massive drought and crop failures spread across Eurasia threatening both China and the former Soviet states with starvation.

    2018: The decision is made. America will pay its debts.

    In a sweeping measure to collect what they are owed, guarantee ample food supplies and take fertile land for their own people, China and the newly re-Sovietized Russia combine forces and invade North America. 

    As limited nuclear strikes devastate major cities and population centers Chi-Sov forces rush to take and hold tactically significant segments of the continent paving the way for the transfer of their own populations for re-settlement and conquest.

    Just as it was for settlers in the early days of the American continent it is a bold new world for Chinese and Russian adventurers. In the face of methodical brutality at the hands of the conquerors, the locals don’t intend to give up the land without a fight.

    Brad Stone, IT chief for the VA Hospital in Anchorage Alaska, has dropped his teen sons off at Boy Scout Summer Camp and is heading home for a planned romantic week with his beautiful Korean born wife Youngmi when death rains down from the sky. Rockets and troops cut off the highway forcing Brad to escape into the mountains on foot. He must choose whether to save his sons at scout camp, or find Youngmi first. As the war rages around them Brad, Youngmi and their teen boys, end up in separate but equally deadly situations. Unsure of whether any of the other family members are alive, each of them must survive and bring the fight to the invader. See the partial cast of characters below.

    Status of the series:

    The entire three book series has been outlined and the first draft of book one is complete. Drafts of the next books are under way, and the first book is starting its initial follow-up rewrite, adding the flesh, muscle and sinew to the skeleton until it comes fully alive.

    Barring major craziness like hurricanes in my bathroom, massive snow-storms in the kitchen, or alternate/parallel dimensions opening up in my recording booth and turning it into a portal for an alien species to leap through a time warp and attempt to conquer the earth, ICE HAMMER Book One should be ready for submission by late 2014. With the help of pledges at the Executive level, this could potentially go even faster.

    Cast of Characters:

    A short intro to some of the main characters of ICE HAMMER

    Brad Stone
    Age 46. 
    Spouse: Youngmi (over 25 years)
    Children: Jay, Nathan, Alex
    IT Chief, Sunday School Teacher, Former Marine (88-92)
    Becomes Unintentional Leader of the Rebels

    Youngmi Stone
    Age 46
    Korean born
    Met Brad while she was in college & he was in Marines
    Web Programmer, Homeschool Mom, Active in her church
    Husband believes her dead, but she's held captive by Chinese General

    Nathan Stone
    Age 16
    Soon to be Eagle Scout
    Camp Counsellor at Gorsuch Boy Scout Camp
    Escapes into mountains with group of scouts at start of war

    Alex Stone
    Age 13
    1st Class Scout
    Camper with his Scout Troop
    Escapes to mountains with older brother

    Mike Campbell
    Age 45
    Retired Army Special Forces Master Sergeant
    Father of one of the older scouts at camp
    Leads scouts on escape into mountains

    Tommie Dolan
    Age 39
    Private Military Contractor / Mercenary
    Works with Mike training Alaska National Guard soldiers in special warfare skills
    Assists Mike leading scouts in escape

    Kharzai Ghiassi
    Age 40
    Former CIA agent
    Won't say what he's doing living like a hermit in the Alaska backwoods
    Encounters Brad in the forest alone, offers to team up with him
    Has a very odd sense of humor, very good at sneaking... and killing

    Sammi Park
    Age 30
    Korean born, raised in US
    High school ESL language teacher (speaks Korean, Mandarin, Japanese, and English all with native fluency)
    Was Brad's student in church many years ago, had a teen crush on him that she never grew out of
    She and "The Ajummas" are rescued by Brad & Kharzai before Chinese raid

    The Ajummas
    Group of Korean middle aged women picking wild edible plants outside of Anchorage when the war starts. Their knowledge of plants and natural medicine keeps the growing group of refugees alive and mostly healthy.

    General Zhang Ko Bai
    Age 52
    Commander of Chinese Forces Alaska
    Wife died of cancer during the early phase of invasion planning
    Keeps Youngmi prisoner due to her uncanny resemblance to his dead wife

    ...and many more

    Why the Funding Request?

    In writing my books I try to make them as realistic and life-like as possible by way of hands on research. I am an avid outdoors-man who has lived the majority of my life in Alaska. Ranging from Fairbanks to Salcha, Palmer to Anchorage I've experienced temperatures as extreme as +110F and -80F (not in the same day thank God), enjoyed an hours long roller-coaster on a boat in an ocean storm, stood sentry duty in sideways rain and slipped into an ice cave beneath a glacier that made superman's  HQ look positively drab. I've watch my wife's amazing tulip collection bloom all in one day as a technicolor reward for her gardening diligence only to witness a thousand pound momma moose eat the flowers off every last one of them as a mid-morning snack. I've hung tight with the twenty four hour summer sun and watched the Aurora Borealis fill the dark winter sky from horizon to horizon with swirling colors that danced like a supernatural ballet   While I've been around a lot, in such a big place there are innumerable places, objects and experiences I've not seen or done. As a self-published writer there are no royalty advances or support networks to offset costs of researching and producing the work.

    Monies raised in this project will pay for that hands on research including sub-arctic mountain and wilderness survival training (like this guy), indigenous skills such as hide preparation and food gathering, tactical firearms classes by these guys, historical and linguistics research at the University of Alaska Native Studies Dept and the Alaska Native Heritage Center, and gear testing of modern equipment. 

    Part of the funds will be used to purchase up to date video and audio recording equipment for the purpose of creating a documentary titled "The Making of Ice Hammer" that will chronicle the research and experiences I gain in preparing and writing this series of novels, information I expect to be very helpful to writers, new and experienced alike, especially if they attempt to tackle the subject of Alaska.

    Leaping into the mainstream publishing arena challenge

    If ICE HAMMER is not picked up by a major publisher it will be self-published as my previous titles have been. Pledged funds will be spent on professional editing, book formatting and professional cover art.

    If the series is picked up by a major publisher those funds will be spent on marketing and promotion (which the big pubs don’t do much of anymore) by getting out to as many book fairs, conferences and similar events as I can, and hopefully getting to meet some of you who have donated. 

    Risks and challenges

    Being an experienced indie writer with several self-published novels already out there I know some of the pitfalls that may lay ahead for this project. And as the techs and administrators of the Obamacare website became painfully aware of when HealthCare.gov floundered painfully to life a few weeks ago, I also know that there are trips and traps I cannot imagine lurking in the shadows waiting to ambush me. Time management, unexpected illness, day job emergencies, technical issues. Any of the above can toss a pebble into the works. How to overcome them? Persevere! The series is already outlined, the first book already drafted and the rest ready to be fleshed out. I made sure to have that much ready before putting the project into the public eye to ensure that ground work was already laid out and full tilt construction of the series could start from the word 'Go'!

Action/Thriller series following a family torn apart by war and espionage in the Alaska wild.
Books, Audiobooks, and Documentary Film.I am an Alaskan and an indie writer with a passion for getting the 
details right about the land I love. Survival in desperate situations is
 always difficult, but in an Arctic environment there are factors that 
take that difficulty closer to impossible. People have lived in Alaska 
for thousands of years before modern technology, so it is obviously 
possible.So much of what people know about Alaska comes from 
Hollywood which usually gets it very wrong, wrong to the point that if 
someone followed the advice even of some of the "reality shows" they 
could end up dead very fast. While my books are fiction, I strive to 
show my home state as it really is in all its harsh beautiful reality, 
and to provide real tools that a reader could employ if they found 
themselves in the unthinkable situation of trying to survive in an 
extreme climate. And that's where ICE HAMMER comes in.The Story: 
Ice Hammer is a three book fiction series seen through the eyes of a 
family ripped apart by invasion and the ensuing war that consumes the 
North American continent, including their home state of Alaska. It is 
not about the bigger political game that stands behind all war, but it 
is about the lives, the loves and the bitter struggles of those trying 
to survive to see another day. 



The Set Up




2013: NSA spy scandal lost the US many of its friends. 





2016: The US government defaults on its debts. With the collapse of 
the American Empire the few remaining US allies turn their backs as 
well. 
2017: Massive drought and crop failures spread across Eurasia threatening both China and the former Soviet states with starvation. 

2018: The decision is made. America will pay its debts. 

In a sweeping measure to collect what they are owed, guarantee ample 
food supplies and take fertile land for their own people, China and the 
newly re-Sovietized Russia combine forces and invade North America. 


As limited nuclear strikes devastate major cities and 
population centers Chi-Sov forces rush to take and hold tactically 
significant segments of the continent paving the way for the transfer of
 their own populations for re-settlement and conquest.
Just as it 
was for settlers in the early days of the American continent it is a 
bold new world for Chinese and Russian adventurers. In the face of 
methodical brutality at the hands of the conquerors, the locals don’t 
intend to give up the land without a fight. 
Brad Stone, IT chief 
for the VA Hospital in Anchorage Alaska, has dropped his teen sons off 
at Boy Scout Summer Camp and is heading home for a planned romantic week
 with his beautiful Korean born wife Youngmi when death rains down from 
the sky. Rockets and troops cut off the highway forcing Brad to escape 
into the mountains on foot. He must choose whether to save his sons at 
scout camp, or find Youngmi first. As the war rages around them Brad, 
Youngmi and their teen boys, end up in separate but equally deadly 
situations. Unsure of whether any of the other family members are alive,
 each of them must survive and bring the fight to the invader. See the 
partial cast of characters below.



Status of the series:



The entire three book series has been outlined and the first draft of
 book one is complete. Drafts of the next books are under way, and the 
first book is starting its initial follow-up rewrite, adding the flesh, 
muscle and sinew to the skeleton until it comes fully alive.


Barring major craziness like hurricanes in my bathroom, massive 
snow-storms in the kitchen, or alternate/parallel dimensions opening up 
in my recording booth and turning it into a portal for an alien species 
to leap through a time warp and attempt to conquer the earth, ICE HAMMER
 Book One should be ready for submission by late 2014. With the help of 
pledges at the Executive level, this could potentially go even faster.

story:
Short Summary

Has life ever thrown you a curve ball? If it has you aren’t alone. I spent 6 years in college getting my bachelor’s degree in International Finance and Marketing and I threw in an MBA for good measures, and I was in the industry for less than five years.

I woke up at 4:30am for a scheduled 5:30am triathlon training session when everything changed. I had just completed a training ride and transitioned into a run when 300 yards in I started hyperventilating. I tried walking it off only to cough up both lungs and a kidney 13 feet further down the road. I would have chalked this up to over training if I hadn’t seen blood in my mucus.

Long story short I would come to find out that I had three massive tumors wrapped around my small intestine, but I discovered a lot more over the next decade. After 5 different chemo regimens and countless hours of due diligence I learned:

1.  Traditional treatments were ineffective.

2.  After losing 90 lbs in 4 months, IV nutrition was the most effective diet ever.

3.  Over the course of a decade $5 million in health care costs is a reality for the uninsured.

4.  I wouldn’t be able to squeeze back into my cookie cutter life.

So when my doctor told me, “Be Prepared, this is what your life looks like going forward” I set out to prove her wrong. Two years later I had written my first manuscript that was recently picked up by a publisher, and I started creating my way to a new reality.


What We Need & What You Get

The book is done, and will be on store shelves come August 5th. So this fundraising campaign is for the ultramarathon book tour I have dreamed up. I mapped out a 20,000 mile cross-country book tour that hits all 100 top major book markets in America. That's like being in the driver's seat 24 hours a day for 16 days. I’ve been told by professionals that I was nuts and it can’t be done...challenge accepted. This entire project was never about money. It has always been about dreaming inconceivably big, the journey itself, and overcoming the adversity that comes with it.

This book tour will be taking place no matter what even if it means I have to sleep in the back of the car to conserve cash. So all funds collected are going to the book tour.

I don't think my little adventure will cure cancer, or end world hunger. However, I do believe that it may inspire someone else to believe that anything is possible who otherwise might not have, and he or she will be the one who changes the world.


The Impact

A portion of every book sold goes directly to Habitat for Humanity. My publisher has some kind of partnership because Habitat for Humanity’s logo is plastered on the book (I'm not sure if that is a local chapter or if it goes to the national organization. Sorry, I don't know how the organization operates).

For my part I’m making a personal donation to a different charity. I don’t have a formal partnership with them, and I don’t want to be halfway across America and find out their legal department is sitting on my doorstep so they will remain nameless. However, they are a great organization that is near and dear to my heart, and I have the utmost respect for what they do.

Risks & Challenges

When I look at the challenges of the tour they are: logistics, weather, and finances. I'm doing my best to mitigate the logistics and weather complications by preparing now. I have mapped out my entire trip so that I can stay ahead of the bad winter weather, and I'm scheduling my tour stops about two months in advance. Finances will be whatever is in the bank, and my credit cards' card limits.

There is only one real risk, and that this book tour could put me in the hospital. Normally I don't travel any further than 5 miles from my house. The last time I took a four day road trip it took me nearly a week to recover from it. So I don't know how this little adventure is going to affect me. The only thing that can really be done is monitor my conditions along the way, and pray that there are no unforeseen disasters. However, there is nothing that will keep me from attempting this feat.

Other Ways You Can Help

I would like for you to join the Spread the Love Campaign and share the name of the book "Average Joe's Story: Quest for Confidence" and what you’ve read here on social media. I’ve been told that Facebook and Twitter are the places to be, but I’m an equal opportunity message sharer that believes any share is a good share, regardless of where it is shared. So share away. I believe that Indiegogo has some tools that makes this sharing thing real easy to do. So share and share often!

Book Excerpt

"I am not rich, famous, or successful. I am not a titan of industry, a
world leader, or a superstar entertainer. What I am is an Average
Joe… the guy next door. I have an SUV with nearly 250,000 miles
valued less than the full synthetic oil I put into it to keep it running.
I lose sleep at night over finding ways to pay down the nearly $10,000
balance on my American Express card. I am embarrassed to say I am
in my thirties and I live at home with my parents. I stand 5’9” (5’10”
with the right pair of shoes on a really good day), and I am categorized
as overweight even though I carry it well. I spent six years in college,
and I struggle to find a job that pays more than $10 an hour even with
the framed degrees hanging on the wall. I am your neighbor down the
street, the guy sitting two cubicles down and on the right, and the guy
standing in front of you in line at McDonalds. I am Average Joe.

I am not some great author with years of experience. For the most
part, I don’t even like writing. But I know you can do anything you put
your mind to because I already did it. How do I know that about you?
Simple. You are reading my words. I have read plenty of self-help stories
from all kinds of successful people after they became successful. Donald
Trump has any number of books on how to turn a person into a real
estate tycoon, Jack Welch has a few on becoming a leader, and Zig Ziglar
wrote on success in life. This book is Average Joe’s journey traveling
down the road in search of confidence.

What is it about the superstar that differentiates them from you
and me? Have you dreamed of walking onto a stage to 70,000 people
chanting your name so loudly that the vibrations register as a minor
earthquake on the Richter scale? Watching from the stage and listening
to that massive crowd sing your lyrics back to you. What does it take to
be the superstar?

First things first: what is confidence? Webster’s Dictionary defines
confidence as, “a feeling or consciousness of one’s powers, or of reliance
on one’s circumstances.” It also refers to confidence as the quality or
state of being certain. I used a small test group in a Toastmasters club
in Florida to discover how the average person might define confidence.
They basically stated that in their opinions confidence was being able to
comfortably project an aura of certainty because of the familiarity and
knowledge one might have on a specific subject.

There are many questions people have about confidence: how do
you get it? How do you lose it? Why does it matter? I tried answering
those questions for myself, and I was not altogether satisfied with my
responses. What I came up with seemed so simple that I second-guessed
the validity of my own answers."

story:
Story of My Book

 

bedfellows is a coming-of-age story that explores love, and what being with someone and loving them means, beyond the romance and intimacy we expect.

I wrote this book because I wanted to explore and try to understand the complexities of wanting someone and being with them—what it means to be in love, what it means to be in a relationship. In my own experience, it’s never been as cut and dry as the romances that exist portray and I hope this book serves as a look into the real-life complexities of relationships. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the nuanced and raw chaos underneath the surface of relationships and romance. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to wonder and explore what being with someone means, begin to understand what identity and the constant pursuit of who we are really is, and ask questions about what we believe love is, what we’re taught it should be, and what we really truly want it to be beyond that.

The book follows an Indian-American girl, Kash, throughout her teenage years into her early twenties, and navigates the unknowns of falling in love and attraction through her eyes. It’s not easy, and it’s wrought with teenage wanting, attraction, and the visceral confusion of not knowing who she is or what she wants. The story is punctuated by moments where Kash shares a bed with certain people in her life and how sharing such a vulnerable space with someone changes her relationship with them.

If you enjoy exploring the more metaphysical, philosophical side of love and intimacy and unconventional romance as well as the relatable inner chaos of growing up (with copious amounts of angst), then I think you'll enjoy this book.

bedfellows speaks to new adult and coming-of-age readers who want to grapple with both the complexities of growing up and defining ourselves to others, and intimacy—what it means to be with someone and the different ways we fall in love—in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that bedfellowsinspires you to think, challenge, and engage with questions like:

How do we (and do we ever) ‘grow up’ as individuals? 

How do we know what we want? And how do our wants and desires define us?

Can romance and/or attraction be more than just platonic or physical?

What are the different ways we express love, in all its forms?

How does the intimacy and vulnerability of sharing a personal space (i.e. a bed or bedroom, a car, a childhood escape, etc.) affect the way we connect with others?

 

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with you! I believe discussing, and realizing how different our answers are to these questions, will change us all for the better. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in Winter 2020 through Spring 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this late Spring 2021

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

 

Nivita Chaliki is a current student at Parsons School of Design in New York, and an artist of many mediums within various genres and areas all of which she simplifies into one word; storyteller. 
Her work is much informed by her experiences navigating identity and culture as an Indian-American girl, as well as a personal creativity with which she tries challenge the norms she sees around her. She loves to get caught up in the wonder of the human mind, and often finds herself within the gray areas of philosophy and design, questioning and learning wherever she can.

She began writing ‘bedfellows’ through a curiosity to dig deeper into what it means to be in a relationship with someone and how we define what we want as individuals. Inspired by her own experiences and inner struggles with translating conventional romance into real-life relationships, finding who she wants to be, and her own conflicting identity growing up as an Indian-American, Nivita wanted to tell this story to try and narrate the visceral tension and chaos of being young and trying to understand what we want both from ourselves and others. She hopes this book also contributes to a lacking but growing space of representation for South Asian diaspora, and their stories.

For more information, you can connect with Nivita Chaliki at nchaliki@yahoo.com and @nivitachaliki on Instagram. Please reach out if you have any questions, concerns, or just general wonderments!

 

Risks & Challenges

 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #bedfellows and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page!

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!!

I truly appreciate it and hope to keep you all updated as the process continues. 

Thank you again,
Nivita Chaliki
story_txt:
Story of My Book bedfellows is a coming-of-age story that explores love, and what being with someone and loving them means, beyond the romance and intimacy we expect.I wrote this book because I wanted to explore and try to understand the complexities of wanting someone and being with them—what it means to be in love, what it means to be in a relationship. In my own experience, it’s never been as cut and dry as the romances that exist portray and I hope this book serves as a look into the real-life complexities of relationships. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the nuanced and raw chaos underneath the surface of relationships and romance. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to wonder and explore what being with someone means, begin to understand what identity and the constant pursuit of who we are really is, and ask questions about what we believe love is, what we’re taught it should be, and what we really truly want it to be beyond that.The book follows an Indian-American girl, Kash, throughout her teenage years into her early twenties, and navigates the unknowns of falling in love and attraction through her eyes. It’s not easy, and it’s wrought with teenage wanting, attraction, and the visceral confusion of not knowing who she is or what she wants. The story is punctuated by moments where Kash shares a bed with certain people in her life and how sharing such a vulnerable space with someone changes her relationship with them.If you enjoy exploring the more metaphysical, philosophical side of love and intimacy and unconventional romance as well as the relatable inner chaos of growing up (with copious amounts of angst), then I think you'll enjoy this book.bedfellows speaks to new adult and coming-of-age readers who want to grapple with both the complexities of growing up and defining ourselves to others, and intimacy—what it means to be with someone and the different ways we fall in love—in a new way.Ultimately, I hope that bedfellowsinspires you to think, challenge, and engage with questions like:How do we (and do we ever) ‘grow up’ as individuals? How do we know what we want? story:
This is my wonderful son, Johnny. He is 15 years old and is special needs. God has given me many blessings but Johnny is the greatest one of all! I only have my income to support the two of us. We struggle to make ends meet. I'm doing whatever it takes to give him everything which he needs. However, the van that we have now is old and is needing many more repairs that I simply cannot afford. The A/C isn't working, the engine needs a lot of work, and we have been trying to fix a multitude of electrical problems over the last few years. Johnny's respiratory and neurological issues demand that he be kept cool (<70 degrees) at all times. When he gets overheated, he has difficulty breathing, his seizures increase and he is already ventilator dependent. More than once we have missed appointments due to the van breaking down. I was raised to not ask for help, but I don't know what else to do at this point. I cannot risk his health and I can't maintain our day to day bills while putting so much money into our present van.

Johnny’s wheelchair weighs 100 lbs and he deserves to have reliable transportation. Due to the changes in Medicaid coverage, even more of his medications and treatments are no longer covered. I have avidly been looking for reliable wheelchair vans but being a single parent (we lost his father to liver cancer in 2009), our finances are squeezed to the limit and it’s much more than I can provide for him. What a blessing it would be to give him what I can’t do alone. I work as hard as possible to try and let him experience as many things a “normal” boy gets to do. There are so many things he has yet to experience in life but isn’t able to because of our personal transportation needs. The more outings and stimulation he has, the better he thrives and the higher his quality of life is for him!

Please donate for Johnny’s new van and help me to improve his life!

My son is my heart, my life, and my entire world. And please, if you are not able to donate, pray for our cause because I believe God answers prayers, Amen!

Short Summary

Johnny’s story begins with a hypoxic brain injury caused by the umbilical cord begin wrapped around his neck during birth so his birthday came via emergency c-section. Johnny is a 15 year old quadriplegic with scoliosis, brittle bones and contractures. He eats through a mic-key button and breathes through a trach. He’s has over 17 diagnoses which include: cerebral palsy, seizures, cortical blindness, moderate hearing loss, sleep apnea, dysphasia and chronic respiratory distress and is currently ventilator dependent.

In spite of all this, he’s a happy, loving young man. He loves to get out of the house and go places and meet people! He enjoys going to church, movies and playing on the Buddy League, a local baseball league for children with special needs. He’s ridden horses, gone fishing and even co-piloted an airplane. He attends vacation bible school each summer.

Although he can’t walk, talk or even move independently, he’s touched more lives than I ever dreamed possible. He’s absolutely the strongest person I’ve every known, always a source of inspiration and unconditional love for me and everyone who knows him. Johnny has endured repeated hospitalizations throughout his life and has never shed a tear even when he broke his leg (he’s had both femurs broken at separate times).

Being able to afford a new wheelchair van with "artic" a/c would be just what the doctor ordered.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask your family and friends to help and get the word out and pass on the information about my little campaign.

story:
¿Qué?

Entre todas las mujeres es una novela de corte psicológico donde cada nuevo descubrimiento abre una nueva interrogante, cuando no son más...

La abogada Verónica Reina, acuciada por las deudas de su despacho, acepta representar a Alejandro Hinojosa, imputado por un delito de pederastia.  La historia adquiere un tono sombrío y misterioso desde el momento en que Alejandro defiende su inocencia ante su abogada al declararse víctima de una maniobra de extorsión hacia su persona por parte de los padres de las dos niñas a las que presuntamente ha agredido y abusado sexualmente. Con su encarcelación  se pretende evitar la revelación de una información comprometida sobre malversación de fondos perpetrada en una fundación ultra católica de la que él es un miembro destacado y cuya gestión está a cargo precisamente de los denunciantes.

Durante la investigación llevada a cabo por el equipo de la abogada se va desentrañando una obscura trama cuyo génesis se remonta a los tiempos más duros del nacional-catolicismo, con casos de bebes robados y pederastia y cuyos destellos, en la actualidad, continúan cegando una realidad irresoluta. El resultado es una galería de espejos deformados por el que desfilaban personajes de otros tiempos y actores de un  presente putrefacto devastado por la corrupción. El relato está marcado por una serie de misteriosos asesinatos,  y culmina con un desenlace impactante que, inesperadamente nos hace torcer la mirada hasta el Vaticano y  la Santa Sede.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Javier Colomer.

Nacido en París en 1967 se trasladó con dos meses al pueblo valenciano de Alboraya. Es doctor en Bellas Artes y ejercer como profesor de diseño en la Escuela de Diseño de Castellón. En 1997, se trasladó a vivir a Bétera, donde tiene su estudio.

Aunque ante todo se considera pintor, escribe cuentos y poesía desde hace más de 30 años. Tanto la literatura como la pintura las considera diferentes plataformas sobre las que reposa una misma inquietud, un movimiento imprescindible impelido por la curiosidad y el interés por el alma humana.  

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Entre todas las mujeres que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Javier Colomer vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
ALAPÁS

Durante más de 17 años, en la Alianza Laura Aponte por la Paz Social (ALAPÁS) nos hemos dedicado, en cuerpo y alma, a defender los derechos de las víctimas de delito y, además, hemos sido su apoyo y acompañantes en su proceso de recuperación. Nuestro Centro de Ayuda a Víctimas ALAPÁS es el lugar en que las personas que han perdido un ser querido víctima de un asesinato u homicidio saben que pueden llegar y serán escuchadas, respetadas y atendidas con diversos servicios.

Apoyo a Víctimas

Estos servicios que las víctimas de delito reciben gratuitamente incluyen terapia individual, de pareja o familiar, grupo de apoyo, orientación legal, además las  acompañamos al tribunal e intercedemos por ellas ante agencias de gobiernos. Desde hace dos años, nuestro Centro de Ayuda a Víctimas recibe también víctimas de otros delitos graves como robo, escalamiento, agresión y secuestro.

Los otros proyectos de ALAPÁS

ALAPÁS, además del Centro de Ayuda a Víctimas, que es el proyecto que mejor se conoce porque brinda servicios directos, tiene otros proyectos a través de los cuales aportamos al bienestar de las víctimas y el país. Estos son:

  1. Bosque de los Siemprevivos: Este proyecto nació del compromiso con nuestro medioambiente. Tomamos un terreno que había sido arrasado con máquinas y lo comenzamos a reforestar sembrando árboles en memoria de nuestros hijos e hijas fallecidos. De esta manera se une la terapia con la conservación de la naturaleza.
  2. ALAPÁS Educa: Con el proyecto educativo buscamos brindar adiestramientos tanto a víctimas o público general como a profesionales, sobre temas como el proceso de duelo por muertes violentas, el perdón, como acompañar a una persona que ha sufrido una pérdida, cómo manejar los días festivos sin el ser querido, entre otros. Además, hemos ya publicado nueve números de la primera revista digital que trata temas sociales desde la perspectiva de las víctimas: ALAPÁS: La Revista.
  3. ALAPÁS en la Comunidad- Con este proyecto comunitario comenzamos a acercarnos a las comunidades que necesitan nuestros servicios, pero no pueden llegar al Centro. Nuestra primera incursión fue en Vieques. Nos solicitaron ir a la isla nena porque en un año habían asesinado 14 personas. Así que fuimos y coordinamos un Grupo de Apoyo. Este año replicamos el proyecto en Guayama.  ALAPÁS en la Comunidad incluye también Tacita de Café, inspirado en el Premio Solidaridad con el que nos galardonaron en 2010. Tiene como propósito cultivar la hermandad y fomentar la solidaridad en la comunidad y entre las organizaciones sin fines de lucro para gestar alianzas positivas de transformación, solidaridad y paz. Entre las alianzas en las que formamos parte están GRUCORPO, que es un grupo de trabajo de varias organizaciones para garantizar la participación comunitaria independiente en la reforma de la Policía, y la Coalición Puertorriqueña Contra la Pena de Muerte.

La campaña Da una Mano por la PAZ

El dinero recogido en esta campaña Da una Mano por la Paz será utilizado para continuar los trabajos de los proyectos. 

Solidaridad con la Tacita de Café

Este año, en nuestra campaña Da Una Mano por la Paz, contamos con la solidaridad de un grupo de ceramistas, que nos han donado unas tazas, que utilizaremos como regalitos de agradecimiento en ciertas categorías de donaciones. Las tazas fueron hechas a mano y en el torno alfarero, usando porcelana y quemadas a alta temperatura. Participaron las ceramistas Beatriz Fernández, Eduardo Tapia, Sandra Guillermety, Nora Álvarez y Aileen Castañeda - presidenta de Casa Candina (http://www.casacandina.org/es/). Contamos además con la colaboración del ceramista estadounidense Dan Zulawski (http://www.danzulawski.smugmug.com/), quien nos donó el set de tres piezas. Con estas piezas, el grupo de ceramistas se conecta con el sentido de comunidad de ALAPÁS y su proyecto Tacita de Café.

Nosotros tenemos el compromiso y la voluntad de seguir trabajando. Tú también puedes ser parte de este proyecto de transformación del dolor en solidaridad y paz aportando a esta campaña. Te invitamos a Dar una mano por la PAZ, con la cantidad que puedas. Cada centavo cuenta. ¡Contamos contigo!

ALAPÁS en la Comunidad- Con este proyecto comunitario comenzamos a acercarnos a
     las comunidades que necesitan nuestros servicios, pero no pueden llegar al
     Centro. Nuestra primera incursión fue en Vieques. Nos solicitaron ir a la
     isla nena porque en un año habían asesinado 14 personas. Así que fuimos y
     coordinamos un Grupo de Apoyo. Este año replicamos el proyecto en Guayama.  ALAPÁS en la Comunidad incluye también
     Tacita de Café, inspirado en el Premio Solidaridad con el que nos
     galardonaron en 2010. Tiene como propósito cultivar la hermandad y
     fomentar la solidaridad en la comunidad y entre las organizaciones sin
     fines de lucro para gestar alianzas positivas de transformación,
     solidaridad y paz. Entre las alianzas en las que formamos parte están
     GRUCORPO, que es un grupo de trabajo de varias organizaciones para
     garantizar la participación comunitaria independiente en la reforma de la
     Policía, y la Coalición Puertorriqueña Contra la Pena de Muerte.


La
campaña Da una Mano por la PAZ 
El dinero recogido en esta campaña Da una
Mano por la Paz será utilizado para continuar los trabajos de los proyectos.  

Solidaridad
con la Tacita de Café
Este año, en nuestra campaña Da Una Mano
por la Paz, contamos con la solidaridad de un grupo de ceramistas, que nos han
donado unas tazas, que utilizaremos como regalitos de agradecimiento en ciertas
categorías de donaciones. Las tazas fueron hechas a mano y en el torno
alfarero, usando porcelana y quemadas a alta temperatura. Participaron las
ceramistas Beatriz Fernández, Eduardo Tapia, Sandra Guillermety, Nora Álvarez y
Aileen Castañeda - presidenta de Casa Candina (http://www.casacandina.org/es/).
Contamos además con la colaboración del ceramista estadounidense Dan Zulawski (http://www.danzulawski.smugmug.com/),
quien nos donó el set de tres piezas. Con estas piezas, el grupo de ceramistas
se conecta con el sentido de comunidad de ALAPÁS y su proyecto Tacita de Café.
Nosotros tenemos el compromiso y la
voluntad de seguir trabajando. Tú también puedes ser parte de este proyecto de
transformación del dolor en solidaridad y paz aportando a esta campaña. Te
invitamos a Dar una mano por la PAZ, con la cantidad que puedas. Cada centavo
cuenta. ¡Contamos contigo!

story:
Important Update: I am floored by all your support! It took me half the time I thought it would to reach my goal, and I've already received double the traffic I expected. Though I have reached $5,000, I feel obliged to keep this momentum going, if only to continue getting the word out about the writers and publishers I'm so proud to call part of my community. A stretch goal of $6,200 would make it easier for me to afford both residencies and continue spreading the word about books, publishers and authors I know you'll love (and remember, anything that doesn't go to residency expenses goes to the Alzheimer's Association). Let's keep it up!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Wait, Woodstock? Why would we send you to Woodstock? 

The Woodstock Byrdcliffe Guild—a collection of artists and artistic patrons in upstate New York that's been around since 1902—has offered me an Artist-in-Residence spot for June. This means I get to go write for a month on their property, which is not only very cool of them, but also a huge honor (and sidenote, if you're a nerd like me, their history is fascinating.)

There's also a possibility I will get another residency at another location later this year, but sadly, I won't know until it's too late to raise money for it.

A few months ago, I finished a rough draft of my novel. This opportunity—or these opportunities—will allow me to get my draft into workable shape. And right now, for so many reasons I'll discuss below, I'm going all in. Getting my book into workable shape means everything to me.

The good news is they're puttin' me up. They bad news is that's all they can cover. All this opportunity is coming after a very tough year for me. That means I can't do any of this without you.

(This is what it looks like when I edit. Here are some testimonials from clients.)

Who Are You?

I'm a writer, editor, and teacher. My writing has appeared in Best Sex Writing, The Rumpus, Guernica, PANK, and elsewhere, and it has been listed as notable in The Best American Essays. I’ve been awarded fellowships by The Jentel Artist Residency Program and the Lambda Literary Foundation, and I teach at Antioch University Los Angeles and Writing Workshops Los Angeles.

My MFA at Antioch University Los Angeles got me set on the path of writing with a social justice bent, and my work has covered issues from mental illness to school violence to sexuality to the perils of having a neo-Nazi cousin. You can find some of my writing here. The novel I'm working on features goblins, domestic terrorism and Hello Dolly, and my memoir is about what it was like to be raised by four child psychologists. My favorite thing is to get lost in a story, and I think that writing about things that matter doesn’t mean getting didactic or losing the human experience. I try to write pieces that are fun and that hopefully will change the world for the better.

(Here I am reading at the Lambda Literary Emerging Voices Retreat) 


What Does This Have To Do With Transforming Your Life?

I’m a lucky chap. I do what I love for a living. I get to edit books, I get to teach some of the most passionate and talented students I’ve ever seen, and I even, very occasionally, get paid to write.

But all isn't gravy. Real talk: I’m stuck. I’m treading water. I'm a gerbil on a wheel, a cat with its head stuck in a vase. I'm Winnie the Pooh high on honey, my butt stuck in Rabbit's front door. I'm Andre the Giant trying to squeeze out the window of a submarine. 


As you freelancers and adjuncts out there know, there's a cost to doing what we love. We work 60-90 hours a week, have unreliable income, impossibly expensive healthcare, and student loan bills that there's nothing to do but laugh at.  On top of all this, I've had some really difficult news in my family in the last few months.

All that work and pressure makes it really hard to finish a book, especially a book that’s any good. I got into this because I wanted to write books, but now here I am, without the time or energy to do so. And at the same time, I'm told that one of the only ways out—or at the very least a bare minimum to start clawing my way out—is to finish that book. 

And this is why I'm coming to you. In 2015, I will bring a working version of this book to life, or I will die trying. Not because I have to, mind you, or because I think it will magically solve all my life problems (trust me, I know it won't), but because it has been trying to come out for a long, long time. And it's time I let it. 

Help Keep Independent Writers, Teachers, and Publishers Alive

I've been a part of the independent writing community for nearly a decade now: first as a student, and then as a teacher, editor, and writer. What inspires me the most about this culture is the nearly universal sense of togetherness and integrity I see everywhere I go. It's not about money, fame, or the bottom line. It's about creating a community that believes in writing as something that is transformative, something that encourages empathy, something that is bigger than any one of us and that has the power to get people to stop being such assholes to one another all the time.

(Here I am dressed like Giles for Lisa Cheby's poetry release for Love Lessons from Buffy the Vampire Slayer)

A handmade journal by Jamie Moore (see perks!)

This residency will allow me to come back to this community stronger and re-energized, ready to give back even more. It's my hope that this campaign will help spread the word about the incredible people and organizations I've listed in my perks (and those folks are only the tip of the iceberg!). It is a testament to how close-knit and supportive our community is that all of these people have come together to support me. Even if you don't decide to donate today, check out organizations like Writing Workshops LA, Red Hen Press, Counterpoint, Dzanc Books, Rare Bird Lit, Unknown Press, Writ Large, Foreverland Press, Unnamed Press, Antioch University Los Angeles, and the countless other small presses and educational institutions that are spreading the radical idea that writing means something.

What's The Money For Again?

My friends who are not in the arts are always shocked to find out that most artistic fellowships and residencies don't actually put any money in your bank account. These  organizations are running on tight budgets, and they're lucky to be able to afford to house us. So we have to pay for transportation, sometimes food, and all those bills that build up while we're working very hard writing but not getting paid for it.

So I'll be straightforward and lay it all out for you. Here is my expense list:

Not Making the Love of My Life Ashley Perez Homeless (and having a place to come home to after I leave Woodstock): $1000 (including all utilities) 

Travel expenses: $700

Sustenance: $300

Health Insurance and Medical Expenses: $400

Not Defaulting on My Loans: $400

Having an Insured Car To Come Back To So I Can Get Back To Work: $300

Phone and Tech Expenses: $150

Indiegogo-related expenses (shipping, their cut, etc.): $500

Miscellaneous: $250

Total: $4,000

Remember, it is looking very possible that there will be another residency, so I am asking for just $1,000 more than my expenses for one month, but way less than it would cost to attend two residencies (If that happens, I guess I'll just figure that out when I come to it).
 If the second residency does not happen, or if I can figure out ways to do this even more on the cheap, I will donate any extra non-residency related expenses to the Alzheimer's Association.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just don't have any money? Me neither! Can I ask you to help out by sharing this with your friends who might be into this sort of thing?

story:
Imagine if you could read the same secret intelligence-report that the allied commanders Dwight D. Eisenhower, Omar Bradley, and Bernard Montgomery used to plan D-Day. 

Soon you can. 

We are bringing to life the original Neptune Monograph, a top-secret intelligence report from World War 2 that only exists in a few copies today. It has never been published and almost disappeared from history after the war, but we are now restoring the pages of one of the most important documents of WW2. 

After a very successful Kickstarter-campaign, we have decided to give new backers the opportunity to secure their copy of the Monograph here on IndieGoGo.

The original 112 pages contained thorough information about everything from tidal forces to typical battle tactics and had the absolute highest security stamp during WW2: Top Secret Bigot - above Top Secret.

It described the German defenses and typical strongpoints, the risk of chemical attacks and was so thorough it even had an analysis of the soil type on Utah and Omaha Beach.

 

The book will contain a one-to-one copy of the original Monograph, new historical context and rare photos to explore. 

in total app 250 pages in hardcover including the original Monograph, added historical context and rare photos.

 

We will restore every single page from 1944 to its original look as it was presented in the Neptune Monograph. 

 

 

The original Monograph will run on the right page throughout the book. Here you get a rare insight into the depth of the incredible intelligence work and literally cast your eyes on the same pages, that the allied command got in their hand for the first time six weeks before D-Day.

 

 

Originally some of the left pages were blank. Here commanders could add their notes and latest updates. We have decided to use this space to give a deeper understanding of the Monograph and add historical context and rare photos on the left pages of the book to explore and get the full picture of how the information was collected.

 

The Neptune Monograph was split into nine sections giving a deep and rare insight into the situation in Normandy six weeks before D-Day. All nine chapters will be in the book. 

The Monograph has more than 14 pages of charts, maps, and graphics showing predicted German troop movements, tidal charts, and graphics of the layout of typical German strongpoints in Normandy as well as charts of the naval threat from warships and mines. The maps, charts, and folios will be restored and printed in the book in full color.

Henrik Elling has worked for more than 15 years teaching history and as an Editor in Chief at Scandinavia's best selling history- and science magazines. In his job, he has developed and launched hundreds of magazines and more than a dozen books about history covering everything from Stonehenge to World War 2. Today he is the founder of Duckwood Media, that specializes in launching unique history books via crowdfunding.

German-born Andrea Jepp has worked for more than 15 years as an Art Director and Graphic Designer on some of Denmarks most popular magazines and newspapers incl. leading finance-paper Børsen. In her spare time, she is a talented artist with a special love for painting collages and creating posters.

This document is a unique testimonial and insight into the risks, challenges, and fears the allied force faced before the invasion as well as a testimonial to the incredible work by allied intelligence units before D-Day. 

It was compiled - with extreme risk - by commandos, naval intelligence, French resistance groups, air surveillance and weather and astronomical experts. 

Today only a few full copies exist worldwide and by reproducing this book we preserve one of World War 2s most important historical documents and make it available for a broader audience for the first time since it was finished in April 1944 and in time for the 75th anniversary in 2019. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Lean back and enjoy your copy of one of the most unique World War 2 books ever made delivered in time for Christmas. 

 

Risks are low. 

In his job as an author and former Editor in Chief Henrik has been responsible for more than a hundred history magazines and more than a handful of books before, so he knows the process and what to do. 

Andrea has more than a decade of experience as an Art Director and knows exactly how to work with the reproduction and what quality is needed for the printing process.

On this project, we work with trustworthy people that we have known for several years and that have the expertise to produce the product we want - on a deadline.

The thorough scanning process is complete and the work on the restoration and layout has begun. 

The printing will be done in a reputable printing facility in Latvia, which is specialized in book printing. They are easy to communicate with and delivers outstanding quality. 

The fulfillment is done by professional companies, who have done excellent handling before. They will be responsible for sending most of the books out.

story:
About Me (And the Current Covers)

I'm a full-time science fiction author residing in Bozeman, MT. I've released three books (all part of the Dawn Saga):

     

The fourth and final book of the series is set to publish in 2019. I've also released several short stories in the Dawn universe, as well as a couple unrelated titles (all of which you can find on my website).

Writing is my passion, and I love the Dawn Saga and its cast of characters. I've put a lot of heart and soul into these books! As time has gone on, I feel like my author-created covers are holding me back from reaching a broader audience. I want my covers to convey the mood of the stories inside, to make people want to pick them up and read!

Unfortunately, my vision for the covers goes beyond my talent and style, and I'm unable to make them a reality. I'm working with a fantastic artist, Tyler Ellis, who is bringing my ideas to life.

The New Covers

Tyler and I started by collaborating on the cover image for Breakers of the Dawn:

In the coming months, we'll be working through the covers of Harbingers, Destroyers, and the yet-to-be-released 4th book.

 

Why I Need Your Help

Tyler's rate is extremely competitive and well deserved. Covers are $300 each, with an additional $200 for taxes and other fees. Because writing is my profession, I want my series to convey that with quality cover art.

If I don't achieve my crowdfunding goal, I will still go forward with the project, and your donations will help offset costs. In the event we exceed the goal (yay!), I'll put the additional money towards future expenses of promoting the series.

By making a contribution, you are helping both the Dawn Saga and my career take a huge step forward. With these exciting covers, my sales and visibility will increase exponentially, both for the digital and paperback versions.

 

To Show My Appreciation

In addition to my priceless, undying gratitude, I want to reward everyone who supports me. This will take the form of eBooks and autographed paperbacks (with the new covers, of course), as well as commissioned short stories. I'm also offering prints of the new cover art.

 

Other Ways To Help

Know someone who loves sci-fi? Shoot them a link! Or, make a donation on their behalf and I will send your reward to them. Sharing this campaign on social media is also a great way to help out.

story:
The Latest
 

Thanks so much for your support of Betrayal - The Ethel Rosenberg Story. 

We have met the $8,000 goal! This provides the funding necessary for the final production of the soft-cover AND hard-cover copies of the book,  as well as an audiobook version. Your generosity is making this happen, and I could not be more grateful to each of you for giving me the opportunity to give voice to this important story. 

Once the book is published this April, it will be available on Amazon,  Barnes and Noble, and a variety of other bookselling sites and locations.  Please feel free to email this link:

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/betrayal-the...

to your friends and to anyone you think may be interested in the story. One of the best elements of this campaign is that it creates creates a community of collaboration and support, so I welcome your thoughts and guidance during the process.

Thank you again for your love and support!

-Alisa Parenti
 

The Story

Betrayal - The Ethel Rosenberg Story is a fictionalized account of the only woman executed by the U.S. government on charges related to espionage in more than 150 years.

My name is Alisa Parenti, and I wrote this book because in all that’s been written about the case, Ethel is portrayed either as completely innocent of conspiracy to commit espionage or as a spymaster working directly for the Soviet Union.

In reading Betrayal, you will discover that Ethel Rosenberg did not get a fair trial. As Ethel was  accused of betraying her country, she suffered betrayals of her own --  by her family, by the government and by society at large. This book provides an opportunity to engage with themes of hope and betrayal, and learn alongside Mary Wurth, a fictional reporter who tells Ethel’s story about staying true to one’s beliefs, and about the very high price people sometimes pay to do so. 

My hope is that lovers of historical fiction will enjoy being transported back to the middle part of the last century in this book. Spy aficionados will revel in the context of the Cold War era, and students of current tensions between the United States and Russia could gain a deeper understanding of the relationship between these two countries. Betrayal also speaks to history buffs and scholars of women in history who want to examine the changing perspectives of women over time.

Ultimately, I hope that Betrayal inspires meaningful dialogue and the opportunity to reflect on questions, including:

  • How does one reconcile the different demands and pressures an individual faces as a parent and as a member of the world community?
  • How can we better navigate the betrayals of our own lives, when our beliefs and dreams don’t match reality?
  • What happens when our allies become our enemies, and when the opposite happens too?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!

Our Path Forward

My book will be published by New Degree Press. Money raised through your purchases will go towards the following:

  • The editors who will work with me to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts surrounding my book when it is published this spring.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for friends like you who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About the Author

Alisa Parenti, an award-winning journalist, has been a reporter, anchor and storyteller for more than three decades. She is a prolific reader of true crime.

Alisa was drawn to the story of the Rosenbergs initially as it was one of the biggest crime stories in our country’s history. Researching the topic, she encountered a lot of ambiguity in the case against Ethel Rosenberg. Alisa realized that much of what happened during the years of Ethel’s life, from 1915 - 1953, still resonates today. Many are still concerned about the unequal treatment of women, the polarizing debate of capitalism versus socialism, and about growing nationalism in the United States and around the globe.

In addition to her work in journalism, Alisa has served as an adjunct faculty member at Georgetown University teaching undergraduate and graduate coursework in multimedia journalism and news writing. In 2011, she was honored with the Outstanding Faculty Award from Georgetown.

Alisa is a graduate of Northwestern University's School of Communication and earned a Master's Degree from Northwestern's Medill School of Journalism. She and her husband Jim are the parents of two young women. It is her deepest hope that a closer examination of these issues can help improve the lives of her daughters and the world around them.

For more information, you can connect with Alisa at alisaparenti@gmail.com and at @alisaparenti on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and LinkedIn.
