story:
My website died with a piece of my heart last year....It was a hobby/branding experiment pleasantly interrupted by becoming an acupuncturist out in the real world.

I believe I have a message to put out there about spirituality, channeling, and personal branding online that will allow the benefits of holistic medicine to reach the mainstream culture in a very dynamic and healing way. 

Of course this has involved putting my own life, my own spiritual process into the mix of this great entrepreneurial experiment - working with all the things I was interested in and all the images and ideas I wanted to do in my life to undo old patterns and forge ahead with my ideas and this nagging feeling that there was something bigger I needed to be doing with them. 

I knew I would need a website and blog to let out my ideas.  What to say of spirit guides, this 'oneness' stuff and the time-space continuum that didn't garner a doubtful, strange or cynical look?

Or of US culture in all its faults as it pertained to nutrition, wellness and health. Or about the culture and methodology of start-ups, creating something new that's never been done before? All of it came with a bit of challenge to the status quo that most people in their belief systems, was too much.

It is still going to take me a lot of writing and research to take something as esoteric and topical such as spirituality something didactic and useful for the holistic practitioner or entrepreneur in everyday life, in the modus operandi. 

I need a website to leverage this AND OTHER powerful and wonderful information to clients, patients, friends, and followers among all the various social media platforms I frequent and all the fun I want to show to everyone of the real me, my story, and how I know spiritual growth and meditation is THE best route to riches, happiness, love, and purpose.


I come in the form of many previous teachers: Eckhart Tolle, Abraham-Hicks, Gabrielle Bernstein, Deepak Chopra, Pema Chodron, Marie Forleo, Danielle LaPorte, Doreen Virtue (self-help, religion, meditation and spirituality authors) Nancy Grace (my college beat literature professor - a lot of inspiration for this came from the bohemian files of the beats), Joanne Frye (my college thesis advisor for my thesis "The Word Made Flesh: Memoirs in Feminist Motherhood"), Dianne Connelly, Bob Duggan, Ivan Illich, Celeste Homan, Heidi Most, Thyme Gigliotti, Jeffrey Yuen (acupuncture professors/scholars), Jonathan Goldman, Liora Hill, and authors of the Earthlife series of channeled works,  Sanaya Roman & Duane Packer. Pagan tomes as well.

I aim to help creative entrepreneurs and empaths incorporate spirituality into life without risking their personal identity or personal brand. These courses would be meditation-based for people to learn how to shield negativity and intuitive overwhelm in order to build a personal brand into a career and lifestyle with life-skills to boot.



My new branding and coaching program will grow to include a course of e-books and personal one on one and group seminars for people to learn about their own intuitive skills and healing abilities.

The money I am asking for includes recouping lindsaymacdougall.com for rebranding, taking an Angel Oracle Card Certification course and paying for my board exams to practice in DC.

Overall this is going to contribute to a program that is part coaching, part spirituality, and 100% wellness oriented.

Each one of us has a very unique purpose. We are being called to make a bigger impact on the world and to follow our dreams. We deserve to feel alive and excited about our work and to be able to build a life and a lifestyle that supports that and allows us to be fully free in ourselves and our self-expression to the world.

As an entrepreneur, I understand what it's like to feel like there is something bigger out there that would use more of our intellect, our creativity, and our expertise that we feel deeply needs to get out there be recognized in the world. 

Teaching about the Law of Attraction while using simple channeling, soul retrieval, meditation and journaling techniques, these tools have proven to accelerate personal growth, strengthen intuitive skills and clear old patterns to empower a meaningful life with inspirational style.

I have always wanted to run a spiritually-based business. In fact my blog was started two years ago towards that initiative. It was first a hobby for my writing, to teach and to learn more deeply about what I love talking about with people all the time.

The blog had posts with titles like "When Your Source of Inspiration Is Yourself," "Subconscious Mind and Law of Attraction," & "Allow Me To Solve All Your Problems," generating lots of comments and 'likes' for my newsletter and various social media sites.

Each post concluded with 'Action Steps' for people to use the information in their life right then, usually of a personal log with a meditation. 

In future posts I plan to incorporate my own personal stories and experiences for people to understand how powerful we can manifest effortless change, and how well we can heal with nature and mother earth, and the healthy support of each other! 

As I write my first book about the subjects that get me the most, you will receive plenty of freebies, course material, or talk.

I have a least ten thousand dollars worth of investment towards marketing and business skills (in addition to my master's training in acupuncture!) to successfully launch a coaching course online, for healing and lifestyle wellness -- it will be called my "Holistic Health Makeover Course"!!!

I actually love marketing and social media and am constantly working with personal branding and what that means and how to do it for life and for business.

When the website comes up, I plan for it be Sweet, I will continue to update my weekly blogs and video-logs, with more professional media. And I also will use the site to sell my first e-book!!! I am really excited about this expansion and all the money I collect from this campaign is going to go towards making these things streamlined for upcoming programs and offerings.

I hope you will donate right now to be part of something big.

AMOUNT REQUESTED INCLUDES:

1. Paying my former web designer

For his time and services and the amount it cost to have that domain name for a year.

2. Hiring a new web designer

For the person I choose, I am envisioning something super chic, simple, classic, with a bit of the bohemian. Of course well-curated images you know I'm good for. Also looking at having it with mobile-friendly features.

3. One two-hour session with a photographer

There need to be professional photos of myself for people to see on my website and various media to equivocate my brand.

4. The cost of an Angel Intuitive Certification Course in Orange County in October with my Angel mentor and love Doreen Virtue from HayHouse Publishing: http://www.hayhouse.com/angel-intuitive-orange-county-2015-event 

I have been following her religiously for years but have never been to one of her live events. She just recently retired from doing tours so going out to California will be the one opportunity I need to take advantage of this special course and its material! I already feel a strong calling to learn and teach about angels and divine messages and intuition as it is, and this will really help expand as well as ground me to one of the most important aspects of my business I am seeking to teach people and incorporate into my brand at this time.

5. Taking the national board exams ($600 sums up two modules) to acquire my license to practice in DC. I need to register and pay for these to hold my place on the calendar and have a deadline from which to pace my studying.

I HAVE ALREADY from this list Manifested my MAC COMPUTER which is so sweet -- THANK YOU KATE!!!! And other various improvements which you can see on this recent newsletter:





My practice is expanding in exciting ways and I am so glad you will be a part of it! As I create new products and information, downloadable meditations, you will be the first to receive these - for FREE !! - as a token of my sincerest gratitude!!!

story:
¿Qué?

El verde de las lápidas nos aproxima a la muerte, a través de sus personajes, en un intento de acercarnos a su normalización...

La calle de al lado del cementerio. Casas desde cuyas ventanas se ven las lápidas. Un joven en paro que ha vivido toda su vida en una de ellas con sus abuelos. Una idea de negocio... La vida siempre transcurre por el lugar menos pensado, o quizá no, haya algo predeterminado que nos lleve hasta un punto exacto, aunque no nos demos cuenta. Para Simón su vida está compuesta por varias piezas que le hacen sentirse cómodo dentro de su mundo, sin embargo este nuevo negocio hará que lo que está oculto salga a relucir y se entremezclará con ese momento vital que en un momento u otro iba a explotar, haciendo de ese estallido sea más dulce.

Acompañado de todas esas personas que empiezan a agrandar su mundo, descubrimos que lo humano está en todas partes, que los lugares y las personas no son siempre lo que parecen, que dentro de cada persona hay una historia con significado y que cuando nos acercamos de verdad a algo, descubrimos que todo vale la pena.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Ana Liyu.

Nació en Pamplona, rodeada de esa naturaleza que tanto le nutre día a día, y gracias de visitar y vivir en distintos países y continentes ha ido uniendo cada pieza del rompecabezas de la vida. Le gusta leer, y escribir, y leer y bailar, y soñar ¿por qué no?, y leer, y pasear por las montañas y mil cosas mas.  Y entre cañas con limón bien frías, organiza Veladas entre Artes, recitales, lecturas, charlas, eventos... donde el cartón y las manualidades cobran vida propia, junto a la música, algo que no puede faltar. Frecuenta alguna quedada literaria, lee en voz alta en algún bar, en voz baja para sus amigos y aún más bajita para sí misma, y las ideas las deja escritas en papeles siempre sueltos, y en sucio, y en alguna que otra servilleta. 

Su sumerge en las montañas, se refugia baja las mantas, se le ve siempre montada en su bicicleta y no soporta las etiquetas. 

Cuando lo necesita, baila al ritmo lento del Jazz.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«La idea se nos había ocurrido la semana anterior, mientras Abuela ponía las verduras en el fuego y yo acariciaba a Gigi sentado en la encimera, junto al vidrio helado de la ventana. A esas horas, a lo lejos solo se veían las nubes confundirse con el horizonte y las siluetas de los altos cipreses queriendo tocarlas sin conseguirlo, por mucho que existieran tantos mitos sobre ellos. Algún animal se movía al abrigo de la oscuridad y las lápidas dejaban de verse, como si ya no estuvieran allí nunca más, como si ya no existieran.
          Había crecido con esa vista desde que lograba recordar. Las casas adosadas a la pared del cementerio eran lo más barato que mis abuelos habían podido conseguir después de que Abuela perdiera el trabajo de pescadera.
          Y fue en esa cocina, con olor a verduras cocidas y la elegante voz de Luisa (como me gustaba simplemente llamarla) saliendo del aparato antiguo de radio que todavía funcionaba, donde Abuela sugirió que sería una buena idea pedir al Director que solucionaran la situación cuanto antes.
          ―¿Y por qué no nos encargamos nosotros? ―se me ocurrió de repente.
          Llevábamos tiempo mal viviendo con lo poco que podíamos conseguir, y quizá esa podría ser la respuesta.
          ―Pues vas a tener razón, hijo, vas a tener razón ―exclamó añadiendo cilantro a la cazuela.
          Cada vez veíamos más tumbas abandonadas, más flores secas, más plásticos deambulando por los suelos, desligados de lo que en su momento habían sido ramos hechos con mino y depositados con delicadeza sobre la tierra aún húmeda o sobre la losa siempre fría.
          Hubo un tiempo en que me entretenía contando las personas que entraban por la puerta para visitar a sus antepasados. Los clasificaba por edades, por género, por lo que llevaban puesto…  y por la noche, antes de acostarme, los añadía a mi cuaderno de listas, en la sección del cementerio donde llevaba la cuenta de los visitantes desde el último año. Un día se lo enseñé a Abuela y me hizo ir al el despacho del señor Piedrafría para mostrárselo. Tenía diez años y él me entregó una condecoración en reconocimiento a mi ayuda a la Institución. Creo que le conmovió que alguien más se interesara por lo que él había convertido en su vida. Desde que su mujer le había dejado, vivía en un cuartito al lado de su oficina…»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El verde de las lápidas que saldría después a la venta.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción RESPALDAR es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Ana Liyu vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad
story_txt:
¿Qué?
El verde de las lápidas nos aproxima a la muerte, a través de sus personajes, en un intento de acercarnos a su normalización...
La calle de al lado del cementerio. Casas desde cuyas ventanas se ven las lápidas. Un joven en paro que ha vivido toda su vida en una de ellas con sus abuelos. Una idea de negocio... La vida siempre transcurre por el lugar menos pensado, o quizá no, haya algo predeterminado que nos lleve hasta un punto exacto, aunque no nos demos cuenta. Para Simón su vida está compuesta por varias piezas que le hacen sentirse cómodo dentro de su mundo, sin embargo este nuevo negocio hará que lo que está oculto salga a relucir y se entremezclará con ese momento vital que en un momento u otro iba a explotar, haciendo de ese estallido sea más dulce.
Acompañado de todas esas personas que empiezan a agrandar su mundo, descubrimos que lo humano está en todas partes, que los lugares y las personas no son siempre lo que parecen, que dentro de cada persona hay una historia con significado y que cuando nos acercamos de verdad a algo, descubrimos que todo vale la pena.
¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.
De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy te presentamos a Ana Liyu.
Nació en Pamplona, rodeada de esa naturaleza que tanto le nutre día a día, y gracias de visitar y vivir en distintos países y continentes ha ido uniendo cada pieza del rompecabezas de la vida. Le gusta leer, y escribir, y leer y bailar, y soñar ¿por qué no?, y leer, y pasear por las montañas y mil cosas mas.  Y entre cañas con limón bien frías, organiza Veladas entre Artes, recitales, lecturas, charlas, eventos... donde el cartón y las manualidades cobran vida propia, junto a la música, algo que no puede faltar. Frecuenta alguna quedada literaria, lee en voz alta en algún bar, en voz baja para sus amigos y aún más bajita para sí misma, y las ideas las deja escritas en papeles siempre sueltos, y en sucio, y en alguna que otra servilleta. 
Su sumerge en las montañas, se refugia baja las mantas, se le ve siempre montada en su bicicleta y no soporta las etiquetas. 
Cuando lo necesita, baila al ritmo lento del Jazz.
¿Por qué?
Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:
«La idea se nos había ocurrido la semana anterior, mientras Abuela ponía las verduras en el fuego y yo acariciaba a Gigi sentado en la encimera, junto al vidrio helado de la ventana. A esas horas, a lo lejos solo se veían las nubes confundirse con el horizonte y las siluetas de los altos cipreses queriendo tocarlas sin conseguirlo, por mucho que existieran tantos mitos sobre ellos. Algún animal se movía al abrigo de la oscuridad y las lápidas dejaban de verse, como si ya no estuvieran allí nunca más, como si ya no existieran.          Había crecido con esa vista desde que lograba recordar. Las casas adosadas a la pared del cementerio eran lo más barato que mis abuelos habían podido conseguir después de que Abuela perdiera el trabajo de pescadera.          Y fue en esa cocina, con olor a verduras cocidas y la elegante voz de Luisa (como me gustaba simplemente llamarla) saliendo del aparato antiguo de radio que todavía funcionaba, donde Abuela sugirió que sería una buena idea pedir al Director que solucionaran la situación cuanto antes.          ―¿Y por qué no nos encargamos nosotros? ―se me ocurrió de repente.          Llevábamos tiempo mal viviendo con lo poco que podíamos conseguir, y quizá esa podría ser la respuesta.          ―Pues vas a tener razón, hijo, vas a tener razón ―exclamó añadiendo cilantro a la cazuela.          Cada vez veíamos más tumbas abandonadas, más flores secas, más plásticos deambulando por los suelos, desligados de lo que en su momento habían sido ramos hechos con mino y depositados con delicadeza sobre la tierra aún húmeda o sobre la losa siempre fría.          Hubo un tiempo en que me entretenía contando las personas que entraban por la puerta para visitar a sus antepasados. Los clasificaba por edades, por género, por lo que llevaban puesto…  y por la noche, antes de acostarme, los añadía a mi cuaderno de listas, en la sección del cementerio donde llevaba la cuenta de los visitantes desde el último año. Un día se lo enseñé a Abuela y me hizo ir al el despacho del señor Piedrafría para mostrárselo. Tenía diez años y él me entregó una condecoración en reconocimiento a mi ayuda a la Institución. Creo que le conmovió que alguien más se interesara por lo que él había convertido en su vida. Desde que su mujer le había dejado, vivía en un cuartito al lado de su oficina…»
¿Cómo?
Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El verde de las lápidas que saldría después a la venta.

story:
Short Summary

Around the world there are many thousands of pet statues with intriguing stories behind them. Some reveal insights into our social history, such as the little brown dog in Battersea that was a focus of suffragette riots. Others have wonderfully quirky origins, like the twenty-three cats of York: sculptures added to buildings designed by a cat-loving architect. Many more reveal tales of courage, loyalty, myth and legend.

For more information check out our website:

http://www.monumentaltales.org.uk/

What Will Your Money Do?

Your money will be used both to fundraise for the Blue Cross and to cover parts of the production costs of this beautiful book. The Blue Cross does invaluable work supporting vulnerable animals all over the United Kingdom: it provides rehoming, veterinary services and seeks legislative changes. The amount we can donate depends on how much we can raise, so your generous contributions are essential! Please see the chart below for a more detailed breakdown.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute fincancially but if you feel even a little inspired by our cause please share our campaign via the social media links below!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Rachel, I’m creating a photojournalism book that will be a collection of portraits and interviews with survivors of sexual assault, emphasising how they found ways of working through those deeply difficult times. All personal profit made after publishing fees will be donated to The Sharan Project, a non-profit organisation who support victims of abuse and work towards ending violence against women and children.

I've been a professional photographer for nearly 9 years now and a large amount of my work is centred around empowering women, recent work includes shooting for So Just Shop (an online store allowing you to buy directly from women-led artisans throughout the world), I am the official photographer to burlesque women's rights activist Sukki Singapora, and I work closely with The Sharan Project supporting them as both a photographer and ambassador. 

I've decided to write this book because I noticed something about the resources available to survivors. The paperwork you're provided with when you’re on the road to recovery is often quite clinical. Support workers understandably need to give you very clear, structured advice so you know the next steps to take and that is a wonderful, necessary approach to providing written material to those seeking help. But I’ve noticed there are far fewer warmer, more emotive reading materials available to work alongside the current text. I want for there to be a book where you can read other people’s stories, find out more about all the other ways an individual could aid their recovery. A book solely dedicated to survivors reaching out to other survivors, connecting with each other on a purely empathetic level. And therein lies this project - 100 interviews with 100 women and men supporting fellow survivors through story telling. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

My biggest and most crucial expenses will be on travel and connecting with people who would like to be in the book.

Firstly, travel. Though I will be taking the coach wherever possible and will be strategic with timings so I can conduct more than one interview per trip to save money, I am still going to rack up a bill travelling up and down the country. Often I'll need to go to the interviewees home or meet them in a safe space of their choosing with their support worker, so travel money is essential.

Secondly, connecting with interviewees. There are now 2 billion active users on Facebook and so that's where I’m basing the majority of advertising. It's unfortunately quite costly, but after research and testing various other routes I am confident it's the most efficient way to reach people. I've already received enormous support from people across the country who have seen my sponsored facebook posts, now need to make sure I'm continuing to reach more and more potential interviewees in this way.

Lastly, smaller expenses. Many applicants have opted to meet for a coffee, others have also asked we use props to disguise their faces so they can remain anonymous. Although all those drinks and props don't cost much per meeting, when you add up 100 interviews worth of smaller expenses they will inevitably become a drain on the budget, so it's important I account for those odds and ends as well. 

Now, perks! 

There will be 4 main rewards for your help:

£25: You are credited in the book as a supporter. 
£50: You are credited in the book as a supporter and will receive a free portrait taken by myself in selected cities, on selected dates.
£75: You are credited in the book as a supporter and receive 15% discount on release. 
£100+: You are credited in the book as a supporter and receive a free copy of the book on release.

Any additional money will be put back into the book. For example, if I raise more than my target amount I'll be able to hire city central spaces to conduct interviews making life easier for the interviewees and pay for additional advertising via Instagram and other social media platforms. Any money beyond that I will donate to The Sharan Project. £800 is the minimum amount I can manage this project with, any extra financial support would be so appreciated. 

The Impact

This book will be a warm, accessible resource for survivors of sexual assault. It'll be a way of connecting with others who have experienced similar things in a format that is currently unavailable as far as I know. I want to create an easy to read, open and honest book of stories told by some of the strongest people I've ever met. 

When a person experiences sexual assault, there are countless way that person could find a way to recover. They'll consider all the different incredible organisations that are there to help, various kinds of counselling available, hobbies or projects that might help them work through everything. However, deciding how they're going to proceed is often one of the most difficult parts of the entire process. Being able to read through how other people have approached their recovery has potential to be an absolutely vital source of support and inspiration for survivors, a resource I'm going to work incredibly hard to create. 

Challenges

I'm anticipating there being a couple of challenges along the way. Firstly, I need to ensure the interviewee's are receiving the necessary specialist support or are looking to seek that help. Speaking about potentially deeply hurtful experiences could be a particularly taxing conversation so I need to be sure they have the support network they need to work through it. If that person requests additional help I can connect then with qualified support workers recommended by The Sharan Project who will step in and make sure they receive all the help they need. So please rest assured they interviewees well being will ALWAYS come first. 

Another challenge will be photographing interviewees who have asked to remain anonymous. As this is a photojournalism book the accompanying imagery is a crucial part of the project, so I'll be using all my creative know-how that I've developed as a photographer over the last 9 years to shoot emotive images weather or not the person in the photo is identifiable. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this page!  Please share this crowd funding page so your friends and family can read about what I'm trying to create, help me spread the word!

story:
The publication’s main mission is to provide a platform for Black, Indigenous, and People of Colour (BIPoC) from across (Colonially Known As) “Canada” to speak about the social impact of mental health through the lens of racialized experiences.

The project originally comes from a need to highlight more BIPoC artists and writers in the predominantly-white “Canadian” spoken word scene (especially wimmin, femmes, and folks outside the binary), as well as the social and psychological impact of mental health narratives long dominated by white supremacy.

Although explicitly titled and focused for BIPoC, this project also recognizes the need for welcomed inclusion LGBTQQIP2SAA, queer, genderqueer, trans, non-binary, bigender and agender representation, visibility for disabled individuals, and across intersections of all social marginalization.

There will be no consideration for any material embodying or representing the same hateful, discriminatory, and oppressive systems which currently exist as the object of our resistance.  This includes (but is not limited to): anti-blackness, homophobia, ableism, Islamophobia, misogyny, misogynoir, cis-sexism, transphobia, anti-Semitism, serophobia, classism, etc. Kyriarchy is a Rubik’s cube of various systems we can unlock and break down with time, patience, energy, care (for self and community), and most importantly, love as radical justice.

 

For more information, please contact: 

Samuel “Bassam” Halévy

Curator, editor-in-chief

BIPOC.pills@gmail.com

story:
Story of My Book

1 Week, 1 Thing - Freedom for the business owner to find peace and unimaginable breakthroughs in just 3 pages a week!

My name is Jeffrey Nott and I am the author of 1 Week, 1 Thing. I wrote this book to help business owners get the big things done in their business that they have not been able to do so before. In personal experience of owning multiple businesses and working with many other business owners, I discovered that one can get more done by focusing on just one big area (HR manual, Processes, etc.) of their business each week rather than 2 or 3 things at once. This book uses classic business tools for you, the owner, to facilitate this process to create a well oiled machine.

Owning a business is like juggling. Every day you are asked to juggle different priorities:

  • Business Strategy
  • Human Resources
  • Operations and Finance
  • Marketing
  • Sales

This book gives you a balanced approach to keeping all the balls in the air while working on each of these areas in a one year time frame. Some of the issues that challenge the typical business owner in doing so:

  • Focus - If you are ADHD (like me) or distracted by too many things
  • Time - You are challenged b (like me) in any given day to complete an important task
  • Skill - Your skill (or just desire - like me) keeps you working on easier tasks instead

The chapters are structured to address the issues listed above and helps you, the reader, to work on and through every key area of your business on a cyclical basis.

You will love this book if you ready for real breakthroughs in getting those things done that you know need to be addressed.


1 Week, 1 Thing is a non-fiction book that speaks to small to medium business owners who are looking at working less in the business and more on the business for the first time.

The Book - 1 Week, 1 Thing

The book is written in 3 sections:

Section 1 - Introduction to the book and how to use it.

Section 2 - What to do if you need a fast fix to an immediate need.

Section 3 - Takes the business owner on a one week at a time basis through the most important parts of building a successful business. The end result is that the business owner will have the most important moving parts of the business in place, allowing time (freedom), peace of mind and the money for that much needed 2 week vacation that most business owners almost never take.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mock-ups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copy editing for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a special acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book
  • Complimentary 30 minute 1-1 call to review my book and strategy session for the first 50 purchasers
  • Speaking session - Buy bundle of 10 or more books and I will address your group/team.

About the Author

Jeffrey Nott is passionate about helping and training others. He has an extensive history as a business owner and manager and has held positions of leadership in many organizations. Jeff has spoken to audiences of many sizes on different topics, including keynote, event planning, goal setting, and especially business topics.

Jeffrey wrote this book out of his desire to help the business owner finally get the business they have always wanted. It was an idea that came to mind over four years ago and is now coming to fruition.

Jeffrey is a voracious reader and would spend most of his day doing so, if he could. He also enjoys wine (and reads a lot about that, as well), working in the yard, and dining with friends. He considers himself an ‘experiential traveler’ because when traveling he is more interested in the culture and history of an area than just the sites. This is probably due to his stamp collecting as a young person which opened up his view of the world.

For more information, you can connect with Jeff at jeff@1week1thing.com and www.linkedin.com/in/jeffnott/, www.facebook.com/jeffreynott , www.instagram.com/jeffnott/ , https://twitter.com/NottJeff

Risks & challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Let me upgrade your social media - post, link and tag.

  • Don’t forget to tag so we can help amplify your efforts: #jeffnott #1week1thing #newdegreepress
  • Share the news of my book on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Instagram with your friends, family and network.
  • Post my Indiegogo Pre-Sale Campaign Page
  • Link with me at www.linkedin.com/in/jeffnott/, www.facebook.com/jeffreynott , www.instagram.com/jeffnott/ , https://twitter.com/NottJeff
  • Text my book #1week1thing to 5 friends, family members, or business owners who you think would enjoy it.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Jeffrey Nott

Focus - If you are ADHD (like me) or distracted by too many things

story:
Story of My Book 

Imagine shooting photos out of a helicopter with no doors. Being dropped off in the middle of a Zimbabwean jungle to shoot a story about rhino horn poachers, only to find out that you were on your own. Or finding yourself challenging the messages that you were assigned to shoot after having finished the assignment. Sometimes you have to go to great lengths to get the shot. It’s all just part of the job for the talented women who’ve paved the way for future generations of photographers. Their work appears in glossy publications, on national news sites, and in your social media feed, but unless you slow down to read the photo credits, you’d never realize how few of the images you see every day were actually taken by women photographers.

My name is Sophia Nunn and I’m the author of Framing The Shot. Feeling lost after being sent home in March because of the Coronavirus Pandemic, I reflected on what I could do now that I didn’t have time to do while on campus at Georgetown. I decided that this time was the perfect opportunity to use my voice and to create something meaningful. I wrote this book to highlight the powerful work that women have been doing for decades as photographers and to bring into focus their under-representation in the photography industry. 

Framing The Shot is a book about women photographers, strategies for success, and representation. Featuring interviews with thirteen notable women photographers, Framing The Shot combines the stories of these photographers with advice on how to explore your own passion for photography. The book highlights the tools that successful women photographers have used to build their own careers while considering the greater context of women in the workforce. Many of these women are entrepreneurs, businesswomen, and consultants. Some of them are also photography teachers and professors.

My hope is that by hearing their diverse perspectives you’ll gain a more three-dimensional understanding of women in the photography industry. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn from the work and careers of these women while challenging what you know about photography’s history. I hope that from Framing The Shot, you gain a greater understanding of the importance of representation in the photography industry.

If you’re interested in hearing stories from war photographers, reading about the entrepreneurial drive of freelancers, or learning about how crucial ethical visual journalism is in today’s world, this book is for you. You will love this book if you want to read about empowered women, learn more about photography as a method of storytelling, or discover new strategies for success. 

Framing The Shot speaks to women, photographers, and entrepreneurs looking to read about the impact that women photographers have had on the world, to learn more about the photography industry, and to identify the steps needed to build their own brand.

Ultimately, I hope that Framing The Shot inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What does it mean to be a woman in the photography industry?
  • How does your identity influence what you notice and ultimately what and how you choose to photograph? 
  • What steps should I take to pursue my own passion? 

 

I believe that discussing how photography intersects with identity and encouraging young people to follow their passions will change us all for the better, and I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. 

 

The Book - Framing The Shot
Framing the Shot is written in three parts.

Part 1 provides context. In this section, you’ll find stories and statistics about the history of the photography industry, including women’s role at key points in its history. Part 1 also examines why diversity and representation matter and introduces notable women photographers. It dives into more specific fields within the photography industry and examines industry trends. According to data tracking by Women Photograph, in 2017, only 18.2 percent of published news photographs were taken by women. Progress is a slow, hard battle— for the year 2020 up until the week of November 16th, the number of published news photos taken by women had only risen to 19.8 percent. And lastly, you’ll find out what different organizations such as Women Photograph, Black Women Photographers, and Authority Collective, are doing to change such statistics. 

Part 2 explores the stories of individual women photographers and focuses more specifically on how to become a better photographer. Understanding the power of your voice is an important first step in doing so and you’ll read about how these women found their own voices. You’ll learn how to create balance between saying yes and saying no to photography assignments and how to avoid underselling yourself as a photographer. Part 2 also discusses visual storytelling at length and highlights the importance of de-colonizing the lens, engaging in ethical photojournalism, and deconstructing the white male gaze. 

Part 3 consists of the final chapter: a compilation of the advice from the different women that I interviewed. Though the advice was given in the context of the photography industry, much of what they advise is applicable to other fields as well. These photographers advocate for taking up the space you deserve, growing from failure, and finding your community. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor who will work with me to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The copy editor and proof reader who will polish grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The cover designer who‘ll create a high-end design for my book jacket. (The mockup you see currently is a placeholder.)
  • The layout designer who will build the interior of my book, both the physical copy and ebook formats.
  • The launch & promotion experts who will lead the effort when I ultimately publish this Spring.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Sophia Nunn is a junior at Georgetown University, majoring in Psychology and double minoring in Philosophy and Women’s and Gender Studies. Sophia chose to study Psychology because she’s always been fascinated by how we develop as people. Though she’s loved all of her Psychology courses, Psychology of Sexuality has had the greatest impact on her as both a student and an individual. Causing her to reflect a great deal on social constructions, Psychology of Sexuality was also the reason that she decided to pursue a minor in Women’s and Gender Studies. Sophia read a great deal about identity in her Introduction to Philosophy class, which spurred her interest in Philosophy and considering what our role is as humans in the world. 

Passionate about photography and keen to make a difference in the lives of girls and women, Sophia decided to write Framing The Shot. She also wanted to increase the representation of women in the photography industry and to provide a place where younger photographers could look for inspiration. Another one of Sophia’s goals for this book is that the reader learn that there isn’t just one path to success and that success can be self-defined. She hopes that you’ll finish Framing The Shot more open-minded, passionate, and most importantly, inspired. 

For more information, you can connect with Sophia at sophianunn1@gmail.com and at @snunnphotos and @sophianunn on Instagram.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #FramingTheShot and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Sophia

story:
Story of My Book

The Loves of Our Lives follows the romantic journeys of a daughter, mother, and grandmother. Although they are different in their struggles and generational gaps, their romantic relationships all have something in common. Through each of their explorations in romantic love Emi, Jo, and Willa learn more about themselves and who they would like to be. The three women learn who they would like to have as romantic partners, and what kind of people they want to be with or without them. Their respective journeys into adulthood may remind you of your own experiences and heartaches. 

My name is Karsyn Wallace and I am the author of The Loves of Our Lives. I wrote this book because I wanted to further explore the concept of inter-generational relationships of black women in America. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover more about the unknown experiences within your own family. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to reflect upon your own family members, escape from your current worries, and learn alongside Emi, Jo, and Willa. Discover the valuable lessons of romance and becoming your own person. 

The contemporary novel, The Loves of Our Lives, explores the importance of family connection and womanhood. The story follows a daughter, mother and grandmother finding their way beyond trials and tribulations and coming together through the timeline of their romantic relationships. Although they may have loved and lost at different points in time and all face challenges with living as Black women in America, their spirits and the lessons they provide to one another will forever be intertwined. 

The Loves of Our Lives speaks to all who want to grapple with family dynamics and self discovery in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that The Loves of Our Lives inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

How much do I really know about my own family?

What have I learned from my past romantic experiences?

How much has changed from my grandmother’s time to the present? 

What moment in time greatly defined my life?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing the themes of womanhood, race, navigating romance and family connection will change us all for the better. 
 

The Book - The Loves of Our Lives

The book is written in four parts.

Part 1 contains the author’s note + chapters 1-10. 

The first part of the novel introduces and provides insights into Emi’s life. This begins from the time she enters college and continues through her journey into adulthood. Eventually, we even follow Emi into old age.

Part 2 contains chapters 11-22 . 

The second part of the novel is the introduction of Jo. Throughout this section, the reader follows along as Jo leaves her life of schooling and is introduced to the adult world.

Part 3 contains chapters 23-33. 

The third part of the novel is from the perspective of Willa’s life. Her story begins from the end of her senior year in high school and into the adventures & dramas of early college life. 

Part 4 contains chapters 34-40 

The final part of this novel is when all three storylines collide. In this, you will see the familial bond of Emi, Jo and Willa grow stronger and how their lives have played out after all of their heartbreak and challenges. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021. 

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion effortsfor my book when I ultimately publish this Spring. 


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

The first 125 preorders will receive a special edition sticker sheet based on the novel designed by Autumn Moons Studio (@autumnmoons.studio on Instagram). 

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Karsyn Wallace is a documentary film production and peace studies student from Seattle, Washington who is incredibly passionate about both film and literature. 

She wrote this book because she wanted to further explore inter-generational relationships through a romantic lens. Karsyn’s reasoning for examining familial connection in such a way is because she believes women in particular learn a lot about themselves through the romantic relationships they forge. When the three women in The Loves of Our Lives explore their feelings about love and romantic partners, they obtain a greater sense of self and are bound together by womanhood and a sense of self discovery. Karsyn hopes that this story will cause readers to become more curious about the development of their own families as well. 

Other than watching films, reading, and writing, Karsyn enjoys journaling and is incredibly passionate about food & environmental ethics. She’s currently learning more about the low-waste lifestyle and is exploring the various ways in which we can improve the state of our world through our personal life decisions. 

For more information, you can connect with Karsyn at karsynwallaceauthor@gmail.com and on her Instagram @karsynwallaceauthor. 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

 

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheLovesofOurLives and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support! 

Thanks again, 

Karsyn Wallace

story:
Story of My Book

My name is April Lara and I am the author of Leadership Principles for Teens. I wrote this book so that millions of teens can visualize achieving their greatest potential, by believing they can make a difference and influence change, no matter what circumstance they find themselves in––home, school or their communities.

I was inspired to write Leadership Principles for Teens after my experience as the CEO of a program in the Chicago public schools. We helped hundreds of students who were suspended from school to get back on track. We did this by teaching important life lessons - like improving self-image, forming more positive relationships, making better decisions, and resisting peer pressure.

I witnessed a transformation in students attitude and behavior when they were shown and taught these skills. It wasn’t just me, parents and teachers were seeing positive changes too: Grades and attendance were improving, students were more engaged at school, they getting along with others better, and having more meaningful conversations at home. Parents constantly asked why their more aware and confident kids had to get in trouble to learn these valuable lessons.

I knew there had to be a better way.

  • A better way to get these effective social emotional learning lessons into the hands of people who have a passion to inspire youth.
  • A better way for teens to learn meaningful life skills that are so important to job preparedness and post graduate success.
  • A better way to prepare teens to take the lead on their own life-- so it wasn’t just the few thousand we helped, but thousands of teenagers around the world.

So after four years of this fulfilling work, I decided not to renew the public school contract so that I could get these powerful lessons into the hands of more educators who could influence even more of our youth.

My hope is that, in using this book, educators are able to reinforce important life skills that teach teens that a life marathon is not so much about instant gratification and making an immediate impact, but a journey of ups and downs...wins and losses. Their greatest success will involve strong relationships and building trust. Teens will see that love wins over hate, and living with integrity and gratitude brings lifelong happiness, among many other lessons.

In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have to inspire youth success. Youth are our greatest resource. The better job we do of providing skills, resources and preparing them to take the lead, what ever they face in their life, the better chance they have for long term success.

And then ultimately I want you to see this book as an educators tool to be the one that makes a difference in a teens life. Now’s your chance to be the ONE. The one that motivated your students to reach their highest potential and helped each one recognize his or her tremendous value.

 

About this book

This is my book of passion. For the past three years, I did my research on outstanding leaders. I do not expect anyone to clock the hundreds of hours of documentaries, museum visits, reading autobiographies, biographies, to come up with a short list of greats and decipher what it made them successful. I did that. Synthesizing all the information into an easy to read format is my contribution to the world.

Drawing on our history’s proven best leaders, we can learn, understand and model the best practices they used to discover their purpose, make decisions, solve problems, connect with others, persist no matter what and model a life of integrity. 

In this book students will learn and practice the best practices from some of our greatest leaders that include Abraham Lincoln, Eleanor Roosevelt, Cesar Chavez, Martin Luther King Jr. and Gandhi as well as current stand outs like Lin Manuel Miranda and the Parkland School survivors. Readers will see that life and leadership skills are as important and relevant today as they were through out history.

By using storytelling and discussion I hope to create unforgettable adventure so that educators and students will enjoy, remember and apply these life fundamental skills to their daily life - and for the rest of their life!

You will love this book if you are an educator, school administrators, teen leader who wants to inspire youth to live to their potential. You will have ideas, thoughts, and a guide on developing skills and creating confidence in children leaving your legacy as a true change maker promoting teen success, not only now but for generations to come.

Leadership Principles for Teens is a non-fiction book that is a tool for educators (6th grade and up) who are looking for a learning solution that gives them confidence and life lessons that are easily folded into daily classroom lessons. Lessons that will grow the qualities of purpose, drive, compassion and integrity in young emerging leaders – whether it is in their communities, families or the world.

 

The Book - Leadership Principles for Teens

The book is for educators and students to use over the school year, one chapter per week. The book is written in the following 7 Parts:

Part 1: INTRODUCTION includes a brief description of some of our greatest leaders.  Readers will be introduced to the idea that no matter who they are, where they are from, what means they have, they can create change in their own lives.

Part 2: SELF AWARENESS contains Chapters 1-4. In part 2  readers will learn about the importance of self-love. They will be encouraged to pay attention and identify their own unique skills, strengths, and values.

Part 3: SELF MANAGEMENT contains Chapters 5-11. The focus of this section is understanding emotions or our feelings. Our feelings are the clues that guide us to follow our love-based emotions or reconsider our fear-based emotions. Readers will understand different strategies to successfully manage impulse control and keep a positive attitude.

Part 4: SOCIAL AWARENESS contains Chapters 12-19. Readers will examine how those they surround themselves with inspire their success —or not. Establishing and maintaining healthy relationships, appreciating diversity, listening well and respecting another opinion are included in this section.

Part 5: RESPONSIBLE BEHAVIORS contains Chapters 20-25. Setting and working toward personal and academic goals and making responsible decisions are covered in this section. Topics like knowing when to say yes or no and making honorable choices are also included.

Part 6: SELF IMPROVEMENT contains Chapters 26-28. A growth mindset is the theme in this section. There are many ways to cultivate learning. We grow when we challenge our comfort zone, believe in our self-confidence and get unafraid to make mistakes.

Part 7: TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR YOUR LIFE contains Chapters 29-33. Students will learn that we are 100% responsible for our own actions. Being able to accept and welcome feedback is necessary and fosters self-love. This section includes topics like quit blaming, being honest and not being afraid to ask for what you need or want.

Part 8: NOW WHAT! contains Chapters 34-37. Readers will learn they can take the lead by voting and serving others. Additionally, anyone, regardless of who they are or what means they came from, can make a difference.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mock-ups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copy editing for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Spring
  • Developing the live on-line training class for educators who want more practice teaching SEL lessons to teens
  • Developing the on-line resource center that includes hands-on exercises for each chapter that reinforce the weekly SEL lessons 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish.

 

Incentives

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And others..

 

About the Author

April Lara is the President and Founder of Life Journey Mentors, a Motivational and Self Improvement Life Skills company. She is on a mission to create worldwide positive change by inspiring others to recognize and cultivate their own pure positive potential.

An admitted self-help book junkie, her teachers have included Jack Canfield, Marci Shimoff, and Neale Donald Walsh, Janet Attwod, Dr. Sue Morter, among many others. Combining her love of self-help knowledge and long-time success in creating culture changing programs through identifying and sharing best practices is what led her to create Leadership Principles for Teens.

As a speaker and workshop leader, April inspires other to open up to the miracles in their life and live to their true potential. April holds a BSBA degree from Aquinas College. A lifelong Cub fan, she lives in Wrigleyville with her husband and children.

Visit www.lifejourneymentors.com for more information and to take the test: What Leader are You.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #leadershipprinciplesforteens and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
April Lara

story:
I'm writing a book aimed at helping as many people as possible.

As few as four years ago, I was riddled with depression, anxiety, and self-hatred. I wasn't happy. I didn't get anything done. It wasn't a good time.

Since then, however, I have turned things around. I got in better shape, wrote a book, found the best relationship of my life, I got to write for a popular YouTube channel, my comedy duo has headlined festivals, I directed a web series that has gotten into many festivals and won awards.

I'm so grateful for all of this. Four years ago I wouldn't have believed any of this would happen.

I am joining many others dedicated to helping.

There's a movement that's happening and people like Jen Sincero, Simon Sinek, Brene Brown, Dwayne Johnson are a part of it. These are people talking and writing about topics like vulnerability, authenticity, connection, helping others, love for yourself and others, honesty when it comes to struggle and failure and other topics that helping people live better lives.

So, I'm going to contribute my time, talent and effort into spreading the lessons, ideas, methods & techniques that have helped me improve my life. I am writing a book and preparing a talk aimed at resonating with a very large audience.

I want to help people heal and grow in a practical, concrete, evidence-based way that will realistically enhance their lives.

Please Help Me Get this Project off the Ground

Here’s what I’m asking: Help me line up six months' worth of work by purchasing one or more of the perks. They’re mostly all my services that people hire me for anyway. I’ve even discounted them a bit because I want to book a bunch of work in advance so that I don’t have to spend any more time looking for work.

Instead, I’ll use that time I would have been looking for work to write the book, build a website, write the talk, look for publishers, look for places to give the talk and whatever else pops up unexpectedly.

I’m a great coach. Hire me and I’ll help you. It’s what I do. It’s what I’m obsessed with. And in turn, you’ll be helping me to help others. Everybody wins!

What's Going to be in the Book?

If it's like my last book I won't know the title til after the 2nd draft, but the working title is... 

Level Up Your Life Not Just for You, but for All of Humanity:    Seriously, let's do this so we can make this place better for everyone

Some of the topics I’ll cover in the book include:

  • Understanding Your Brain’s Ability to Change Itself for the Better
  • Reframing the Story You Have of Your Life
  • Setting Realistic Goals
  • Leveling Up Personal Productivity
  • Acquiring Good Habits
  • Lessons on how you can help others in ways you enjoy
  • Fact: Hurt People Hurt People and Healed People Heal People
  • Increasing Empathy, Resilience, Self Love & Vulnerability
  • How to Try This Stuff For Yourself

Thank you!

Thank you so much for visiting my campaign. If you cannot support financially, I totally understand. Another way to help is to forward this to anyone you think might be interested in coaching or who might otherwise want to contribute.


Update Videos


I will upload a daily Vlog with updates on how the campaign is going. You can click on all of them under the main video above or go here to see them all directly on YouTube.  

 

 

The Perks!

Thanked in the book - Everyone who contributes to this will get mentioned in my next book.

Maggie Shout Outs - These are gonna be super fun. Only $10. I'll provide Maggie's voice as she sends you words of encouragement or whatever you like.

Improv Made Easier - Get a signed copy of my book on improvisation sent to your door 

Coaching Sessions - I love coaching. I'm great at it. And I can coach so many different skills: acting, stand up, writing, improv, career planning, pitch packets, brainstorming, habits/productivity, mindset, relationships, and even basic guitar. 

Writing Feedback  - I'll read your work and give you detailed thorough notes to help you make the next draft better and clear up what you're looking to say.

Sketch, Scene or Monologue - I will write you an original piece you can use to film, put on a stage, act in yourself or whatever you want to do. I'll write it based on what you want.

Hand Drawn Maze - I love drawing mazes. I make them aesthetic and challenging. 

A Song For You - Want an original song written about you or a topic of your choosing? I'd love to write it and make a video of me singing it for you. So fun!

 

Thank you so much for reading all this and supporting me. =)

I'll write it based on what you want.Hand Drawn Maze - I love drawing mazes. I make them aesthetic and challenging. A Song For You - Want an original song written about you or a topic of your choosing? I'd love to write it and make a video of me singing it for you. So fun! Thank you so much for reading all this and supporting me. =)

story:
Summary

My name is Josh LeRoy. I’m married to Laura, and I’m the dad of Anna Grace and Ellis. I live in North Carolina, where I work with a ministry called The Bridge Project. This is a ministry within the beautifully diverse East Side community. I also like to write, and I’ve put together a short book entitled Deeper than your Pain. As should be obvious by the title, it’s a book about pain. More specifically, it’s a book about the spiritual/emotional/physical pain that results from internalized rejection; a pain that has become an epidemic within the organized church. If you were raised in a context where performance was obligatory, then there’s a good chance that you swallowed your fair share of rejection. No matter how well you perform, your performance will never be “perfect”. Performance oriented environments are shame-based, and they fuel the fear of Gods absence. When you fail to be perfect, you assume that God has rejected you. But God never created you to be perfect, and your very existence is proof that He has not rejected you. Healing happens when you awaken to the presence of God. God is not just present; He is presence itself….all that we know of reality and then some. To be knowingly and willingly in His presence is to be healthy and whole. Contributions to this project will help us get that message to the souls who need reminding.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are raising $3000 to get this project published and into as many hands as possible. The funding will go towards publishing, editing, marketing and printing costs.
  • The perks are broken up into 5 different levels ranging from $10 - $500.
  • In the event we do not reach our goal, the funds will go solely to editing and printing.

 

The Impact

As we have begun to share the principles and writings of these books with people, we have seen night and day transformations inside people. We have heard people say over and over again that they are feeling the freedom of living in God's presence for the first time in a long long time.  We believe the timing of this book is critical to where the church in America is today.  We are looking forward to seeing lives changed as God continues to use this book.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to financially support or pre-order a book at this time, you can still help us spread the word! Share the link and tell your friends.

story:
Short Summary

I am an engineer with a little bit inhibited creativity. I have therefore written a detective novel about the swedish summer, the beautiful archepalago of Bohuslän in the west of sweden but mainly is it about ordinary guys that become heroes. The novel contains a lot of action including the first RIB (Rubber boat) hunt, a murdurer that is hard to not admire, curiosity and gutlessness that changes to impressive guts.

I am so extremely impatient to get it printed but my wife asks me to save money to this before I print it. I also would like to give a few Euro to persons that have contributed to the book. If I wait any longer, the short Swedish summer is gone and there is now opportunity for people to read it in their hammock or on the rocks in the archepalago...if they dare.

Pocket, 336 pages.

What We Need & What You Get

Most of the funding goes to the first edition of more than 300 books. If I buy less they are much more expensive. Some money goes to friends that contributed with proof-reading. 

The Impact

If I don´t get funding it will be difficult to print it before the summer when most people read books. But don´t worry, I will continue writing.
