story:
Short Summary

Horror author, Jonathan D. Carter tackles the demons we all have inside of us in his debut novel The Shadows Within. This horrific tale of guilt and regret is sure to chill your spine and leave you sleeping with the lights on.

Ten years after a horrific accident claimed the life of his best friend, Chris Turner still carries around the demons of guilt and regret. When he moves to the small town of Rosemont, Ga, it seems he is finally able to escape the horror of his past.

Chris soon finds out, however, that everyone has demons. And some of them are more terrifying than even his own. There is another nightmare unfolding in Rosemont, Ga. One he won't just be able to wake up from...

 

Excerpt:

It was the same dream Edith had almost every night: kneeling by Harold’s grave, fixing the flowers the wind had knocked over the night before. His name was etched in the stone under his favorite quote: Behind every great man, there is an even greater woman. They had cared so much for each other. He had been the first and only man Edith had ever truly loved.

“That’s good.” Edith looked over the arrangement. “You would really love these, Harold. They would have really brought out your eyes.”

“Yes. They are beautiful.” Harold agreed.

“The best I had in the store. Only the best for my precious Harold.” Tears formed in Edith’s eyes.

“Don’t cry, my heart. You will be with me soon enough.”

“Oh Harold.” Edith wiped the tears from her eyes. “I miss you so.”

“I know, my heart. I miss you too. It won’t be long, though. We will be together before you know it.”

“Yes. The kids, though. They need me.”

“They are selfish. When was the last time you even heard from them? A week? A month?”

“Mary and her husband, Derek, came by last month.”

“They needed money to fund one of their trips, didn’t they?”

Edith shook as her emotions almost got the best of her. “Yes. They took the kids to one of those amusement parks down in Florida.” Edith laughed. “You should have seen how excited they were. They were just beaming.”

“Of course! You were giving them money. Money that I worked all of those years for. God, you’re weak.”

“Harold, please…” Edith’s voice trailed off and tears poured from her eyes as her emotions overcame her.”

“It’s true! They know that all they have to do is call up their Mommy and they can get whatever they want. That’s the only thing that matters to those spoiled little brats anymore. Other than that, what do they care about you?” Harold spoke with an anger Edith had never heard before.

“Nothing, I guess. Those grandkids, though, they love me to death. They would have loved you, too.”

“Would they have?”

“Yes. I think they would have. They are such a joy.”

“Brats.” The response came back harsh and flat.

“No. They aren’t like their parents.”

“Not yet. But they will be.”

“Maybe.” Edith whispered.

Edith looked at her hands as if they held an answer to her hoplessness. The anguish of being alone and the anger in Harold’s voice shook her. “I just wish you were here, Harold. You would know what to do.”

“If I were there, they wouldn’t have turned out so shitty.”

Edith had never heard Harold curse and it jolted her as if she had been struck by lightning. “What?”

“You heard me. You have spoiled our children and their kids are going to turn out the exact same way. What kind of mother or grandmother are you?”

Edith couldn’t believe her ears. Was this really how Harold felt? No. It couldn’t be. Harold would never curse at her. He never got angry enough to curse at her. He most surely wouldn’t have called her worthless.

Suddenly, hands burst through the dirt that lay over the top of Harold’s grave and grabbed Edith’s wrists. Her eyes widened and she struggled against them.

“Time to come home, Edith. Time to stop fucking up our kids and let them find out how hard life is when they don’t have their Mommy around to save them.” The hands tightened around Edith’s wrists.

“No. Please, Harold. Please let me go. You’re hurting me.”

Vines snaked out of the ground beside Edith and wrapped themselves around her ankles. She screamed as the ground in front of her separated to reveal Harold’s coffin. The top burst open and Harold’s gruesome, deteriorated remains rose up. “It’s time to come home, Edith” He grinned through blackened, rotted teeth.

“No. Please, Harold, no.” The vines crept up Edith’s legs. She grabbed at them and they grabbed back, curling their way up her arms.

Suddenly, Edith was being pulled closer toward her own plot. The ground tore open and she saw teeth growing out of the sides. On the bottom, there was a giant tongue whipping around as if it were licking its lips.

Harold laughed maliciously as his head turned to the side, watching the pitiful fight Edith was putting up against the vines.

Edith screamed as she was pulled into her grave.

She screamed as the last bit of light from the sun was blocked out by the ground closing over her.

She screamed until she couldn’t scream anymore.

 

Help Jonathan bring one of his most terrifying nightmares to the world.

 

The book has already gone through two drafts, beta readers, and countless revisions. It’s time to send it off to the final editor and then get it printed, shipped, and ready for mass consumption. That’s where you come in.

Please help Jonathan bring this unique vision of terror out to the world by donating and you will not only make him the happiest author on the planet but you will get some really nifty perks as well!

 

About the Author:

Jonathan has been interested in horror his entire life. Coming from a strictly religious background, he has experienced first-hand the demons that many people hide from the outside world.

He chose to start writing as an outlet for his emotions and experiences. It wasn't until he read "Pet Sematery" By Stephen King that he decided he wanted to make a career out of writing.

Writing is the only thing he has ever stuck with and been truly passionate about. He has written short stories, flash fiction, and even online articles. "The Shadows Within" is his first horror novel.

When he isn't writing, he is usually playing World of Warcraft or some other video game, spending time with his girlfriend and two dogs (most likely watching Duck Dynasty or Castle), or reading.

Why this campaign is important:

For years, Jonathan has dreamed of having his visions shared with the world and a successful campaign would get him that much closer to seing this dream realized.

His aunt, an avid reader and storyteller, started planting seeds in him at the age of three. She would tell him stories of sewer monsters and children turning into chocolate chip cookies because they ate too many. These stories were the spark that later grew into a blazing inferno of need. A need to share his nightmares with the world.

This campaign has been created to help pay for the costs of editing, promotions, a professional cover, and everything else that will make this dream a reality.

 

To find out more about Jonathan, visit the links below:

Website: Jonathandcarter.com

Twitter: @horroticawriter

Facebook Fan Page: http://www.facebook.com/AuthorJDCarter

story:
Discover the renewal renegades who practice the art of revitalizing cities & nature for a living. Their secret weapon? Crowd technologies, combined with two powerful trends: Social Enterprises, and Citizen-Led Renewal.

Why am I--an established author, speaker, & business owner--crowdfunding this book?  To give you the opportunity join my virtual research team. I've been writing this book for over two years, and am about 80% finished. But I'm crowdsourcing the remaining 20%, asking you to offer stories from your own community or personal expereince for possble inclusion in the book. I might even quote you in the book, if you have a good insight.

Once this crowdfunding campaign is complete, ALL backers (you) will receive an invitation from me to submit ideas, insights (I might quote you in the book), and stories from your community.

In this new book (my third) you'll discover how to join the ranks of the renewal renegades who are making communities healthier, wealthier, happier, & more beautiful for a living. Here's more information about RECIVILIZING: The Surprising Ways that Crowd Technologies Renew Citis, Nature, Democracy, and Livelihoods.

In this book, you'll discover how a perfect storm of converging trends and crises makes NOW the ideal time to launch a living you love, revitalizing some aspect of your local community or region. Here they are:

3 TRENDS: Crowd Tech + Social Enterprise + Citizen-Led Renewal.
3 CRISES: Our Economy + Our Environment + Our Institutional Failures.
OUTCOME: A revitalizing explosion of local projects, jobs, & businesses.

Their recivilizing weapon? Crowd Technologies.  With these tools, we can activate what I call the "Paradise Loop": When we restore our world, our world restores us.

My definition of "paradise"? Any place that's being reborn...that's coming back to life..or that's already healthy, wealthy, happy, and beautiful, and is getting more so. Nature hates stasis. There's something magic about being around the energy of regeneration. There's even more magic in being the one who's helping that regeneration happen.

So, who are these "renewal renegades"? They are the entrepreneurs, the investors, the professionals, the unemployed, and the dispossessed who see problems in their community, and who want to turn them into opportunities.

A vacant house can be seen as a problem that drives down property values, or it can be seen as a restorable asset that can revitalize the community. It can be renovated and reused, or it can be torn down and the property turned into a playground or community garden that enhances property values. This same principle applies to all of your community's built, natural, and social assets.

If you no longer have a job or savings, you probably have a wealth of available time. Using that time to participate in local citizen-led renewal can be the path to highly-marketable, personally-satisfying new skills. If you do still have a job and savings, participating in local citizen-led renewal can be the path to wonderful new business and investment opportunities.

Local "recivil wars" against heavy-handed, obstructive, and/or risk-averse public and private institutions are revitalizing our besieged livelihoods, cities, democracies, and natural resources. Don't worry: recivil wars are peaceful, joyful, profitable, and cooperative. They are recivilizing our world, and just in time. ReCivil wars are the cure for what ails 99% of us.

In this introductory 8-minute video (above), you'll discover the "good side" of the current economic disaster: the "perfect storm" of crises and technologies that launched the crowdfunded, citizen-led community renewal trend. Using just your computer or smart phone, you can now fix your local environment, economy, society, and government...while quickly creating an ideal career for yourself.

You can pre-order RECIVILIZING right here, right now, via this crowdfunding campaign. Depending on the "reward" level you chose, you can even receive an advance copy of the completed manuscript, months before the rest of the world sees the book. This will give you, your organization, or your community a head start of this powerful new trend.

Citizen-led renewal is the long-term solution to your community's revitalization, but it can be the immediate solution to your "personal revitalization".

WHAT: I'm self-publishing my third book, RECIVILIZING.  You can pre-order your copy, here and now, to help bring this book to the world. It's your guidebook to revitalizing your career, your life, and your community simultaneously.

WHEN: RECIVILIZING will be published in early 2013. But you can receive a PDF of the complete manuscript about two months early if you choose one of the preview reward levels of this crowdfunding campaign.

WHY: Does what we've done to nature break your heart? Does economic inequity sadden you? Do change-resistant institutions--the ones that are supposed to be solving our local, national, and global problems--frustrate you? Does the capture of government by Big Money interests anger you?

If so, RECIVILIZING might be the best news you've ever read. You're invited to help make this book a reality by pre-ordering your copy via this campaign. You can also get an early copy of the finished manuscript, about two months ahead of the rest of the world.

WHO AM I? My name is Storm Cunningham. I'm CEO of ReCitizen, a startup organization in Washington DC. Our mission is to create a global network of citizen-led regeneration efforts. We will provide online tools to facilitate these initiatives free of charge to communities worldwide.

George Ochs, Managing Partner at JP Morgan generously calls me: "...the world's thought leader on community revitalization and natural resource restoration." I don't know if that's true, but if you'd like to learn more about my activities, my public speaking services, and what others have said about me, click here.

If you'd like to see what public and private leaders have said about my 2002 book, The Restoration Economy (from Berrett-Koehler, a wonderful publisher), click here.

If you'd like to see what public and private leaders have said about my 2008 book, Rewealth (from McGraw-Hill Professional), click here.

WHY AM I SELF-PUBLISHING? McGraw-Hill paid me a $25,000 advance (no complaints there) for my 2008 book, Rewealth. It was the first book to document a proven process for community revitalization. But, this Fortune 500 company deleted an entire chapter on what was wrong with the U.S. economy. They said it was "negative" concerning Wall Street and giant corporations. That book came out in 2008, just as the U.S. economy crashed. The book got great reviews, but I wish it included that chapter.

I'm self-publishing this new book via Amazon's CreateSpace service. As a result, I can tell the unvarnished truth about the public and private institutions that are killing nature and damaging society. More important, I'm going to demonstrate how citizens in small towns and large cities are now BYPASSING these roadblocks to restoring and revitalizing our communities, our planet, and democracy.

We're poised for paradise, if your idea of paradise is healing and revitalizing our communities and our planet. Want to take part?

Thank you! - Storm

P.S. - Two notes about what you'll see in the video:

1) It's a victim of global warming. The sequences were shot during the hottest week in Washington DC's recorded history. Between the temperature and the humidity, the perceived heat was close to 120F. So, if I look a bit flushed or wilted, that's why.

2) The book cover is just a placeholder I created myself. When the book is close to publication, and the cover copy has been finalized, a professional artist will design the cover. There's a lot of text on the front cover right now, but some of it will eventually be moved to the back cover.

Don't worry: recivil wars are peaceful, joyful, profitable, and cooperative. They are recivilizing our world, and just in time. ReCivil wars are the cure for what ails 99% of us.
In this introductory 8-minute video (above), you'll discover the "good side" of the current economic disaster: the "perfect storm" of crises and technologies that launched the crowdfunded, citizen-led community renewal trend. Using just your computer or smart phone, you can now fix your local environment, economy, society, and government...while quickly creating an ideal career for yourself.
You can pre-order RECIVILIZING right here, right now, via this crowdfunding campaign. Depending on the "reward" level you chose, you can even receive an advance copy of the completed manuscript, months before the rest of the world sees the book. This will give you, your organization, or your community a head start of this powerful new trend.
Citizen-led renewal is the long-term solution to your community's revitalization, but it can be the immediate solution to your "personal revitalization".
WHAT: I'm self-publishing my third book, RECIVILIZING.  You can pre-order your copy, here and now, to help bring this book to the world. It's your guidebook to revitalizing your career, your life, and your community simultaneously.
WHEN: RECIVILIZING will be published in early 2013. But you can receive a PDF of the complete manuscript about two months early if you choose one of the preview reward levels of this crowdfunding campaign.
WHY: Does what we've done to nature break your heart? Does economic inequity sadden you? Do change-resistant institutions--the ones that are supposed to be solving our local, national, and global problems--frustrate you? Does the capture of government by Big Money interests anger you?
If so, RECIVILIZING might be the best news you've ever read. You're invited to help make this book a reality by pre-ordering your copy via this campaign. You can also get an early copy of the finished manuscript, about two months ahead of the rest of the world.
WHO AM I? My name is Storm Cunningham. I'm CEO of ReCitizen, a startup organization in Washington DC. Our mission is to create a global network of citizen-led regeneration efforts. We will provide online tools to facilitate these initiatives free of charge to communities worldwide.
George Ochs, Managing Partner at JP Morgan generously calls me: "...the world's thought leader on community revitalization and natural resource restoration." I don't know if that's true, but if you'd like to learn more about my activities, my public speaking services, and what others have said about me, click here.
If you'd like to see what public and private leaders have said about my 2002 book, The Restoration Economy (from Berrett-Koehler, a wonderful publisher), click here.
If you'd like to see what public and private leaders have said about my 2008 book, Rewealth (from McGraw-Hill Professional), click here.
WHY AM I SELF-PUBLISHING? McGraw-Hill paid me a $25,000 advance (no complaints there) for my 2008 book, Rewealth. It was the first book to document a proven process for community revitalization. But, this Fortune 500 company deleted an entire chapter on what was wrong with the U.S. economy. They said it was "negative" concerning Wall Street and giant corporations. That book came out in 2008, just as the U.S. economy crashed. The book got great reviews, but I wish it included that chapter.
I'm self-publishing this new book via Amazon's CreateSpace service. As a result, I can tell the unvarnished truth about the public and private institutions that are killing nature and damaging society. More important, I'm going to demonstrate how citizens in small towns and large cities are now BYPASSING these roadblocks to restoring and revitalizing our communities, our planet, and democracy.
We're poised for paradise, if your idea of paradise is healing and revitalizing our communities and our planet. Want to take part?
Thank you! - Storm
P.S. - Two notes about what you'll see in the video:
1) It's a victim of global warming. The sequences were shot during the hottest week in Washington DC's recorded history. Between the temperature and the humidity, the perceived heat was close to 120F. So, if I look a bit flushed or wilted, that's why.
2) The book cover is just a placeholder I created myself. When the book is close to publication, and the cover copy has been finalized, a professional artist will design the cover. There's a lot of text on the front cover right now, but some of it will eventually be moved to the back cover.

story:
What is Flux Webzine?

Flux Webzine is a Brisbane-based, Queensland-focused online magazine, which provides industry information and showcased work from the local design industry. The webzine is a creation of Flux Collective – a group of 3 design students with a passion and yearning to contribute their creativity to the industry that has inspired them. The goal is to grow Flux Webzine to a larger publication so that it can become a major platform for emerging designers to gain exposure, and learn about successful designers in their locale.

 

Who is Flux Collective?

As mentioned, Flux Collective is a creative collective currently made up of 3 emerging graphic designers – Mish Stark, Ben Smith and Jeremy Swanborough. All high-performers at University, they share a keen interest in making an ongoing contribution to the design industry in Queensland and came together to combine their forces to create something of meaning and value.

Ben is the Flux Collective magazine specialist and composition guru, with a keen interest in moving the webzine forward to encompass Rich Media functionality. He is also the Project Manager, keeps the team on schedule, and takes care of file and data management. Mish specializes in Branding and can be described as a pseudo-Creative Director – she holds the main vision and oversees general content creation and quality control. Jeremy is the Flux web and technology specialist. He is responsible for the creation, overall design, development and maintenance of the Flux Collective website. Together, their individual talents, skill sets and experiences lay a solid foundation for a successful venture.

 

Our Campaign

Flux Webzine has been in operation in its current form for 3 months and has quickly gained a significant following in Brisbane. With over 1800 Flux Webzine views so far, we believe that there is a definite market for the publication to grow and extend our scope to encompass all of Queensland, and possibly other related design disciplines.

Our Indiegogo campaign comes as a result of us needing extra funds to reach our larger goal. As volunteers, we put significant time into a non-commercial not-for-profit venture, and thus have no commercial income stream to support future growth. Contributors will help us to improve, expand and continue to publish Flux Webzine. The effects of your contribution towards Flux Webzine will include:

  • Playing a positive role in how design is perceived within the industry and by the larger community
  • Enable young and emerging designers to gain exposure and kickstart their careers
  • Show the creative talent that is often overlooked in Queensland in favour of major cities such as Sydney and Melbourne – and thus making these cities recognize Queensland design as a significant creative force.
  • Allow creative and interested parties to gain inspiration and knowledge about Graphic Design and associated industries.

 

Where will your contribution go?

We have a specific vision of what your contributions will help with, and these are outlined below. However, our creative goals in relation to Flux Webzine are limitless! So if our campaign contributions go above and beyond our initial goal, we will be able to grow and develop the project even further.

To celebrate our 10th issue we plan to release a ‘bumper’ edition of Flux Webzine, which will hopefully include a Rich Media iPad design - setting the stage for the bigger and better Flux Webzine in 2013. The bumper edition will celebrate our past issues and include new features and unreleased content!

A rich media magazine design is basically a magazine designed specifically for viewing on a digital tablet, as they behave like websites and are incredibly interactive. Consequently, this magazine publication platform is becoming increasingly popular and forging new industry standards.

Whilst development of the traditional bumper edition will cost time and money, there are also a few key requirements for creating a Rich Media Magazine design - which is where we need your help! The two key costs include purchasing an Adobe Digital Publishing Suite license (AUD$400) and an iTunes developer member ship (AUD$100). Your assistance with these costs will allow us to purchase these licenses and publish the FREE rich media magazine on iTunes!

If we don’t reach our goal and aren’t able to publish a Rich Media magazine, your contributions will still significantly assist in the creation of a traditional bumper edition and the expansion of Flux Webzine in 2013.

 

Perks - What will your contribution get you? 

  • $5: Our eternal love and gratitude
  • $10: Your name in our “Contributors” section in the Webzine
  • $25: All of the above PLUS an A4 print of your chosen Flux Collective artwork 
  • $50: All of the above PLUS an A3 print of your chosen Flux Collective Artwork
  • $100: All of the above PLUS a page in Flux Webzine dedicated to YOU! Use the opportunity to plug yourself, your work or something else you are passionate about…
  • $150: All of the above, PLUS a Flux Collective VIP lanyard & invitation to our Graduate Exhibition (in Brisbane), where you’ll receive a special gift and see your name/face on Flux’s special thanks wall.
  • $1000: All of the above, PLUS a producer credit in Flux Webzine.

 

Don’t have the means to contribute right now?

If a monetary contribution is not currently within your means, there are still ways you can help! We’d love it if you shared our Webzine link with your friends and online contacts. Or simply use the Indiegogo Share tools while you’re here on the site. 

 

Thank you for your time & any contributions received! <3 Flux Collective.

story:
Contribute to help us get history books to public libraries!

We want to bring our history books onto public library shelves, and we need your help to do it!
 
Legacy Books Press was founded in 2007 as a micro press specializing in non-fiction history books – books about those corners of history that aren’t always explored, but still helped shape the world we live in today.  Our titles include the critically acclaimed The Secret History of Star Wars, by Michael Kaminski, The War that Changed the World, by John-Allen Price, and Bayonets and Blobsticks, by Aaron Taylor Miedema.  They are wonderful books by amazing authors.  But, there was a problem.

As a micro-press, Legacy Books Press lacked the reach that would get these books onto public library shelves, so that readers could enjoy them again and again.  The distribution network was there, but the ability to get the libraries’ attention was lacking.  In the last year, we have begun our transition into a small press, hiring The Cadence Group (now New Shelves Distribution) to handle the sales effort.  With Cadence’s track record, we were certain that we could finally reach out to the libraries and give these books – and their authors – the attention they deserved.

So, a campaign was planned to bring these wonderful books to the attention of libraries across North America.  The books for the campaign were printed and shipped to The Cadence Group – everything was ready.  And then, disaster struck.  Due to circumstances beyond anybody’s control, Legacy Books Press ended up underfunded by over $4,000.  There was no choice – for the business to continue operations, the library campaign had to be put on an indefinite hold.

But with your help, we can raise the money to help bring these amazing books onto library shelves, where they can be enjoyed by thousands upon thousands of readers across North America.  Help us bring history books to libraries now!

What We Need & What You Get

Legacy Books Press needs your help to bring its wonderful books to public libraries across North America.  To do this we need to raise $7,500, which will go cover the costs of the library campaign.

If you can help us raise this money by November 28th, Legacy Books Press will be able to start the library campaign by December 1, 2012.  New Shelves Distribution will market Legacy Books Press’ history collection to public library systems, with these history books expected to start arriving on the shelves of a library near you within two months of the campaign beginning.

And, if we raise enough money before the deadline, the library campaign will start as soon as enough money has been raised.  So, the sooner we reach our goals, the sooner these wonderful books will be on library shelves for the public to enjoy.

For your generosity and support, we have several perks available – with no geographic limitations on any of them.  It doesn’t matter if you’re in Antarctica – if you donate and earn a perk, we will find a way to get it to you.

For a $25 contribution, you will receive a DRM-free e-book in MOBI format of your choice from the following titles:
  • The Secret History of Star Wars, by Michael Kaminski
  • The War that Changed the World, by John-Allen Price
  • The Face of the Foe, by Kjeld Hald Galster
  • Bayonets and Blobsticks, by Aaron Taylor Miedema
  • The Traveller on the Road of Legends, by Robert B. Marks, Legacy Books Press’ first foray into publishing fiction!

For a $50 contribution, aka the Silver level, you will receive a book of your choice from the current Legacy Books Press history collection.  Your options are:
  • A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Agora: 2nd Edition, by R. Drew Griffith and Robert B. Marks
  • The Secret History of Star Wars, by Michael Kaminski
  • The War that Changed the World, by John-Allen Price
  • The Face of the Foe, by Kjeld Hald Galster
  • Bayonets and Blobsticks, by Aaron Taylor Miedema
  • The Art of War: Restored Edition, by Baron Antoine Henri de Jomini
  • The Great War as I Saw It, by Canon George Frederick Scott
  • How I Filmed the Great War, by Geoffrey Malins

For a $100 contribution, aka the Gold level, you will receive two books of your choice from the current Legacy Books Press history collection (the same list as the Silver level).

For a $200 contribution, aka the Platinum level, not only will you receive two books of your choice from the Silver level list, but we will also donate copies of the same two books to a library of your choice.

For a $500 contribution, aka the Penultimate level, you will receive the entire Legacy Books Press history collection – the whole of the Silver level list – in addition to Kjeld Hald Galster’s new book, Crucial Coalition: Anglo-Danish Military Collaboration and the Lessons of History.  Crucial Coalition doesn’t hit the store shelves until November 15th, but you can have it now.

For a $1000 contribution, aka the Ultimate level, not only will you receive the entire Legacy Books Press history collection, along with Crucial Coalition, but the entire collection and Crucial Coalition will also be donated to a library of your choice!
 
As these perks may involve printing books and international shipping, please allow 4-6 weeks for delivery.  If you have donated via credit card, please understand that Legacy Books Press will not receive your donation until the end of the campaign (that's just the way Indiegogo works - don't ask us why), and allow 4-8 weeks for delivery after December 1st (just in case your books end up caught up in the holiday rush).

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, this doesn’t mean you can’t help!  Please, help us out by:
  • Getting the word out about this campaign – tell your friends, family, Facebook friends, etc.
  • Spread the word with the Indiegogo share tools.
  • And, most important of all, support your local library!

story:
What’s up?

My name is Eric James and on most days I’m your typical middle manager in a suit. What you may not know is I’m also a produced screenwriter who has a penchant for travel. I’ve also been known to drop the suit and disappear for months to perform my version of a walk-about.  Come early next year I am going walk-about again, but this time with purpose.

You + Local = Yocal.

Go local. Shop local. Eat local. We’ve all heard these catchphrases at every turn and I’m all for it. But what does it mean to be local? Yocal is about discovering what keeps locals, local. Each book will detail thirty days spent in various cities, foreign and domestic, mixing it up with the local population discovering their secrets and documenting success and failures alike for your enjoyment.

What I need.

My goal is $5,000.

$3000 will be for the expenses involved with a month spent exploring. I will have to pay rent, food, travel, and other daily expenses that one incurs while living local. Part of the goal is show how hard/easy it is to get into a city and get set up as if I’m staying long term.

$2000 will go towards the writing, editing, marketing, and publishing of the first Yocal travel experience plus my first travel book, A Fish In The Vineyard. A Fish In The Vineyard is about my time in France, living on a vineyard learning about French wine, all the while I can’t speak any French. Needless to say it’s a comedy. 

The Impact.

I believe Yocal can become a lifestyle changer. More about life than style. There is already a slow food movement, why not a slow travel movement?

Once I get traction I’d like to invite other writers to pursue the Yocal way and build support and success through others. No one gets anywhere alone.

Risks.

Many. Clowns and Mariachi’s have been found in most towns and cities.

How can you help?

Donate, but if you can’t donate then please pass this on to anyone with a curiosity for travel and/or humor.

Sincerely, thank you for any help you can extend.

story:
WHY THIS BOOK?

It’s a stereotype because it’s true: men often have trouble talking about their failed marriages.

While they may be reluctant to openly share their pain, especially with other men, I think they’re more likely to pick up a book about it, where they’ll see their own struggles reflected and know they’re not alone.

When I was going through my divorce, I was desperate to find books that would offer advice and hope, affirm what I was going through, and let me know I’d survive it. 

I scoured the shelves, but almost all I found were titles like When He Leaves, Runaway Husbands, and A Woman’s Journey Through Divorce.

To be fair, I did find a handful of books written by men. Some were helpful, but few spoke to the emptiness and grief I was struggling with. Instead, the majority covered topics like how to secure the best attorney, keep your financial assets, gain custody of your children, and have great sex again.

Those are all helpful subjects. But Falling Forward is a different kind of book.

It explores the emotional landscape of a man’s divorce, from the marriage’s collapse to the author’s eventual healing. It’s a story about the questions all divorcees will recognize:

How do you start a whole new life from the ruins of all you’ve known for so long? How do you handle the shame of those who judge you for your marriage’s failure? Will you ever feel normal again?

What crutches work to pull you through the hard times and what don’t? Will you survive the bottomless grief of losing the most important relationship in your life? How do you handle dating again after years of marriage?

Falling Forward will be a collage of brief essays that recount a vivid journey of heartbreak, disillusionment, and ultimately hope.

But this book is not just for men. Pain is no respecter of gender. Fortunately, neither is healing. So just as men can benefit from divorce books written by and for women (like I did), I believe Falling Forward will also resonate with female readers, providing solace for their struggles as well as unique insight into what men experience.

It’s a labor of love, and I hope you can be part of the journey in bringing it to readers.

If you’d like to sample Falling Forward before you pledge, check out a short chapter here.

Thank you so much!

Chris

WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?

The book will be shopped to traditional publishers, but before that can be done, I have to finish the manuscript! Costs include writing and professional editing, cover design, formatting for print and digital conversion, and printing and distributing a limited edition of physical copies.

Your pledge will go toward making this book a reality and, I hope, helping other people who are struggling through the trauma of divorce.

Can’t give right now? Times are hard. I totally get it. You can still help by telling your friends about the book, directing them to this page, and sharing on Facebook and other social media sites. Anything you can do is appreciated!

WHY THIS BOOK?

It’s
a stereotype because it’s true: men often have trouble talking about their
failed marriages.
While
they may be reluctant to openly share their pain, especially with other men, I
think they’re more likely to pick up a book about it, where they’ll see their
own struggles reflected and know they’re not alone.
When
I was going through my divorce, I was desperate to find books that would offer
advice and hope, affirm what I was going through, and let me know I’d survive
it. I scoured the shelves, but almost all I found were titles like When He Leaves, Runaway Husbands, and A Woman’s Journey Through Divorce.
To
be fair, I did find a handful of books written by men. Some were helpful, but
few spoke to the emptiness and grief I was struggling with. Instead, the
majority covered topics like how to secure the best attorney, keep your
financial assets, gain custody of your children, and have great sex again.
Those
are all helpful subjects. But Falling Forward is a different kind of book.
It
explores the emotional landscape of a man’s divorce, from the marriage’s collapse to the author’s eventual healing. It’s a story about
the questions all divorcees will recognize:
How
do you start a whole new life from the ruins of all you’ve known for so long?
How do you handle the shame of those who judge you for your marriage’s failure?
Will you ever feel normal again?
What
crutches work to pull you through the hard times and what don’t? Will you
survive the bottomless grief of losing the most important relationship in your
life? How do you handle dating again after years of marriage?
Falling Forward will be
a collage of brief essays that recount a vivid journey of heartbreak,
disillusionment, and ultimately hope.
But
this book is not just for men. Pain is no respecter of gender. Fortunately,
neither is healing. So just as men can benefit from divorce books written by
and for women (like I did), I believe Falling Forward will also resonate with female readers, providing solace for
their struggles as well as unique insight into what men experience.
It’s
a labor of love, and I hope you can be part of the journey in bringing it to
readers.
If you’d
like to sample Falling Forward before you pledge, check out a short chapter here.
Thank
you so much!
Chris

story:
UPDATE: Thank you to everyone who supported us! Because we didn't raise enough to produce our guide book, we have donated, as planned, all proceeds to the Detroit Riverfront Conservancy. Thank you again!

We want to crowd source a guide from Detroiters that is packed with a lot of soul, local lore, stories, favorite haunts, and watering holes.  Equal parts tribute and travel guide, this guidebook will be 100% your voices. 

Space + Value = Place.  Help us tell the world about all the amazing lives being led in Detroit. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make this happen, we need YOU and in the words of Motown’s Temptations, we Ain’t to Proud to Beg for your help!

This guide relies on your cultural knowledge to comprise the book and of course we need the capital to make it happen. We know you want to share your stories (you’re Detroiters after all) and we hope that you will donate your urban insight and chip in a little to get this guide made. 

Once the campaign is funded, we will reach out with a template for you to fill out depending on your contribution. The template will lend you creative freedom to put in whatever you want, stories, pictures, lists, you name it.  As soon as we are able to compile everyone's submissions, you'll have the guide in your hands as soon as possible!

We will be donating a portion of the proceeds to Detroit Riverfront Conservancy, an organization that is transforming Detroit's international riverfront - the face of the city - into a beautiful, exciting, safe, accessible world-class gathering place for all. If our campaign does not tip and we are not able to compile the guide, all proceeds will be donated to the Detroit Riverfront Conservancy. 

The Impact

Haven’t you ever traveled somewhere and only wished you knew some real locals who could give you the lowdown on what life there is really like?

This is a rare chance for you to share in the creation of the first local crowd sourced guide by sharing your recommendations, memories, and experiences. Let’s show the world what’s really goin’ on in Detroit! 

We know you want to share your story, help us make this happen!

Other Ways to Help

Even if you can’t contribute, please share with your friends and spread the word!

story:
Origins Revealed

A paranormal, crime novel with a premise none has come up with before, but due to the market being flooded with generic vampire novels mainstream publishing houses shy away from taking on a manuscript in this genre. However I've been told by an agent that the story is new and exciting and she would have loved taking it on, but the agency no longer takes takes anything in the genre. 

However, after several beta readers have read it and assured me it certainly has every chance of becoming a best-seller, I feel I should try to raise the funds to not only get it professionally edited, but have a really good cover, and after its release have it backed by a great marketing campaign. 

And that's where the crowdfunding is needed for. Editing fees, cover design, and marketing are all things that come at a price. As with all things quality will cost, and I will not settle for mediocrity if the written words deserve the best finishing touch and push onto the shelves money can buy.

Who am I and Why should you back me?

I am Lucy Pireel, the author of Red Gone Bad, A Menu of Death, and Bound. All three well received by the public. But since I never had the funds to really market the books they sell only at a slow pace.

This novel however is worth being put in the market with a bang loud enough to be heard over the static noise the vast amount of other indie books published on a daily basis create.

The £10,000 I aim to raise will go towards:

 -hiring a professional editor, who has proven he knows his trade 

-hiring a professional cover designer and commissioning an image by a photographer (Lee Turnbull) who knows how to capture a specific feeling. 

The formatting of the book is something I will do myself, but after that comes the marketing stage. So a huge chunk of the funding will go to professional marketing tools, such as:

-allocating budget to get professional reviewers to read and review the novel as well as obtain a Kirkus review ($575), and others from professional reviewers.

-acquire a listing on several sites that recommend books to readers.

-hire a social media assistent to really push the book up on the reader's list and into the public eye, while I can write the next book on my list.

Even if I shouldn't manage to reach the entire goal, it still would help to get the manuscript edited and published. The release might not be accompanied by a loud bang with less funds, but at least the novel itself will be worth teh reader's time and money for it will be without errors.

The Impact

Your contribution will make the difference between this author not being able to hire the best editor for the best paranormal, crime novel you could ever read, or getting a great novel published of which you can say, "I helped realise it."

This is my first ever crowd sourcing campaign and I'm stumbling in the dark here, but with your help I am sure this will be a success. 

The work is done, as in the novel is written, it just needs your help to get it polished and ready to hit the markets.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have any money to spare and just can’t contribute financially, please help in other, not less valuable ways.

  • Get the word out, make some noise about my campaign. Twitter, Google+, blog about it, or Pin it
  • And remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

That's all I can say about it now, but feel free to contact me if you need to know more, and I'd be happy to tell you all you need to know.

story:
Short Summary

'Flight of the Goddess' covers a much-needed topic within archaeology and art history - of the period in which Goddess cults spread into the early Greek Archaic and Mediterranean world. 

The book incorporates the era known as the 'Orientalizing period' in art, which has not been well-covered within literature. It is an era of intensified trade and cultural exchange within the Mediterranean, when the purple-pigment-dealing Phoenicians sailed the Mediterranean, alongside numerous other cultural groups. 

The Goddesses sanctuaries provided places of devotion and shared worship of the feminine divine. Amongst the images which entered the visual vocabulary (alongside the Phoenician alphabet) was symbols long held sacred and in association to ancient Goddesses. These include the flower rosette and star of Venus (associated with Inanna - Ishtar), the bivalve shell - used for storing and transporting cosmetic pigment known as far back as the Tombs of Ur, and the 'holy horn / boat of heaven'.  

British Museum 'Ear rings featuring flower rosette, sphinx, crescent and bivalve shells' (c420-400 BC) Found in Eretrea

The period saw not only new styles of art, but also the introduction of drinking practices and rich mythologies; ideas which journeyed onto islands and new lands, woven amongst imagery of shells, flower rosettes, winged women, sirens, and women-in-the-window linked to Goddess cults. With incense wafting, bejewelled thrones, and sacred necklaces, the narrative will interweave passages of the famous female poet, Sappho of Lesbos, and the mythology of the Sirens in flowery meadows (al)luring men with their song and promised knowledge of all things, and Homerian Odes to the Goddess, as well as even more ancient cuneiform hymns and rituals from Mesopotamia and Assyria.   

British Museum 'Siren Vase' (Red Figure Stamnos) of Odysseus tied to the mast of his boat to avoid the lure of the sirens, c480-470 BC, excavated from Vulci, Italy. 


ABOUT THE AUTHOR - EMMA LOUISE WESTON

I hold a Masters in Comparative Art and Archaeology degree from University College London, and a Bachelors degree in Art History and Theory from the University of Otago. Alongside my majors, I have also studied across Classical Studies, Religious Studies, Architecture and Ancient Art. 

Completing the 'Flight of the Goddess'

Thank you so much for reading this and for your interest. 

I am on the last leg required to complete my book on 'Flight of the Goddess'. Having done all the background reading and sourcing all the books and articles, what I now need is to physically go to Cyprus where much of the primary collection of archaeology and figurines is located. There I will meet with museum curators, uncover information on find sites of particular objects and their context within Goddess temples, and finish off writing the book.

Louvre Museum 'Model of a Goddess temple' (6th Century BC) Cypro-Archaic 

My plan is to visit Cyprus in the off-season in the late Winter / early Spring, leaving around the beginning of March.


Photograph of a Cyprus Airways A330 aircraft 


The Impact

The book will be an elegant and accessibly written format, which traces a long duration journey of the Goddess and her symbols. From Inanna to Ishtar to Astarte and other deities, through to the arrival of Aphrodite into the Greek pantheon, and her Roman counter-part, Venus, with cross-overs of many other Goddesses along the way. 

The book will be of relevance to scholars and ordinary folk, providing a lively and delicious feast of images and mythologies, which set the Goddess once again in full flight. As always, my book will be meticulously referenced for those wanting to undertake further reading on any point raised. 

Museum of Fine Arts, Boston 'Lekythos of the Goddess Aphrodite' c350 BCE

I have studied broadly, across Mesopotamia, the Mediterranean and Classical world, and specialize in ancient art and iconography. I do not know of any book which has traced the images, rituals and hymns of the Goddess in this manner and duration. In my characteristic style, I will be interweaving images, ancient cuneiform hymns and papyrus poetry written by poets to the Goddess, presenting sacred jewelry, and showing how shells which held cosmetic came to be associated with the Goddess as she arrived on the island of Cyprus. And how the Sirens of mythology combined aspects of temple architecture, images of winged Goddesses and devotion and prayer expressed in music and hymns.

'Flight of the Goddess' will not only be a valuable book to archaeology and Classical Studies pupils seeking to understand the motifs and material culture of the era, but will also be a wonderful book generally for people to read. A sensory tale of sea journeys, temples, jewelry and beauty, it will be resplendent with colour illustrations of well-known and rare artifacts relating to the movement of the Goddess. Most importantly, it will be written and presented in a way that is accessible to all.    

Image of Aphrodite Anadyomene on a wall fresco from Pompeii (before 79 CE) 


Other Ways You Can Help


- Someone may have a holiday house sitting empty somewhere in the vicinity of Cyprus, Rhodes, Crete, Lebanon, Turkey, or indeed around near Sorrento and the Bay of Naples, where I could stay and be able to write during part of my journey.

The shores of Paphos, where the Goddess Aphrodite arrives fully-formed in mythology.

- Any private collection images of Astarte or Aphrodite, and other Goddesses, relevant material or information would be greatly appreciated. I know there are some amazing private collections out there, with images and figurines that may otherwise be unknown of.

- Any articles I may have missed, or which may be printed in foreign language and are relevant to my book are absolutely welcomed. I've done a lot of research, but there's always more out there that may have been overlooked or not known of as it was published in a foreign language.

- You can help spread the word via Twitter, social media, Facebook, or any other way you like!

story:
The Luxury of Grief (working title)

What do you say to someone in grief? You want to say something other than the generic, yet heartfelt, "I'm sorry for your loss," but you never seem to find the words.

How can you support someone who just lost a loved one, or a job, or is going through a divorce? 

If you're in grief, how can you talk about it without fear of 'bringing everyone down' and bringing the conversation to a screeching, grinding halt?

This sometimes humorous, always earnest look at grief gives you both sides of the coin.

I have found that people don't understand their own grief, or even recognize that it is grief.  It takes many forms, and has many causes. Death and illness are not the only catalists for grief. Job loss, lost friendships, divorce, adoption, rejection, fears of a life mispent all manifest feelings of grief and regret.

Grief is an often misconceived notion. It is not an emotion, but rather, a catalist for thought, reflection, and occasional regret that manifests raw emotion. Everyone processes grief in their own way. This book explores the many causes, and reactions to grief, how to talk about it and  

With our fast paced, technologically driven society, we have lost our ability to grieve as a part of life. It is put on the back burner to be dealt with at another time, or in a therapist's office years later. 

Why am I writing this book?

As Americans, grief is among the taboo subjects. On Sesame Street, when Mr. Hooper (Will Lee) died, they explained death to Big Bird. They received hate mail from parents.  

To the majority of Americans, grief is usually experienced alone and in secret. 

Becoming the oldest living member of an entire side of my family at the age of 35 has given me an intimacy of knowledge when it comes to grief. 
 
Last year, my best friend's mother died. I saw his father surrounded by loved ones saying "I'm sorry for your loss", "She was a wonderful woman," and "She'll be missed." I could tell that he was white knuckling his way through the heartfelt, yet somewhat generic expressions of support. When I approached the grieving widower, I found myself speaking to him in a very honest and intimate way (with his permission, of course). At the end, he gave me a huge hug (he's not a hugger) and thanked me. 
 
At Burning Man last year, I found myself in the Temple, helping stranger after stranger through their own grief. Their stories of grief could not have been more varied - death, divorce, break-ups, abuse, adoption and life-long illness. I was in shock with my ability to welcome complete strangers into my arms and listen to their stories.
 
It was then that I decided to write a book that goes beyond the 5 Stages of Grief and gives people real stories, real advice and real permission to grieve in their own way. It is meant for those in grief, and those around them. 
 
 My research is complete. I have a wall of index cards mapping out the chapters. And Chapter One is complete (but most likely, it will become Chapter Three). 

Why do I need your help?

It has taken me 6 months to complete one chapter. This is not the kind of book that I have been able to write a few pages per day. Even though this is not an autobiography of my own grief, it does take me a little time to find my way. This is why I want to dedicate one day every week exclusively to writing.  With the part time jobs I now hold, that is currently difficult to achieve. I work 7 days a week. 
 
With successful funding, I have a goal of completing one chapter every 4-5 weeks. 

Right now, I am working several part time jobs, 7 days a week. A successful campaign will give me the opportunity to take one day off a week to focus solely on the completion of the book by September, 2013. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with those in your online communities.

It has taken me 6 months to complete one chapter. This is not the kind of book that I have been able to write a few pages per day. Even though this is not an autobiography of my own grief, it does take me a little time to find my way. This is why I want to dedicate one day every week exclusively to writing.  With the part time jobs I now hold, that is currently difficult to achieve. I work 7 days a week. 
 
With successful funding, I have a goal of completing one chapter every 4-5 weeks. 
Right now, I am working several part time jobs, 7 days a week. A successful campaign will give me the opportunity to take one day off a week to focus solely on the completion of the book by September, 2013. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Please share this campaign with those in your online communities.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Simon Travers and I come from Plymouth UK. I am a trained Pentecostal minister, but last year I took a year out to set up my own publishing brand called Stackhouse Jones and write a book called Anatomy.

I've started this campaign to help me publish Anatomy. It's a book of poems and essays that take the themes and imagery from the Song of Solomon and place them in the 21st Century. I want to present a Christian vision of marriage that goes beyond merely repeating traditional western family values. Anatomy introduces you to a husband and wife, and invites you to draw as close as you dare while they make love with each other, whisper to each other, and build a common identity which changes them both.

Publishing Anatomy would be a personal achievement for me, the culmination of a year of hard work. It probably won't break the bestsellers list, but I know that for some who find it, Anatomy will be a powerful voice of hope and grace.

What We Need & What You Get

To publish Anatomy, I need £600. That may not seem like a lot of money, but it will make all the difference to my book getting to market quickly and effectively.

My first priority is to purchase a block of 10 ISBN numbers. This costs £126. This will allow me to create 3 editions of the book (print, EPUB, Kindle) and give me the opportunity of a head start on my next 2 projects.

My second priority is to produce a short run of 200 printed copies of the book. I expect this to cost just under £300.

The rest of the money I raise will be used to invest into publicity and promotional materials, such as videos for my website and printed materials such as advertising postcards.

In return for contributing to the project, I will be offering a range of perks related to the release of the book, with the opportunity to guarantee free copies of future Stackhouse Jones projects.

The Impact

This is the first time that I have ever published a book, so I cannot point to a long track record. All I can tell you is that I have been fully committed to this project. It has been my full time job for the last year without pay. I am ensuring high standards by getting the book proof-read by an experienced proof-reader.

I am aiming to produce an abridged audio version of the poems, and I have made a stop frame animated lyric video of one of my poems 'love and pi'. The proof of the pudding is in the eating, so why not go and check it out at www.stackhousejones.com 

Anatomy is not a vanity project. I've studied English Literature at university and bought poetry alive to teenagers as a teacher. I have researched a wide variety of authors for this project; poets, philosophers, sociologists and monks all have influenced me. When I have road tested the poems with an open-mic audience, I have always received genuine positive feedback about what I have been doing. I have taken risks with my themes and my style, and I've written from the heart.

Anatomy won't be for everyone. It's a surprising read that wants to get under your skin. If you have a stereotype of Christian poetry, this book conforms to that in no way whatsoever. It's true audience is going to value it for its vulnerability, unconventionality and challenge.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can contribute money to this campaign, that would be so amazingly helpful. However, even if you can't, if you're excited by what you've read, please help me get the word out about Anatomy. Make some noise with your friends about the campaign. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to link the campaign to your social media. Also, you can follow me on Twitter and Facebook too.

story:
My Story


Hi. My name's Zachariah Wells; I'm a writer based in Halifax, Nova Scotia. I'm the author of two poetry collections, Unsettled (2004) and Track & Trace (2009). Recently, four of my poems were adapted into songs by Canadian composer Erik Ross, as commissioned by baritone singer Phillip Addis. Mr. Addis will be singing the poems, accompanied on piano by Emily Hamper, at an event in Toronto on December 19. I will, unfortunately, be unable to attend that recital because of work obligations. On January 11, however, they will also be performing at the Opéra National in Paris, France. This is the kind of opportunity that presents itself rarely in most writers' lifetimes, so I wouldn't miss it for anything short of a catastrophe.

I have bought my ticket to Paris, I have booked accommodations and I applied to the Canada Council for the Arts for a grant to cover some of the cost, but my application did not meet with success. My funding target represents the cost of airfare and ground transport to and from airports, as well as a week's accommodation. I will be enormously pleased to raise half of my target, as that is the approximate amount the Canada Council would have covered had my application been successful. 

So: your help would be greatly appreciated.


The Impact

If I can't raise funds to pay for my travel and accommodation costs, then the money will have to come out of my family's general revenue. I work seasonally and on a freelance basis and my wife, who is also a writer, is a substitute teacher and contract literacy programmer, so we are not wealthy. But this isn't a charity or pity case; I'm just trying to come up with a creative way to fund my trip that benefits myself, my family AND my supporters. Win, win, win.


What I Need & What You Get

I have set a goal of $2200 to pay for my transportation and accommodation expenses.

This won't cover 100% of my costs, but I don't want to ask for too much. Any funds raised in excess of my goal will go towards covering lost income and/or will be put towards my future literary endeavours--and will help pay for the AWESOME PERKS you can claim in exchange for your generous support of my campaign. Any contribution of $100 or more will also receive acknowledgment (unless anonymity is preferred) of support in my next published book.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you support my campaign, or would like to but can't spare the cash (believe me, I understand!), please help me spread the word by means of email, blog and social media. Every bit helps.

story:
Hello Everyone!

Do you want to win $400? Of course you do!


The Basic Details

My name is Chris Schmidt, and I have been researching my Family history for the last 13 years. I am writing a family history on the family – that is my mum's maiden name – and I am researching this full time from March until the end of May. This project is to raise the difference between what we need to produce and research the book and what I am charging. It will be a high quality, hard cover, full colour book. By investing in this project you can preserve our heritage, and future members of the family will know who they are. If you don't know your family background, you don't understand yourself.

To sum up, “Footprints from the Past: the Descendants of M.F. Kapernick in Australia” will be produced in three parts. One part each will be written on each of the three Kapernick brothers to come to Australia with orders for the first part closing on April 9. Please go to www.facebook.com/kapernick.descendants.family.history and click on the About Us tab to find out more. As you can see, the first part will be available on 15 October 2013.

Goal of Project

1. Preserve the history and culture of our family and therefore the state of Queensland, Australia where they settled

2. Document the stories of our ancestors

What If  I am not part of the family is this relevant to me?

SIMPLE ANSWER YES FOR FOLLOWING REASONS:

1. Preserve our culture and history is everyone's responsibility- it is not just the family that loses its history but the state as a whole

2. You will feel good knowing you are doing the right thing

3. Everyone who donates $2.00 or more goes into the draw to win $400.00.

4. For a limited time- until the perks on that donation run out- for every $20.00 you donate you get an extra entry in the prize draw. However, the sites accept donations as low as $1.00.

Is my donation Secure?

The contribute button will link you through to PayPal where you can enter your credit card details securely, which means we never see them and can never access them. You will also know you are doing the right thing by preserving our history – not just that of the family but of our state and country.

Why Did I get involved in Writing my Family History

People ask me why write a family history? My answer is because I think it is important and because I love it! My passion for family history began when I was a very young boy sitting on my grandfathers knee. My grandfather was 21 years older than my grandmother, and he used to tell me stories about when he was young. I found it fascinating, and interesting and hard to understand: he was the eldest son of a farmer who emigrated from Prussia, Germany. 

By the time he was seven, my grandfather was working on the farm from the crack of dawn and then walking four miles to school and back home again at the end of the school day. When he got home, he would complete more work on the farm until after dark. He used to say school was a time to sleep in between the real work- he was an intelligent man but didn't have the opportunity for much of an education.

What Skills Am I Bringing to this Project that will add value to your investment?

  1. 20 years experience in marketing and selling generally.

  2. 10 years experience in online marketing, web development, social media and search engine optimisation

  3. Dean Jacobs (www.deanjacobsillustration.com) will be designing and layout out the book. He is gathering an international reputation as an illustrator, author and university lecturer in illustration.

This means that the books will rock! They will be well-written, with excellent layout and quality of production! Your investment is going into a project with class!

Perhaps now it is time to check out one of our Perks? Perhaps you would like the $100 perk, or maybe something a bit smaller is in your budget? The choice is yours!The size of your investment doesn't matter, because by working together we can achieve the goals of this project.

Also point out the bigger the investment you make the more chances you have to win $400.00. For example, if you invested $5000 you would get 300 prize draw entries, plus your your perks. With 300 entries, the chances are high that you win. If you win your net contribution will be close to $0 with the value of the perks. I understand most people cannot do this, and I cannot guarantee you will win, but I am simply pointing out the maths!

The three family history books will cost $67 000 to research, print and produce. Based on orders so far and a conservative projection from that book sales will cover $21 000, DVD versions of the book $9000, page sponsorship $1500, and the ebook version of the book around $1000.00, making a total of $32 500. This leaves a shortfall of $32 000 for the whole three books. In this project, we are asking for $18 000 only.

What are the Main Benefits again?

  • Each donation of over $2.00 goes into the draw to win $400.00

  • For every $20.00 you donate you get an extra entry into the prize draw for a limited period of time until the perks for that donation level run out

  • You will help preserve the history of our family and therefore the state and our country

  • You will also have some great perks to choose from such as Coles-Myer vouchers, books, genealogy site memberships and even a laptop computer.

Now, would you like to go back to checking out the Perks? Perhaps you can afford the $500 investment? Or maybe the $20 is your limit? The choice is yours, and either way I look forward to your investment.

Can I ask everyone a favour? Even if you choose to come back another time to make your investment, please use the Facebook, and Google plus buttons below the video to share this project. It would really help me a lot, and I appreciate the favour.

To Improve credibility I am listing some contact details and information about myself

Full name: Christopher Paul Schmidt

Date of Birth: 29 Dec 1966

Father's Name: Walter Schmidt

Mother's Name: Iris Erica Schmidt

Mobile: 61 413 262 782

Email: chris_schmidt@optusnet.com.au

Address: Modbury, Adelaide

story:
The aim of this compaign is to make a series of 5 books, covering the vinyl labels of the 60s. Each page will be filled with high quality scans of the A and B sides of 45s.

The record label has been one of the most iconic images of the 20th century, from early Bakelite 78s through to the Compact Discs at the end of the century. Recorded music has provided the background for that century and most of us have owned and handled the discs that contained that music. My passion has been the vinyl 45, it was always more than just the music itself but the disc too. Something about the way each disc is the physical representation of all those memories that are evoked by the music contained on it.

These books are I hope a for those who love the music of the 60s, built from my own personal record collection, it contains images of each disc both the A and B side, invoking memories of the music of the biggest and smallest artists alike.

Each image will be scanned by me from the thousands of records that i've obtained over half a century of collecting 45 vinyl. Over the years my collection has grown to around 20,000 discs each with 2 unique labels (A and B side) that I’m slowly building into a digital archive.

 

I started with the 50s and a brain storm one morning thought to turn it into a book, the utility of the ebook and the shear beauty of the physical version makes me want to do the same for the sixties, however my sixties record collection is much bigger!

 

The series takes a total of five books, each around 450 pages with two large colour pictures per page (1 record A and B sides), each label side is scanned, details added into a database and then finally a complete 2 year section is transformed into a book.

 

I've been collecting for collecting for 50 years and never found a book purely on labels, so this hopefully will help fill that spot for other likely minded people.

story:
Our Story

I am focused on experiencing and sharing the sacred and imagination~~ Returning to the garden...


I recently created my astrological counseling practice, Weeping Willow Astrology, and moved to the woods after living in Brooklyn as an art curator for 9 years. I have always lived modestly, usually just enough funds to get by and take classes, but now I am here living in a small community in central Massachusetts which is mostly off the grid. I came here to learn from and live in harmony with nature and to focus on my astrology business-- and now I can see the constellations at night! I am seeing my new lifestyle change as a form of activism, to live in a way that is sustainable.


The Impact

Astrology counseling is a great tool for understand the self, relating and connecting to the great cosmic cycles of the universe. I look at every chart as a beautiful mandala which gives confirmation and information for growth and healing. My astrology work has been a fantastic channel for my high sensitivity, motivation and creativity. More about the cathartic symbol of the Willow, vision & testimonials. *This fundraiser will help me be able to offer free readings to the community.


What We Need & What You Get


This is a pre-sale for my astrological services to help me gain a foundation and market. It will allow me to focus my connection to nature and to develop my practice, combing with art and healing modalities like Reiki. The funds will go to pay my basic bills, take more astrology classes, and stay on this natural path. I am living very modestly among eco-experts/creatives/healers, and enjoying it profusely. You can see video of my cabin here. I receive a food stipend from Earthlands.  I will update this site with videos of Earthlands and Petersham, MA. If I do not make my goal I will still be able to continue Weeping Willow Astrology. I hope you enjoy the magic numbers I used for the perks.

***For the Retreat:
Earthlands
& Michael Todrin:  Lotus Temple Yoga & his blog


Other Ways You Can Help

The success of this project depends upon you valuing this work enough to share and praise it. Emailing your interested contacts, promoting via social networks, and blogging are much appreciated.I have deep gratitude for all of your support and look forward to sharing this journey with you! Please be in touch alison.b.levy@gmail.com

starry blessings, Alison
