story:
PRESS FOR DEAD HEROES

Geekadelphia shows us some love!

TwitchFilm shows us some love!

PRAISE FOR GREG CHRISTIE'S FIRST SERIALIZED E- NOVEL, PISSING IN THE PUNCH BOWL

Mad scientist / artist / writer / boozy critic extraordinaire Greg Christie is no ordinary word slinger and this is no ordinary book we're talking about, . The man is brilliant. And brave. And completely f**king nuts. If you've read some of his Fear & Loathing pieces on Twitch, you have an idea of this man's genius. If you haven't do seek some of them out.  Mitch Davis, Fantasia Film Festival

“We got hate mail, we got fan mail, and it became very, very clear that each new piece - and, by extension, their creator - was an event unto itself.” Todd Brown, Twitch

To my mind, Greg's the best film related journalist/writer/satirist around at the moment and if you've read his work before then you'll know why. If you're new to his stuff then I'll say only that you're in for a treat and a maybe a bit of "what the hell did I just read?" The man really should be writing modern noir novels (hell for all I know he already is) as his work kinda puts me in mind of Charlie Huston and believe me that's high praise.BSR MOVIE SHOW

Philly Film's most outspoken voice. Insanely ambitious! Cinedelphia

SO, WHAT HELL THE IS THE DEAD HEROES SAGA?

The Dead Hero Saga is a comic book influenced serialized E Novel. It's a surreal, horror, noir, super hero story for people who've grown tired of the super hero genre.


The time line runs from 1985 to the present, but the bulk of the material is set in the early and mid 90’s.


The central character is Jessica and she’s unlike any character you’ve read before. She’s a half African, half native American punk rock rriot girl goddess.  She’s strong, smart, vulgar, dangerous, and criminally insane, literally.

In her teens, Jessica was a resident on 62nd and Osage in Philadelphia. She was there in 1985 when the city made the decision to bomb the house belonging to the black radical group, Move.

She lost her severely autistic brother to the flames that claimed 52 row homes that fateful evening and developed an everlasting disdain for any and all figures of authority.

But this is not a work of historical fiction, this is not an  work of explicit political or social commentary.

This is something else entirely.

In the Dead Hero saga, there was also a Super Man that was born out of the rubble of the fire on Osage,  an ominous, all powerful, judgeful, and homicidal super hero only know as “Him.”

"He" was once a corrupt, violent, and racist officer on the Philadelphia police force who ended up in the wrong place at the wrong time.

He’s like Super Man crossed with Dr. Manhatten crossed with the Punisher, and Jason Vorhoees.

This benevolent super hero is actually something of a slasher movie monster.  He’s deadly and unstoppable, and if he thinks you’re a criminal then you’ve just scored yourself a reservation in hell.

Imagine Man of Steel re-imagined as Friday the 13th. 

The story moves forward to the early nineties where Jessica is a member of a DIY all female punk band.  The venue where she performs is owned and operated by the mob and when a big drug deal goes bad during one of her shows, she becomes a target for HIM.

So long as HE believes she is involved with the organized crime family that ran her concert, no one will help her.

She’s a dead woman unless she can find a way to fight back.

But just how do you stop a Super Man?

The answer might just just shock you.

The story again moves a few years forward at the dawn of a new millennium where Jessica has become a petty thief and gun for hire. Now in her early thirties, she's been diagnosed with schizophrenia. As her conditions worsen. She transforms into a costumed super villian modeled on the Lenope tribal folklore.

There are vigilante anti hero mummers, disfigured detectives, and an entire plot line surrounding the Y2K bug.  And if you’re already a fan of my work,  it’s all written with my trademark brand of surreal satire that reads like a lucid fever dream.

 

Most native Philadelphians have long believed that there’s gate to the 9th circle of hell located beneath our city streets, and towards the end of the Dead Hero saga, that gate is opened.
 

HOW ARE YOU GOING TO READ THE DEAD HERO SAGA?

Dead Heroes is an epic and elaborate, multi-faceted serialized novel.

To be more specific, it's a novel that will be comprised of three separate mini novellas.

Book 1: Him

Book 2: Her

Book 3: Them

Each Novella will consist of four parts and each part will have three chapters that will total anywhere from thirty to fifty pages each.

It will be released as a monthly series over the course of the next year starting in August to be read on your Kindles, Ipads, and other electronic reading devices.

But this isn't a typical E-Book. What you’re purchasing (or donating) to is a yearly subscription to the Dead Heroes saga.

Kind of like a comic book huh?

Each part will have its own self contained story and character arc and will be sold as separate E-books on Amazon. While it's preferable that you read the story from the beginning, it's being designed so that new readers and fans can jump in at any point and still follow along and enjoy each part as a singular work.

Kind of like a comic book huh? 

Each part will come with it's own fully illustrated cover and will conclude with a two to five paged comic strip.

Kind of like a comic book huh?.... Oh, wait, maybe it kind of IS a comic book?

WHY SHOULD YOU DONATE TO THIS CAMPAIGN NOW?

There's plenty of incentive to donate to my campaign right now rather than waiting to buy Dead Heroes when it's eventually released on Amazon.

First off, you're saving money! Only during this Indiegogo campaign will you be able to read the Dead Heroes saga for $20. I'll be releasing each part on a monthly basis for roughly $3 - $4 each, which means you're saving anywhere from $16 to $28 right off the bat.

Second, every one who donates now is getting the E-novelization of Pissing in the Punch Bowl for free!

Third, you're helping Dead Heroes be the best that it can be by insuring that I have the start up cash to actually do it.

This is a project that's going to happen with or with out your help and that's the beauty of writing and illustrating, unlike a film project, or a published work of fiction, I don't have any high initial over-head costs.

BUT!

I am a true blue DIY outsider artist, and my resources for making this work are primitive. If you see that I've already met my measely $500 goal, don't think for a second that the campaign is over. 

I'm working on a seven year old laptop with a dead battery and no professional software installed.

Each installment will include an illustrated comic book and while I've made a name for myself with my artwork, I generally use less than ideal materials. 

If I can exceed my goal, I plan on acquiring a better computer with the right additional hardware and software so I can forgo the coloring pencils and make this look like something you really ought to be buying off the shelf of your favorite comic shop.

The more I raise, the better the finished product will be!


ABOUT THE WRITER

Greg Christie is an international man of mystery who writes about his many crazy mis-adventures within the film world for www.Twitchfilm.com.

He’s a disgruntled  film critic, popular for his Boozie Movie drunken reviews and notorious for his Fear and Loathing homages that have now been collected and re-branded as the novel, Pissing in the Punch Bowl.

A native resident of the 9th circle of hell, otherwise known as Philadelphia, Greg has worked on film productions in New York, acted as an assistant press secretary in Harrisburg, and worked with major media festivals in Austin. He won’t say which because he’s not sure if he’s on good terms with them. But if you found this page, chances are, you’re a fan of them.

He’s also a pulpy erotic artist who sometimes goes by the name of Greg Sukebe. After a life destroying stint in Japan, he’s became infected with a chronic condition known as Big Fat Nerdom Japanophilia. The only way to relieve his symptoms is by making really dirty doodles and has since developed a following for his juvenile illustrations of women wrestling with dinosaurs and his even stranger black light erotic art.

He’s also an event organizer and promoter. He founded The Hell Fire Film Club and co-founded the Philadelphia Japan Arts Matsurii.

story:
The Story

Someone has been going around killing a lot of people, but that’s not important right now.

…….

Sylvia Stiletto lives a simple life.  Her job is as easy as sex.  She only has one friend that she needs to keep track of, so what does it matter if that friend is a kleptomaniac?  No one else even knows she exists, and she would like to keep it that way.  Love would only complicate things.

Harry Bland may be washed up, but he is still on the biggest case of his life.  If only he could find the time to concentrate on it.  He is more than happy to simply wait out his remaining years in his recliner watching the evening news.  Love would only complicate things.

Both of their lives are about to get complicated.

Expensive Champagne will be imbibed and pie will be eaten.  There will be prostitution, robbery, sadistic games, and fun times at the fair.  And if all goes as it should, two redneck truckers just might discover the meaning of life.

…….

Also, at some point, someone should really stop this guy from killing more people.  If there’s time.


Who am I, and why am I bothering you?

The hard part is over. 

The book is written. 

Now I have hit a wall that everyone needs to deal with at some point, and that is lack of cash.  My name is Casey Bartsch, and I really want you to read my book.

The last two and a half years of my life have been devoted to this novel.  I wrote it, edited it, and wrote it again….repeat.  Now is the time to finally send it out into the world, but I want to do it right.  I want to eventually make my living doing this.  I have no designs on riches, just bill money that comes from doing something I love.  After carefully analyzing the current market, I’ve decided that the traditional publication route just isn’t as shiny and wonderful as it seemed to be when I first caught the writing bug 15 years go.  Self-publishing has become a viable, and in many ways; preferable alternative.

However, work still needs to be done to get the novel ready for the spotlight.  Editing, copywriting, formatting – all of these things cost. 

·  I have had the book edited as well as it can be without the use of a professional, but that simply isn’t good enough.  I need to hire the expertise of an editor.  Someone who can help me to make the book as good as it can be.  This will run me approximately two grand, depending on how many passes need to be made.

·  Then, the manuscript needs to be formatted.  Both for physical copies and the myriad of digital file types.  The cover needs to be professionally designed so that it doesn’t look like clip art printed in someone’s basement.  From there, we have copywriting, ISBN numbers to assign, a web site to create, etc.  These are the things that a self-publishing company can achieve for me if I hand over a stack of money.  Between 2 and 3 thousand portraits of George Washington in fact.

·  The last step in the process is marketing.  There are a million things that I can do to get the word out about my book, and hopefully I will be able to accomplish two or three of them.  Should I make enough to accomplish the previous two goals, every remaining cent will go here.


What I can do to say Thank You!

Now on to what you get if you should be so awesome as to help me out.

Other than the book itself, there is little I can offer up as incentive other than my other talent.  Namely art.  I am offering original artwork in return for various contribution levels.  Below you can see examples of what is available for each tier.  All pieces will be original and tailored to your specifications.

$10 – A copy of the book as it stands now in Word format.

$25 – A digital copy of the novel after it is edited and professionally formatted.  File type of your choice.

$50 – A physical copy of the book in the event that it is printed.  This hinges solely on money raised.  In the event that goals aren’t reached, or the timeframe to publication is too lengthy, a digital copy will be provided.

$75 – Space painting.  That’s what I call it anyway.  Original, poster size spray paint art.  Color scheme of your choice.


$150 – Pencil sketch.  Portrait or most anything else you cold want.  8 X 10


$300 – Drawing.  Either B&W or Color.  More detailed than the sketch.  8 X 10 or 11 X 14


$500 – Pyrography.  Burned into natural planks of wood.  Can also work on bone, such as an animal skull, etc.


All art will be done after the campaign is over, and in the order in which I received the contributions.  All perks will be fulfilled, but please remember that many hours will need to go into these works, so I ask for your patience. 

Thanks for reading this far.  I appreciate anything that you can give, and if you can't help monetarily, please help me by spreading the word.  Thank you!

story:
Who am I?

Hey there! My name is Mallory Everhart and I am a full time social worker, part time competitive performance poet , and recent college graduate. Put those three roles together and it tells you a bit about me: compassionate, outspoken, principled, and poor. I write and perform poetry about feminism, body politics, family, relationships, and death, dying, and Alzheimer's Disease. You can watch videos of me performing here and here.

On December 19th, I competed in the Hear, Here! (a recognized slam venue in Colorado Springs) WOWPS qualifying poetry slam in Colorado Springs, CO and won, which is pretty freakin’ cool.

What is WOWPS?

WOWPS, or the Women of the World Poetry Slam, is an international indie slam poetry competition, focused on showcasing the voices of people living their lives as women. This four day poetry festival, taking place in Albuquerque, New Mexico, includes competition, workshops, keynote speakers, and open mics. It is a feminist celebration of women’s experience, women’s voices, and women’s talent. 72 women will simultaneously battle it out and build each other up over the weekend of March 18th-21st.

Where do you come in?

I would love the chance to spread my words around, meet some other awesome lady poets, learn from their craft, and have a great time in ABQ, but I can't do it on a social worker's salary. I've done the math and come up with what I need to get me there and tend to all my pesky biological needs.

  • For $150, I can bribe my Pontiac Sunfire to drive to and from Albuquerque.
  • At $450, I won’t have to sleep in the aforementioned Pontiac.
  • If we get to $650, I can even eat while I’m in ABQ!

If we make it to the $650 mark and you still want to show me the love, I have included a few stretch goals that would support the next few steps of my journey as a poet.

  • $800 will fully fund my slot at the Women of the World Poetry Slam and help pay for the cost of printing Love, Loss, and Lots of Paperwork, a chap book that I am currently in the process of finalizing.
  • If we raise $1000, I can pay a graphic designer to help with a cover design and layout for Love, Loss, and Lots of Paperwork.
  • I’ll throw a publication launch party if we make it to $1500. I’ll even make my famous queso dip.
  • At $2000, I can get my chap book professionally edited and it’ll be even MORE legit.

Thank you so much for your support.If you'd like, stop by my  facebook page and say hi!

experience, women’s voices, and women’s talent. 72 women will simultaneously
battle it out and build each other up over the weekend of March 18th-21st.
  Where do you come in?
I would love the chance to spread
my words around, meet some other awesome lady poets, learn from their craft, and have
a great time in ABQ, but I can't do it on a social worker's salary. I've done the math and come up with what I need to get me there and tend to all my pesky biological needs. 


For $150, I
can bribe my Pontiac Sunfire to drive to and from Albuquerque.

At $450, I
won’t have to sleep in the aforementioned Pontiac.

If we get to
$650, I can even eat while I’m in ABQ!

If we make it to the $650 mark and you still want to show me the love, I have included a few stretch goals that would support the next few steps of my journey as a poet.


$800 will
fully fund my slot at the Women of the World Poetry Slam and help pay for the
cost of printing Love, Loss, and Lots of Paperwork, a chap book that I am currently in the process of finalizing.

If we raise
$1000, I can pay a graphic designer to help with a cover design and layout for
Love, Loss, and Lots of Paperwork.

I’ll throw a
publication launch party if we make it to $1500. I’ll even make my famous queso
dip.


At $2000, I
can get my chap book professionally edited and it’ll be even MORE legit.



Thank you so much for your support.If you'd like, stop by my  facebook page and say hi!

story:
Invest in People Becoming Bitter Free! 

I invite you to take this opportunity to invest in a very important book project, designed to set people free from the clutches of bitterness in their life. 

In this book, people will be instructed on how to walk free in the following areas: 

  • How to get bitter areas out of their heart and life. 
  • Learn to overcome anger battles. 
  • See how conflict can be a way for relationships to become strengthened, not destroyed. 
  • How to forgive absolutely anyone, no matter how badly they hurt you. 

With great insight combined with simple and practical application, those who read this book and apply it will be changed forever!

What this Project Will Fund

As  contributor to this project, the funds will go towards (in the following priority order):

  • The costs towards design and production of the printed book. 
  • Getting the first inventory of 100-200 books ready for sale. 
  • Funds to market the book on media outlets and social platforms. 
  • Audio/video equipment that will help us develop upcoming video projects; on the street interviews and remote video shoots. 
  • Computer and software upgrading to produce quality audio and video teachings. 

Contribution Bonuses: 

For those who donate a certain amount for this project, the following bonuses are included: 

  • $50: pdf copy of the book
  • $75: Signed copy of the Book
  • $150: Signed copy of the Book and Freedom From Bitterness Teaching Series on MP3
  • $250: Signed copy of the Book and Freedom from Bitterness Teaching Series on CD
  • $500: Signed copy of the Book, Freedom from Bitterness Teaching Series and Year Year Membership to Turning Hearts Ministries partnership site, with weekly teachings and partner only resources. 

The Impact

I believe this book project will not only get the word out for people to become more free in their thoughts, health and relationships, but will also open the door for more resources projects in the future that will change people's lives. 

Participating Organizations:

  • Turning Hearts Ministries www.TurningHeartsMinistries.org
  • Transformed You www.MarkDeJesus.com

story:
LUMINA’s mission is to provide a journal where emerging and established writers and visual artists come together in exploration of the new and appreciation of the traditional. We want to see sonnets sharing space with experimental prose; we want art that pushes boundaries and bends rules with eloquence.

LUMINA, established in 2000, is the annual print publication of the Sarah Lawrence College graduate writing program. The journal is run entirely by graduate student volunteers who are committed to giving proper consideration to each unsolicited entry and publishing new artists and writers alongside their established counterparts.

Every year, Lumina is greeted by a new editorial staff; as a result we are not tied to any style or subject matter. Instead, we seek the new, exciting and rule-breaking work from writers both established and emerging.

This year Lumina is excited to be working with The Sarahs, which celebrates the best audio fiction currently being made around the world.

LUX uses technology to re-imagine the relationship between written and spoken word, visual art, and the traditionally bound journal.

LUX combines print media with the expanding world of technology. The concept is interactive. Essentially when you open LUX, you will find poems, short stories, photographs, and drawings, as you might in any journal—but then using the app LAYAR on any smart device, you can scan the image or words on the page and it will link you to an online piece—whether it be an audio recording of the author reading the piece, a youtube video, a short film, a song, or a podcast; the list goes on!

WHAT HAVE WE BEEN UP TO?

A lot has been happening on the LUX lines over the past few months. We are now collaborating with , The Sarah Awards is an initiative of Sarah Lawrence College started by writing professor Ann Heppermann.an audio fiction award started by Sarah Lawrence Professor and radio/multimedia documentary producer, Ann Heppermann. Also known as the “red carpet” for audio fiction, The Sarahs seeks to expand the concept of narrative fiction made for the ear. Our relationship with The Sarahs has given us an opportunity to include more radio drama (for the 21st century) in our third edition of LUX. We will choose various submissions from the “Very, Very, Short, Short Stories Contest” to feature in the upcoming issue.


GOAL: HELP US BRING LUX TO A LARGER AUDIENCE

LUX Volume III will continue to push the boundaries that don’t exist. To do so, we need your help… We are hoping to raise $3,000.00. With these funds we will be able to publish MORE and reach a wider audience. The money will go towards production, as well as material costs, printing, and design. Last year, through our campaign, we were able to improve the quality of LUX by including more color, and expanding the visual arts technology and spread of artistic content. This year, with your donation, we will be able to keep LUX colorful, and far-reaching in space—both physical and cyber. With more resources available, we can advance our vision of LUX as a cutting-edge journal that combines mediums and gives artists the ability to translate roles and expand upon their own creations. With your support, we hope to increase our number of annual submissions, as well as compensate both new and established artists for their contribution to the journal. We appreciate any support to help us go even further.

story:
We want to write a book! In fact, we've begun the process of writing and designing, but in order to complete the project we need your help. (To view more details about the project, including a full book description, chapter breakdown, and introduction, download the PDF proposal.)

Our goal is to look at the many facets of Christian theology - and especially the gospel of Jesus the Liberating King - through the lens of the Showtime series Dexter. Dexter's story is rich with parallels and illustrations of just what the gospel means and, more specifically, just what it means for people like us in a changing 21st century world. 


Our plan is to continue writing and designing, and then launch the book on January 15, 2012. (Note: the video says "November" but we've moved the date forward due to the publishing schedule.) The exciting news is that we are partnering with a publisher that shares our vision for connecting theology and culture: Gray Matter Books. Gray Matter is helping us with some funding up front, but we still need $1,000 to complete the writing and design.


So if you share this same passion - for deep theology and great art/entertainment like Dexter - or if you are just a bit curious and want to see more, we hope you will check out our project and donate whatever you can!


Thanks so much!


- the GA2D team


P.S. We are excited to announce that popular author and church leader Chris Seay has agreed to write the Foreword and is enthusiastically helping us to promote the project. So pumped! 


P.S.S. ALL of the donations to this project are tax-deductible thanks to our sponsoring organization, Dwell!!! Just send us a request and we'll send you a tax receipt via email!

Rewards:

We know that some of you guys were supporters of this project over at Kickstarter. Unfortunately, we had to end that project due to a lack of funding. Our funding needs have lessened thanks to Gray Matter Books, and we have a simplified plan for donor Rewards.

Here it is: If you donate $50 or more, you get a Gospel According to Dexter e-book! And if you donate $500 or more, you get the e-book plus a printed copy of the book signed by Zach Hoag and Chris Seay! Finally, if you donate $1,000, you get the e-book, a signed printed copy, AND a limited poster print of chapter art from the book!

Remember - it's OK if we raise more than the $1,000 goal, so please donate to your heart's content! Anything exceeding the goal will go to good use in producing more extras for the project (art and collateral), or go to future projects from our team.

THANK YOU!

story:
Cookies In Cupcakes - Ready to Come Out of the Oven!

Starting as a short film screenplay, COOKIES IN CUPCAKES, was such a huge hit with several key industry players, that I developed it into a full length feature film. It was recently submitted to the Oscars' Nicholl Fellowships in Screenwriting Contest, and there are many other contests coming up that will provide much needed exposure. I am asking for donations to get this delicious screenplay into a few key contests as well as into the hands of excited producers and directors so that it might become a reality.  

 

How Can You Help? - Yes, Money Helps..

As deadlines approach, I would love to reach my goal by mid-July, during Network hiatus, so I can do a mass marketing approach, giving everyone a fair chance to option this script. The amount you can donate is not an issue as any support is kindly appreciated. If you would like to find out other ways to help me with this project, please email me. I am currently using my own savings to fund the project and it has taken off beautifully. I have a reputable cupcake company on-board helping with local promotions (to deliver actual Cookies In Cupcakes with the script locally). Large supporters will also receive a delicious gift and all donors will receive mention on www.cookiesincupcakes.com. I strongly believe in creativity and enthusiasm and I am very eager to see this project take off! Based on all the great feedback, and with your support, I am sure COOKIES IN CUPCAKES will soon be a delicious reality. 

Other Ways You Can Help - It's not always about the dough

Please visit www.cookiesincupcakes.com and "LIKE" our facebook page. If you work in an agency, or know anyone that would like to option/purchase a wonderfully written, fun-filled Romantic Comedy screenplay, pass this along. And if there is anything I can do to help you out...let me know. Helping each other is what it is all about.

Big Hugs, Ward

story:
Who:

Investigative Reporting Denmark - a center for investigative reporting, located in Denmark and member of The Global Investigative Journalism Network.

Bruno Ingemann is managing editor at the center.

Nils Mulvad is project leader of journalistic investigations. 

A lot of other well-respected investigative reporters are involved in the center. We all have many connections outside Denmark. See more about the center here.

What:

Money for six months of investigations and spreading of the findings. We will in this period then focus on agribusiness with stories on pesticides, MRSA and climate change.

Why:

We failed in getting a big fund. We need money now for the next half year to continue to produce and publish investigative stories on our website. We count on other funding thereafter.

Our goal:

We will work cross-border on investigations. Sometimes another center will coordinate, sometimes we will do coordination.

We will gather information using traditionel methods and from new sources as data and social media.

We will publish our stories for free on the web and for mobile platforms.

Our first story: "GMO lose Europe – victory for environmental organisations"

Former minister of Agriculture, Eva Kjer Hansen, predicts in 2009 a great future for GMO corn in Denmark. Four years later the trials went wrong, data are kept secret and Monsanto has decided to withdraw GMO development and sales in most of Europe.

What happens if you don’t get the 5.000 Euro:

We will try to figure out another way to continue. We don’t have the answer yet.

What happens if you get more:

We will then speed up the process. And we will do more investigations. We are especially working on projects to coordinate investigations in climate change and environment with good journalists in centres in other countries. We also prepare projects in health and on whistleblowers.

Why a center for investigative reporting: 

It is very hard, if not impossible, for individual journalists to do revealing stories. Typically, you are up against massive departments of communications staff and political and economic pressure, so you need an organization to back you up, to give you the power nobody has on their own. 

Why a Danish Centre for Investigative Reporting:

Every country needs a centre. Some countries need more than one, for instance US. Investigative journalism is declining in the old media. We really need a network of centres round the world to do more cross-border investigative journalism and documentation on important stories – and to develop new methods and ways to spread the information. Some media do some, but the need is huge – and growing.

See also this background description of our view on the situation in Europe.

What stories will you investigate:

We focus very much on environment and climate change. Here there is a special need for cross-border investigations. It’s part of a blind spot for traditional media. We will also investigate other important areas such as health, organised crime, corruption, sport - often in cooperation with other centres or traditional media.

How can I follow the funding campaign and what happens:

Fill out the form as a support member. Hopefully you also then contribute, but you can also just sign up as a support member and then get a newsletter. Through our newsletter we will share the status of the campaign. You can also just go to this website on the campaign. We’ll always have the all the latest there.

How do you cover stories:

The purpose is not to build a fully working news service in investigative journalism or on the specific topics, that we investigate. We publish when we have something to contribute. And then we link to stories from our collaborators.

Can we help in other than financial ways:

Yes, sign up as a support-member, and get a newsletter, help spread the word on our need for donations, spread our stories, come with tips and story ideas. We also especially need help from a web designer.

How do I get involved:

We aren’t hiring right now. We don’t have money for that. The investigations that we are doing are also quite limited at the moment. But if you think you can help us out, please send an email.

Have another question:

Just email us, and we'll try to answer. We might also share the question and answer here later.

story:
¿Qué?

Descalza entre cristales rotos de espejo es la crónica de la pesadilla que tuvieron que sufrir cientos de miles de mujeres entre 1966 y 1989 durante la dictadura de Ceaușescu.

Durante la época comunista de Rumania, Liana, madre de dos niños y profesora que vive en un barrio de una gran ciudad rumana, se da cuenta que no tiene medios para criar un tercer niño. Por lo tanto, cuando se queda embarazada, decide someterse a un aborto. Pero según las leyes rumanas, en esta época, los abortos estaban prohibidos y penados con prisión tanto para las mujeres como para los médicos que se hubieran atrevido a practicarlos. Por lo tanto, Liana acude a medios empíricos, siguiendo consejos de mujeres mayores y, de esta manera, acaba en el hospital.

Asistimos a una serie entera de eventos en los cuales, la distancia entre agonía y éxtasis adquiere la dimensión de un gesto de valentía.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Lili Craciun.

Nací el 2 de marzo de 1958 en la localidad Pancesti de la provincia de Bacau. Siete años más tarde mi familia cambió de domicilio a la localidad Falticeni, provincia Suceava, el lugar de nacimiento de mi madre y donde pasé los años de la infancia y de la adolescencia. Entre los años 1973-1978 fui alumna de magisterio en Suceava, ciudad capital de la provincia. Después de acabar los cursos de magisterio fui maestra dos años en la localidad Rasca, provincia Suceava y después me trasladé a Iasi, como consecuencia de la admisión en la Facultad. Por lo tanto, entre 1980-1984, fui estudiante en la facultad de Filosofía-Historia que acabé en 1984 con el tesis de licencia que tenía el tema: La ontología del humano en la filosofía del absurdo. En 1988 fui admitida en la Facultad de Derecho (de la Universidad “Al. i. Cuza” de Iasi), facultad que acabé en el año 1993 con la tesis: Consideraciones psicológicas en la encuesta del infractor menor.

Desde 1984 hasta 1994 fui profesora de Historia. Después de acabar la Facultad de Derecho trabajé como jurista en la Dirección de las Aduanas, Dirección Financiera Iasi o en otras empresas privadas de Iasi. Cambié luego de domicilio (en 2001) a Bucarest donde trabajé en la Dirección de las Aguas, luego, a partir de 2003 hasta 2016, como notario público. Desde 2016 cambié de domicilio definitivamente a Oradea.

Escribo desde siempre, pero publiqué tarde, apenas en 2015. El miedo a hacer el ridículo, el miedo a no ser capaz de llamar la atención, la familia, los niños, todo contribuyó un poco a que mi debut fuera tan tardío. En el colegio escribía siempre en la revista literaria, luego en la facultad colaboré en la Sección de cultura del  diario La llama de Iasi. Después de la facultad, durante un tiempo escribí solo para mí. Luego, a medida que Internet cobró más fuerza e influencia, empecé a animarme y a escribir cuentecitos en mi blog personal La justicia ciega. Más tarde, algunos de ellos han aparecido en revistas o periódicos.

En el año 2015 debuté con la novela testimonio El viaje (que tiene el titulo definitivo en la segunda edición  Descalza entre cristales rotos del espejo-El viaje) el drama de una mujer que se queda embarazada en los últimos años de la época comunista y elige un método empírico para acabar con el embarazo indeseado. Balanceando entre muerte y prisión, la heroína vive en un laberinto de donde parece que no tiene escapatoria. La novela ha sido muy bien recibida por el público y por la crítica, llegando a agotar la segunda edición en lengua rumana. También entró en el punto de mira de un guionista de USA con el cual firmé un contrato para una película y un espectáculo de teatro. 

En el año 2016, abril, publiqué un libro de prosa corta Las cuidadoras de mi suegra, que comprende trece cuentos: retratos de los aspectos de la vida de trece mujeres a las que el destino las obligan a llegar a ser cuidadoras. La primera edición se agotó en solo dos meses.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Descalza entre cristales rotos de espejo que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Lili Craciun vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

¿Qué?
Descalza entre cristales rotos de espejo es la crónica de la pesadilla que tuvieron que sufrir cientos de miles de mujeres entre 1966 y 1989 durante la dictadura de Ceaușescu.
Durante la época comunista de Rumania, Liana, madre de dos niños y profesora que vive en un barrio de una gran ciudad rumana, se da cuenta que no tiene medios para criar un tercer niño. Por lo tanto, cuando se queda embarazada, decide someterse a un aborto. Pero según las leyes rumanas, en esta época, los abortos estaban prohibidos y penados con prisión tanto para las mujeres como para los médicos que se hubieran atrevido a practicarlos. Por lo tanto, Liana acude a medios empíricos, siguiendo consejos de mujeres mayores y, de esta manera, acaba en el hospital.
Asistimos a una serie entera de eventos en los cuales, la distancia entre agonía y éxtasis adquiere la dimensión de un gesto de valentía.
¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.
De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy se nos presenta Lili Craciun.
Nací el 2 de marzo de 1958 en la localidad Pancesti de la provincia de Bacau. Siete años más tarde mi familia cambió de domicilio a la localidad Falticeni, provincia Suceava, el lugar de nacimiento de mi madre y donde pasé los años de la infancia y de la adolescencia. Entre los años 1973-1978 fui alumna de magisterio en Suceava, ciudad capital de la provincia. Después de acabar los cursos de magisterio fui maestra dos años en la localidad Rasca, provincia Suceava y después me trasladé a Iasi, como consecuencia de la admisión en la Facultad. Por lo tanto, entre 1980-1984, fui estudiante en la facultad de Filosofía-Historia que acabé en 1984 con el tesis de licencia que tenía el tema: La ontología del humano en la filosofía del absurdo. En 1988 fui admitida en la Facultad de Derecho (de la Universidad “Al. i. Cuza” de Iasi), facultad que acabé en el año 1993 con la tesis: Consideraciones psicológicas en la encuesta del infractor menor.
Desde 1984 hasta 1994 fui profesora de Historia. Después de acabar la Facultad de Derecho trabajé como jurista en la Dirección de las Aduanas, Dirección Financiera Iasi o en otras empresas privadas de Iasi. Cambié luego de domicilio (en 2001) a Bucarest donde trabajé en la Dirección de las Aguas, luego, a partir de 2003 hasta 2016, como notario público. Desde 2016 cambié de domicilio definitivamente a Oradea.
Escribo desde siempre, pero publiqué tarde, apenas en 2015. El miedo a hacer el ridículo, el miedo a no ser capaz de llamar la atención, la familia, los niños, todo contribuyó un poco a que mi debut fuera tan tardío. story:
What is Symbolism?

Theory of Thought is a unique body of work that focuses on illustrating the structure of thought itself. It hypothesizes that thoughts are special types of structures in the Universe that partly exist within a greater, hyper-dimensional space.

What does this mean exactly? Imagine a meta-world of abstract objects which exists in direct proportion to our natural, material world. Regardless of whether we are in control of these hidden structures using physical or spiritual mechanisms, thought theory posits that the probability of events happening here is a function of events happening within this greater space.

Theory of Thought introduces a geometric framework called mindspace that helps reveal a hidden universe where ideas collide and movements are born.

I've spent the last 8 years exploring this theory, and I'd like to spend another 8 keeping it grow. Cheers!


Download A Free Ebook

I've written a 264-page book about my ideas and I'm giving it away for free, because I want you to meaningfully grasp what I'm talking about. 

Here it is for free:

Download Theory of Thought: Symbolism for iPad 
Download the PDF Versions for any device


Donations are Welcomed

I need thought theory fans to come through and help me finance this project, especially if you enjoyed the book. Creating images, videos, and websites is quite costly, and I have access to few public or private resources to help expand my work.

With some funding, I can envision Theory of Thought going in a few directions:

  • Launch the 3rd Edition in Spring of 2015 . This won't be easy, because I'm making lots of enhancements and changes. I'll be removing most of the physics chapter for example, but replacing it with more geometry. Maybe I'll create a few more video clips too. It'll get way better, trust me!
  • Spend more time writing blog articles - I have dozens of drafts of fantastic blog articles, but I just don't have the time to finish any of them because I have to work a day job for a living.
  • Make better videos. I would like to film short Q&A segments that explain thought theory clearly. Similar to Brian Greene's Science-U videos.


Help Put Theory of Thought in Bookstores

Finding a publisher isn't easy, and part of the funding will go towards solving this problem. Without a major publisher, getting distribution into major bookstores isn't easy. I have distribution at Indigo, but if you would like to see Theory of Thought in a store near you, please donate or ask a local bookstore manager to order a few paperback copies. That simple request goes a long way in convincing stores to stock a few copies.

Read Theory of Thought: Symbolism 2nd Edition for FREE:

Download Theory of Thought: Symbolism for iPad 
Download the PDF Versions for any device

story:
Our Book Project

We are launching an illustrated children's book to help parents and educators talk to kids about child sexual abuse prevention. What started as a simple rhyming story for kids has evolved to important conversations with parents and educators around ‘stranger danger’ and speaking up when one feels uncomfortable and threatened.

If you’re the type of person who believes in the importance of child abuse prevention but feels overwhelmed by the gravity and sensitivity of the topic, we hope that you’ll consider supporting our project!

 

 

In this memorable children’s tale, we learn of three friends – Monkey, Toucan, and Frog – who want to play in the jungle in peace. But there’s one thing in their way: the ominous Mr. Snake, who makes them feel uncomfortable as they go about their day. This story imparts a valuable lesson that young readers can take forward into their daily lives: if something feels off, it’s important to address the issue before it escalates.

 

About us

Ivy Verdin, Author

Based in Irvine, California USA

Ivy has a passion for writing children’s books.  She works as a senior program/project manager.  She’s a proud mom who enjoys traveling, practicing yoga, and spending quality time with the people she loves.

 

Stian Thomassen, Illustrator

Based in Mandal, Norway

Stian is a proud husband and father of two.  He loves to draw and has been drawing since he was a kid.  He's a big fan of old hand-drawn movies and tv-series. He has a degree in “Multimedia, Technology and Design” and works as a graphic designer.  Stian is passionate about simplicity, technology and efficiency. In his free time, Stian enjoys going on mountain hikes.

 

Sharon Paras, Creative Director

Based in Los Angeles, California USA

Sharon has a degree in Communication Arts from Otis College of Art & Design. She currently works as a Lead UX/UI Designer for a global entertainment company. With 15+ years of experience in product design, digital marketing, and advertising, she is enjoying all aspects of her work. Between projects, Sharon can be found at art & music events, practicing yoga, cooking, and hiking with her dog Homer. 

 

Why we do our work

We were alarmed by the staggering statistics on child sexual abuse and we want to do our part to help prevent victimization.

The Crimes Against Children Research Center reports...

  • 3 out of 4 adolescents who have been sexually assaulted were victimized by someone they knew well.
  • 1 in 5 girls and 1 in 20 boys is a victim of child sexual abuse.

 

 

Here are three reasons we think you might want to support our project:

  • You’ll be helping create a beautiful picture book and inspiring educational resource for kids age 3 through 8.
  • Beyond what’s needed to produce and ship our book to you, a portion of your contributions will go towards supporting non-profits addressing child sexual abuse.
  • You’ll get your very own copy of the book to share with family and friends!

 

 

 

 

 

Why would we launch an IndieGoGo campaign during a global pandemic?

We created Creepy Mr. Snake – A Jungle’s Tale to teach kids about awareness and setting boundaries and this message is as relevant now (in the midst of a pandemic) as it was and will be in the future.

 

How will our IndieGoGo funds be used?

Raising $10,000 will allow us to print and ship 1,000 books.  A print run of 1,000 books is technically small by publishing standards, but it’s the mark where the cost starts to go down significantly.

At $10,000 raised, our cost breakdown will be as follows:

And that's all there is to it.

 

Thank you for giving what you can

Your contribution at any level is deeply appreciated, and if backing our project financially during this time doesn’t feel possible, please feel free to forward this campaign to others who might be able to support this project.

story:
Note on Pre-sell: 

Receive $100 to spend on Shaffali Skincare as well as  everything listed under 'Become a Beta Reader' for $89 purchase/contribution.

Receive 50% discount credit on Shaffali.com for purchase/contributions above $100.

Story of My Book

I am Shaffali, the author of What Lights You Up? A Mind, Body, Soul Approach to Connecting with your Passions.

I wrote this book because I love to see people LIGHT UP. I love to see that special energy, often seen in the eye, and felt in the air, around a person who connects to something s/he is passionate about and inspired by. 

During a journey of finding alignment in mind, body, soul in my own life -  a continual journey of growth and transformation - I discovered key practices that helped me connect strongly with things that light me up.  I share these practices in this book and take you on this amazing journey.

The stories, experiences and ultimately the discoveries shared in the book emanate from exploring the phenomenon of the 'should life'— an often insidious voice in our head, planted by social, cultural, and familial conditioning that is not necessarily from the deepest depths of our souls - a life that limits us and cuts us off from connecting to our LIGHT. This 'should life' often leads people, myself included, into a life of conformity without ever questioning how we ended up in someone else's desired life or  the a dullness, restlessness and general unhappiness that may pervade in our own lives.

I know from first hand experience what falling into the "should life" feels and look like. In this book I share with you struggles from my own life, with examples both personal and professional,  in love, relationships, and business, sometimes in an entertaining lighthearted way, and sometimes in a way that may make you shed a tear or two. In doing this, I guide you on a modern day spiritual journey of sorts and provide you with tools that I found on my path for finding harmony in mind, body and soul, and to help connect you with your passions.

My hope is that on this journey, you too will discover ways to make your life more vibrant, inspired, and motivated and ultimately a higher consciousness that connects you with your highest truths and most authentic self. In the end, my wish is for you to find  love, abundance and the ability to identify and manifest what you desire.

In this book, you will learn about concepts from Eastern Mysticism and Transformation. I will walk you through the major energy centres in our body, known as chakras, which will set the groundwork for thriving in mind, body, and soul.

You will love this book if you are eager to grow, change, and develop, using approaches to Eastern philosophy and mysticism. You will also like this book if you appreciate a bit of lighthearted wit and humor, alongside thoughtfulness on some serious life topics.

What Lights You Up is a non-fiction book that speaks to empaths, and in particular women, who are looking to explore their mind, body, and soul and discover the sources of their motivation and a life that is at the heart of  their desires.

About The Content - What Lights You Up?

The book is written in Two Parts;

Part One contains the introduction + 8 additional chapters.

This part is a spiritual memoir or sorts, including stories that come from my openness to life.

Part Two contains Chapters 9-16.

This part is a guide for how to live a “Light Life” which includes principles and exercises for you to create some practices and rituals around your own life. The principles are as follows: Spaciousness & Boundaries, Somatic Intelligence, Drishti, Devotion & Love, Truth, Vision and Light.

Funding

This book will be published with New Degree Press. The funds raised will go towards the following:

Revision and publication of the manuscript in July 2020

Cover Design - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

Interior Layout Design for both paper copy and Ebook

Copyediting 

Launch & Promotion Efforts during summer of 2020


To publish, I need to pre-sell 100 copies of What Lights You Up, with audio and hard copy editions following subsequent sales.

About the Author
Shaffali Miglani is known for her spiritually luxurious products and experiences. For two decades Shaffali has guided people to look and feel beautiful through her two companies: Shaffali Skincare and Shaffali Yoga + Wellness, both rooted in Eastern Wisdom.  She deeply believes her mission is to spread love, light, and beauty.

Shaffali holds a BSBA in Entrepreneurship from Boston University’s Questrom School of Management. She is a healer, yoga and meditation teacher, as well as a licensed esthetician.

"I wrote this book because I think some of us need tools and guidance to really connect to our deepest desires. I have been lucky to achieve that through a long journey. I know for sure that I would have appreciated this guide before going through the dramas I experienced in my younger years! Nonetheless, I am so grateful for all the wonderful friends, mentors, guides, healers,  coaches, as well as the music that came my way to help me solidify tools and techniques into a comprehensive guide."

For more information you can connect with Shaffali at shaffalim@gmail.com and @shaffali.

My Commitment to you

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book, specifically the mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

Working closely with New Degree Press we will make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you and keep you informed of key milestone and  the dates that pre-ordered books are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially, you can:

Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #WhatLightsYouUp and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

Share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

With sincere thanks and gratitude for your love and support!

Thanks again,

 

Love, Light & Namaste,
Shaffali

story:
The Story Creation

Hector and the Virus Vector is about Santa Claus cancelling Christmas because a novel virus is making people sick around the world. An elf named Hector tries to find a solution using science experiments tested on Santa Claus. Through his innovations, will Hector be able to save Christmas?

I am running this Indiegogo campaign because I want this story told to children. I want children to believe that Christmas can still be special, even though Covid-19 has changed many aspects of their lives. The campaign allows me to sell copies of the book and get the word out to new people. So please tell all your friends and family.

Calgary and Edmonton

Please Contact me for free-shipping codes for Calgary and Edmonton. Several Perks are listed already with free shipping to these areas. Please only use the free-shipping for the Calgary and Edmonton areas!!

Donations

I wanted to donate copies of my book to children in need this Christmas. Unfortunately due to Covid-19 concerns, many places are not accepting physical gifts at this time. Instead...

I am donating a portion of the profits to The Alberta Children's Hospital!

 

Illustration Examples

Here are a few of the illustrations that will be in the book. To see more, check out my Instagram feed @rainbow_ink_designs

 

Goals and Gifts

My goal for the campaign is to reach $3500.  Most of the funding will go towards the cost of printing the books and the other perk items. Any profit will be put into marketing and selling copies to local stores. I also will use some of the money to develop Rainbow Ink Designs into a business, with the potential of becoming a full-time author/illustrator. Since I’m illustrating the book myself, I do not have to pay an illustrator for my images.

Perks:

Hector and the Virus Vector – The main reason you are here! The book is a beautiful hardcover that is 8in x 8in. With 19 glorious illustrations, on 21 pages, and 500 words of rhyming story, this book is sure to make you smile.

 

Christmas Tree-Rex T-shirt – Get the Tree-rex t-shirt that Santa is wearing in the book. It comes in Small, Medium, Large, X-Large and 2XL. Please contact me if you need kid or other sizes.

 

Pathogen Stickers – Hand sketched viruses and bacteria that have been turned into stickers. each sticker is approximately 3in x 3in. Covid-19, Ebola, HIV, H1N1 (The Spanish Flu), Smallpox and Yersinia pestis (Bubonic Plague). Feel free to buy them for yourself, or give to a friend or family member!

Colouring Book Pages – I will include a PDF with one or more printable pages for colouring.

 

You In The Book- For three lucky individuals I am going to sketch you (or your child? Spouse? Mother?) as an Elf! I will include the elf image in the Santa’s Workshop scene. I will also mail you the original sketch. The drawing will be approximately 8in x 8in and will be black and white inked. This Perk is only available for the first five days of the campaign!

If my goal is not met, I will still be printing and sending out all the books and perks. I will just make less profit to market the book and develop Rainbow Ink Designs.

 

Timeline

Mid November- Printing submitted as soon as the campaign ends

December- Mailed out the first week of December

 

The Impact

The more people that are able to contribute to this campaign, the more children who will be able to see and read the book. I want it to reach as many children as possible, to reassure children that Christmas will not be cancelled this year.

 

Shipping

Since I am a sole proprietorship, I do not have bulk shipping options available. This results in a higher cost for shipping than you are probably used to seeing from bigger businesses. I have created a small business account with Canada Post and will be shipping through Canada Post.

Contact:

rainbow.ink.designs@gmail.com

@rainbow_ink_designs (for Instagram)

www.rainbowinkdesigns.com

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk with this campaign is the uncertainties that Covid-19 causes. I have received several quotes from different printing companies that allow for the timeline I have laid out. But Covid-19 brings unexpected events and I cannot guarantee that there are not unforeseeable predicaments.

As well Canada Post usually has a guarantee arrive by Christmas shipping date but this year they are already warning people to get parcels out early due to Covid-19 concerns.

I plan on getting the books printed as soon as the campaign ends and shipping as soon as I have the books. This will hopefully prevent any shipping delays from occurring.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute, there are other ways you can help!

  • Post about the campaign on your social media: tag @rainbow_ink_designs on Instagram.
  • Tell your friends, family and neighbours!
  • There are also Indiegogo share tools that you can use.

If you cannot afford a book, but want a copy, please contact me directly

 

 

Disclaimer: Please check with your local tax office for any duty/sales tax due on imported books. We cannot be held responsible for any fees they may charge you.

story:
Have you ever wondered:

  • How "FREE" apps make money?
  • What does it take to build a great mobile app?
  • Why only 1 out of 10,000 apps succeed while most others are uninstalled?
  • How app companies like Uber, Spotify, Tik tok, Duolingo, etc achieved success and entered our lexicon?

My name is Anuj Mahajan, and I am the author of The Billion Dollar App. I wanted to learn what it takes to make an app a billion-dollar success. Why do some mobile apps make the list of top 10 highest-grossing apps year after year? And why are most others uninstalled after a single use? I wrote this book because I wanted to share my research with you.

In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for mobile apps. And then, some. Ultimately, I want you to use this book as a tool to help you launch your own mobile app with sound business sense.

You'll learn the nine principles of user-centric monetization. These principles are based on my research of over 100 top mobile apps. This will help you understand how some of the most innovative mobile apps are monetized, how to get users to pay for your app, and how to keep them coming back for more.

My book is for business as well as tech enthusiasts who want to know how to create a successfully monetized mobile app.

The Billion Dollar App is a non-fiction book that speaks to everyone from tech enthusiasts to product managers and tech entrepreneurs who are looking at the mobile app space and app monetization principles for the first time.

 

The Book - The Billion Dollar App

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1. This section explores the need for and proposes a new user-focused way of monetization. You don’t want to make the same mistakes that many other app companies have made. Why? Because those companies don't exist anymore.

Part 2. This section dives deep into the nine principles of user-centric monetization. These principles have allowed the best mobile app companies to tap into their loyal user base. The same users that pay a premium for a great experience.

Part 3. This section takes readers a step further and analyzes case studies on some of the top-grossing apps: their stories of success, what makes them a great mobile app and how they succeeded at monetization.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go toward the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my book - the mockups you see currently are placeholders!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. When I publish, you will receive the following:

  • A personally signed copy of my book
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author


Anuj Mahajan is a product manager who has worked on successful mobile apps, including Marriott Bonvoy and OfferUp.

Anuj wanted to write a book that told the stories of the biggest successes and failures in the mobile app industry. Mobile apps have changed the way how we communicate, order groceries, do business and even date. And that's why he strongly believes that mobile apps are going to be one of the biggest areas of opportunity in this century.

When he is not geeking out on obscure mobile apps, he likes to work out and swim. He wants to legalize afternoon naps for everyone. Especially, workplace professionals.

For more information, you can connect with Anuj on LinkedIn at www.linkedin.com/in/anujpm/.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #BillionDollarApp and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page,

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Anuj Mahajan

story:
Here in the Yorkshire & Humber region we would like to give every voter the opportunity to vote for a Green Party MP. In order for us to stand candidates we need to raise a deposit1 of £500 for each one. As you can imagine, with 54 parliamentary seats in our region alone, this is quite a substantial sum for our party to raise.

You may be aware that the larger parties often take large donations from big business interests, but the Green Party are not funded in that way. Our campaigns are powered by party members and supporters like you.

Please help us support your local parliamentary candidate by giving what you can. With donations starting at just £1 we hope everyone can get involved. Please note: if you decide to donate more than £50 we will need to take some additional details2 from you before we can accept your kind offer of support.

Should we fail to raise the required £500 deposit for this constituency we would try to transfer funds from better funded areas. This will be a reciprocal arrangement so if this campaign is over funded our team will try to support as may other local candidates as possible. After funding deposits across the region, any remaining funds will be returned to the originating constituency, to support their campaigning efforts.

If you feel you are not able to contribute financially, you can still help by telling your friends and family, sharing our page (www.yorkshiregreen2015.com) on social media and following the campaign on Facebook and Twitter (links below) to stay up to date with progress. You can also volunteer to help the Green Party campaign by signing up here http://greenparty.org.uk/getinvolved/

Finally, of course, don’t forget that your vote counts on May 7th!

Many thanks for your helping in turning Yorkshire and Humber Green in 2015.

1Candidate deposits have been required since the 1985 general election

2For donations over £50 we are legally obligated to take a record of the donor's name and address and to also confirm the donor is on the UK electoral register.

Promoted by Bluebell Eikonoklastes on behalf of the Yorkshire and the Humber Region Green Party Parliamentary election candidate list both at Flat B, 77 Grange Avenue, Chapeltown, LEEDS, LS7 4EN.

story:
Story of My Book

How Healthcare Happens: Using AI and Machine Learning to Transform Healthcare. The book explores the ways in which AI tools are improving healthcare, as well as some of the legal and ethical challenges that lie ahead in this growing frontier. The concepts of AI and machine learning are explained, including examples of how different types of AI are applied to different healthcare problems. This book is an invitation to anyone interested in AI technology in the healthcare system. Readers will learn about the fundamental concepts of AI and machine learning and how these tools are being used to solve real problems in the healthcare system right now!

My name is Matthew Marcetich, and I am the author of How Healthcare Happens: Using AI and Machine Learning to Transform Healthcare. I wrote this book because I am interested in the ways AI is improving healthcare while also recognizing the ethical and legal challenges to applying AI to patient data. Note: this is just the working title - I expect the title to change.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover some surprising ways AI is changing healthcare. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion, excitement, and fascination that I have for AI and healthcare. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you better understand how some of the everyday healthcare you receive is influenced and impacted by AI tools.

In this book, you'll learn about AI applications to clinical medicine, research, and administration, and steps needed to develop healthcare AI tools. More specifically, the book describes:

  • Uses of AI in pharmaceutical development
  • Ways in which the definition of health data is changing
  • Administrative uses of AI are not so boring after all and provide significant opportunities
  • Inspiring career paths of entrepreneurs in the field

You will love this book if you are curious about AI and machine learning, their impacts on healthcare, and distinguishing between the two. How Healthcare Happens: Using AI and Machine Learning to Transform Healthcare is a non-fiction book that speaks to early adopters of AI in the healthcare industry. The undeniable reality is that AI applications in healthcare will affect everyone - from all walks of life - whether they are aware of it or not. Healthcare will always be a necessity, especially in older age, and the influence of AI on the healthcare industry is inevitable.

The Book - How Healthcare Happens: Using AI and Machine Learning to Transform Healthcare

The book is written in 3 parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction and chapters that will introduce you to AI concepts. You will learn a brief history of AI, some of the pathways to developing AI ideas within healthcare, and the difference between different branches AI.

Part 2 contains chapters specific to AI in healthcare. You will learn about moonshot ideas, but also practical examples of ways AI is implemented to address clinical, research, and administrative problems. You will learn about a Johns Hopkins researcher's work in computer vision in rural Senegal. You will also learn about ways that AI is helping hospitals determine which patients will actually show up for their appointments - an intervention that helps providers and patients alike.

Part 3 contains chapters that outline obstacles to implementing AI tools in healthcare. From a legal perspective, you will see how the definition of healthcare data is changing given the proliferation of digital tools that capture and analyze personal health data. You will also learn from researchers at Johns Hopkins and Google about some of the infrastructure needed to support development of AI in healthcare solutions.

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (paperback and ebook)
  • The Copy Editing for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch and Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Spring, 2020.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

And of course, if you decide to pre-order, you can purchase multiple copies! :) Maybe there is a colleague, friend, classmate, or cousin who would enjoy the book.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • And for some tiers, the opportunity to attend my Launch Party (perfect opportunity to visit DC in the Spring)
  • And more...

About the Author


Matthew Marcetich, MPH is currently an Associate Manager in the Applied Intelligence group at Accenture Federal Services and was previously Team Lead at a boutique AI consulting company, SoKat. Matthew gained formative experience in medical research at Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine and the Medical College of Wisconsin. He holds a Master of Public Health from Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health, which includes a Certificate of Public Health Informatics. He lives in Washington, DC, and loves to golf when he’s not thinking about AI or healthcare.

From the author:
I wrote this book because I have always been a science, math, and tech “nerd” since a young age, and I now see impressive opportunities at the intersection of AI and healthcare. Applying AI to healthcare needs to be navigated intentionally, and with good understanding of the underlying technology. I entered the field of AI in a somewhat circuitous and self-taught way, and I hope my book will give the reader a fundamental understanding of AI concepts.

Since my background is not computer science, there are many people out there who are more skilled at programming than myself (although I still maintain my annual DataCamp subscription!). I tip my hat in admiration to the talented physicians, scientists, and programmers whose efforts serve as the subject matter of my book and as a continuous source of personal inspiration.

You can connect with me at matthewmarcetich@gmail.com and on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/matthewmarcetich/.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Consider using #HealthcareAI and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Some ideas: call/test an old college friend, or using the book as an excuse to talk to that doctor/scientist/hacker next door/classmate/neighbor/cousin who might be interested!

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Matt

Story of My BookHow Healthcare Happens: Using AI and Machine Learning to Transform Healthcare. The book explores the ways in which AI tools are improving healthcare, as well as some of the legal and ethical challenges that lie ahead in this growing frontier. The concepts of AI and machine learning are explained, including examples of how different types of AI are applied to different healthcare problems. This book is an invitation to anyone interested in AI technology in the healthcare system. Readers will learn about the fundamental concepts of AI and machine learning and how these tools are being used to solve real problems in the healthcare system right now!My name is Matthew Marcetich, and I am the author of How Healthcare Happens: Using AI and Machine Learning to Transform Healthcare. I wrote this book because I am interested in the ways AI is improving healthcare while also recognizing the ethical and legal challenges to applying AI to patient data. Note: this is just the working title - I expect the title to change.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover some surprising ways AI is changing healthcare. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion, excitement, and fascination that I have for AI and healthcare. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you better understand how some of the everyday healthcare you receive is influenced and impacted by AI tools.In this book, you'll learn about AI applications to clinical medicine, research, and administration, and steps needed to develop healthcare AI tools. More specifically, the book describes:
Uses of AI in pharmaceutical development
Ways in which the definition of health data is changing
Administrative uses of AI are not so boring after all and provide significant opportunities
Inspiring career paths of entrepreneurs in the field
You will love this book if you are curious about AI and machine learning, their impacts on healthcare, and distinguishing between the two. How Healthcare Happens: Using AI and Machine Learning to Transform Healthcare is a non-fiction book that speaks to early adopters of AI in the healthcare industry. The undeniable reality is that AI applications in healthcare will affect everyone - from all walks of life - whether they are aware of it or not. Healthcare will always be a necessity, especially in older age, and the influence of AI on the healthcare industry is inevitable.The Book - How Healthcare Happens: Using AI and Machine Learning to Transform Healthcare
The book is written in 3 parts....Part 1 contains the introduction and chapters that will introduce you to AI concepts. You will learn a brief history of AI, some of the pathways to developing AI ideas within healthcare, and the difference between different branches AI.Part 2 contains chapters specific to AI in healthcare. You will learn about moonshot ideas, but also practical examples of ways AI is implemented to address clinical, research, and administrative problems. You will learn about a Johns Hopkins researcher's work in computer vision in rural Senegal. You will also learn about ways that AI is helping hospitals determine which patients will actually show up for their appointments - an intervention that helps providers and patients alike.Part 3 contains chapters that outline obstacles to implementing AI tools in healthcare. From a legal perspective, you will see how the definition of healthcare data is changing given the proliferation of digital tools that capture and analyze personal health data. You will also learn from researchers at Johns Hopkins and Google about some of the infrastructure needed to support development of AI in healthcare solutions.What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. The Layout Design for the interior of my book (paperback and ebook)

The Launch and Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Spring, 2020.

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
